For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business which earns her a source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbors. In addition she also operates a kiosk shop that earn her another source of income. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 30,000 she wants to purchase chicken feeds and chicks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve his living standards

loans.use: to purchase chicken feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia  is 32 years old, married woman. She is been in the business of beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best providing services she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  That is why she has applied a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 54 years old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. 

Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 4 children. Currently, she requested a loan of 55000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta 9ª grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la siembra de  hortalizas, tiene 2 hijas menores de edad que ya van a la escuela, también con ella vive un hermano con discapacidad especial. 
 


Ana se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, se ha dedicado  al trabajo de campo desde que tenia 16 años, aprendió porque sus padres eran agricultores, además tiene una pequeña tienda de jugos, sodas y golosinas. El lugar donde cultiva está a 3 kilómetros  de su casa y viaja a pie, su esposo es quien le ayuda en las actividades que realiza y madrugan para comenzar las labores.


Ella solicita este crédito para comprar 12 sacos de fertilizantes y preparará la tierra donde va a sembrar.


El sueño de Ana es poder darle el estudió a sus hijas y con sus ahorros poder construir una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, 37 years old, studied through 9th grade. She is in a relationship and her life partner works farming vegetables. She has 2 daughters who are minors who are already in school. A brother of hers with disabilities lives with her as well. 

Ana works farming basic grains. She has worked in the field since she was 16 years old. She learned because her parents were farmers. Also, she has a small store that sells juice, soda, and candy.  The place where she farms is 3 km from her house and she travels there on foot. Her husband is the one who helps in the work she does and they get up early to start work. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase 12 sacks of fertilizer and prepare the soil where she is going to plant. 

Ana's dream is to be able to provide her daughters with an education and, with her savings, to be able to build a better house.

loans.use: purchase 12 sacks of fertilizer and prepare the soil where she is going to plant.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando de 42 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta séptimo grado ya que por la situación económica que vivía su familia en ese momento tuvo que empezar a trabajar, actualmente está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuido de sus hijos.

 Rolando tiene más de 20 años en la agricultura, cultiva maíz, maicillo y frijoles, además realiza crianza de cerdos y su esposa le ayuda con los diferentes trabajos.

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar insumos y preparar la tierra para la siembra de maíz.

Sus sueños son cultivar más el próximo año y comprar mas cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos a buen precio.
texts.en:
Rolando is 42 years old, and left education after the seventh grade since, given his family's financial situation, he had to start working. He is married and his wife looks after their home and brings up their children.

Rolando has worked in agriculture for over 20 years. He grows corn, sorghum and beans. He also raises pigs and his wife helps out with these various tasks.

He will use the loan to buy inputs and prepare the land to grown corn.

His dreams are to grow more next year and buy more pigs to fatten them up and sell them at a good price.

loans.use: to buy inputs and prepare the land to grow corn.

loans.name: Shahmim

texts.en:
Shahmim, 42 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Shahmim needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Jai Maa Ambe Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015 ten self-dependent women of Purunapada of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India, formed a group named Jai Maa Ambe. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social livelihood by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

Pramila is the most active and energetic lady of the concerned village and has taken the leadership to form a self-help group. This outstanding lady is aged about 30 years, standing in the first row second person from right with raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For the last 10 years, Pramila has been engaged in a grocery business with the help and support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of INR.8,500 from her occupation. The present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So Pramila decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business through a loan. 

She will purchase a huge quantity of grocery items such as wheat, oil, spices, rice, salt, sugar, soap, and related items from the nearest market. Through this, Pramila hopes to generate a handsome extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house.
 
The other nine members of the group are also engaged with different small businesses like packed snacks, pampad business, vegetable vending, tailoring, betel shop, milk selling, general store, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of grocery items such as wheat, oil, spices, rice, salt, sugar, soap, and related items

loans.name: Naeem

texts.en:
Naeem  is a hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a business selling bed sheets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers.  

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs. It will help her to inflate her sales. 

She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Denis is 44 years old, a resident of Manyama in Rakai district. He is married and has six children all attending school. 

Denis deals in the business of bark cloth trading, which he started in 2004 with the aim of improving on his daily income. Denis works six days a week and 12 hours per day. Bark cloth is used as a burial sheet among a certain tribe in Uganda, and its also used for making crafts. Denis sells bark cloth because this is a business he learned from his father and because the materials were there in the area and the market was guaranteed since the local people have respect for culture. 

He wants a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy more stock for his business so as to meet the demands of his customers. Denis’s major customers are the people from different areas, especially in Kampala, for burial activities. However, he faces challenges of inadequate capital and competition in the market.
His hope is to establish a nice looking shop in a busy centre like Kampala where his customers can find his products easily. 

Denis is an honest and hardworking gentleman who appreciates the services provided to him by lenders to lend him money when he needs it.

loans.use: To buy stock of bark cloth to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Claro

texts.es:
Claro, de 36 años de edad, es un agricultor, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos están en la escuela.

Claro, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 16 años, este trabajo se lo enseño su hermano mayor, cuando se casó le sirvió mucho todo lo que aprendió, ya que con eso mantiene a su familia, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo tiene que caminar 10 minutos y su horario es de 5:30 a.m. a 11:00 a.m.- Ahora Claro, ha comprado 50 pollos de engorde, lo cual  le genera ingresos adicionales, ya que cuando sale a trabajar su esposa los cuida.  

Claro, necesita el préstamo para comprar 5 sacos de abono y pesticidas para matar la hierba mala, porque le afecta a los cultivos, también pagará el alquiler de 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, con esto va a mejorar mucho porque podrá cultivar más.

Los sueños de Claro, son poder seguir cultivando y poder ayudarles a sus hijos para que estudien y se superen académicamente.
texts.en:
Claro, 36 years old, is a farmer. He studied up to ninth grade. He is married and his wife is devoted to housework. He has four children, three of whom are in school.

Claro has made a living in farming for 16 years. This work was taught to him by his older brother. When he got married, everything he learned served him well since with it, he supports his family. To reach his workplace, he has to walk 10 minutes and his hours are from 5:30 a.m. to 11:00 am. Now Claro has bought 50 broiler chickens, which generates him additional revenue since when he goes out to work, his wife takes care of them.

Claro needs the loan to buy 5 sacks of compost and pesticides to kill weeds because it affects his crops. He will also pay the rental of 14,000 square meters of land; with this, he is going to improve a lot because he will be able to plant more.

Claro's dreams are to be able to continue planting and to help his children to study and excel academically.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of compost and weedkillers and to rent land.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Fausto de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos. 

Fausto se dedica  a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres desde muy pequeño, durante la mañana trabaja en sus parcelas y en las tardes lo hace para otras personas.

	Él necesita el crédito para comprar semilla, abono, veneno, etc. Para llevar a cabo la siembra.

Fausto planea para un futuro comprar cerdos con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en:
Fausto is 42 years old and left education after the ninth grade. He has a partner and two children.

Fausto makes a living in agriculture, a job he learnt from his parents from a very young age. In the mornings he works on his plots of land, and in the afternoons he works on other peoples' plots.

He needs the loan to buy seeds, compost, poison etc. to plant crops.

In the future, Fausto plans to buy pigs with the profits he makes.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, poison, etc. to plant crops.

loans.name: Parbati Group

texts.en:
Parbati Group was formed in the year 2015 at Medinipur village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. There are 10 active, self-dependent women with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. 

Lilarani is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and their group members' livelihood improvement. She is sitting in the first row as third person from right with raised hand in the photo. She is about 39 years old and living with her small family consisting of her husband and three children.

Lilarani has been engaged in a grocery business at Medinipur village for the last 12 years. Her husband is helping her to promote the business. Through this business she earns a monthly income of 7,500 INR. Her opinion is that this income is not sufficient to maintain her family, and hence there is almost zero surplus at the end of the month. She plans to improve her business in the course of loan by purchasing a huge quantity of grocery items such as rice, wheat, oil, sugar, salt, biscuits, detergent, soap, snacks and spices from a wholesaler. 

She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for constructing a house and providing better education to her children.

The other nine members of her group are also actively engaged in different businesses like vegetable vending, milk business, popped rice business, paddy, general store and transport business, and with this loan, they hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of grocery items such as rice, wheat, oil, sugar, salt, biscuits, detergent, soap, snacks and spices.

loans.name: New York Group

texts.en:
Arlene is the featured borrower of New York group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been close friends since they arrived in Lebanon after leaving their hometown in the Philippines to work as housekeepers to provide their families a better living.
 
Arlene is a 37-year-old widowed mother of three children. She has been working hard as a housekeeper to provide them with the necessary living needs, especially now that she is their sole breadwinner since her beloved husband passed away.
 
Since Arlene has a limited monthly salary and her children's needs are increasing, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for their education and living needs in her Philippine hometown. 

Arlene is the second lady from the left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Dara is the first on the left, Olivia is the second from the right, and Clarissa is the first on the right.

loans.use: To pay for her children's education and living needs in her hometown in the Philippines.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa es una señora de 70 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado; está casada y solamente vive con su esposo.

Rosa se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en las parcelas que posee con su esposo, este oficio lo realiza por las mañanas y por las tardes se dedica a la crianza de cerdos.


Este préstamo le servirá a Rosa para comprar semilla, abono veneno, etc. Para sacar adelante su cosecha.
texts.en:
Rosa is 70 years old. She left education after the sixth grade. She is married and lives with her husband.

Rosa makes a living in agriculture, working the plats of land that her husband owns. She does this in the mornings, and then in the afternoons she works raising pigs.

Rosa will use this loan to buy seeds, compost, poison and other items for her crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, poison and other items for her crops.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad a is 54-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. 

Her husband has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. Irshad  fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.en:
Saidniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in small town with her family. She is married and has four children. 

She is a baker. She bakes traditional tasty bread. She has regular clients every day. She started her activity baking buns. Recently, her business has grown and she has her own restaurant where she bakes traditional bread for traditional meals. She also has a variety of orders from regular clients. 

She appealed to Kiva and IMON asking financial support to be treated at hospital. She is awaits your kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está soltero, se separó de su pareja y a él le dejó los tres hijos, actualmente vive con ellos y una hermana, sus hijos van a la escuela. 

José, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, no tiene quien le ayude, siembra 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 metros cuadrados de frijol, todo esto lo aprendió de su padre, quien desde muy pequeño le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura; su lugar de trabajo está a 10 minutos de su casa y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 de la mañana a 11:00 de la mañana.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas, para sembrar maíz, aprovechando que ahorita los fertilizantes están a bajo precio, el préstamo le ayudara mucho, porque ahorita no tiene dinero para comprar los insumos y le preocupa porque el invierno está cerca y quiere estar preparado. 

José, sueña con seguir cultivando, para que a sus hijos no les falte lo necesario y que puedan estudiar para que en el futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Jose is 50 years old and single. He completed second grade at school. He is separated from his partner who left him the three children, and he currently lives with the children and a sister. The children go to school.

He has been working in agriculture for 20 years. With nobody to help him, he cultivates 10,500 square meters of corn, and 3,500 square meters of beans. He learned this all from his father who taught him farming from a very early age. His place of work is located 10 minutes away from home, and his work schedule is from 6 am to 11 am.

Jose needs this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, he will take advantage of current low prices for the fertilizers. The loan will help him greatly because he has no money to buy the supplies. He is concerned that the winter season is coming, and he wants to be ready.

His dream is to continue farming so that he can provide for his children and they can continue attending school to become future professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business of flower making for many years. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies the local market.  She has good communication skills and has a good client list. 

Her husband earns insufficient income to support their family alone. She is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy materials such as fabric, glace papers and packs of paints in various colors to inflate her sales to earn the maximum amount of profits for meeting her household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric, glace papers and packs of paints in various colors to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Hanifan  Shaira

texts.en:
Hanifan is 38 years old and is married with seven children. Her husband’s income is insufficient to cover all of her family’s household expenses, so she initiated a business selling milk. Hanifan has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.

Hanifan is requesting a 45,000 PKR loan to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales. Her loan will help to increase her profit and provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Benkadi  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIEGUEKOUROUNI, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  MAIMOUNA, 2ème personne debout  de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group Benkadi I are married women who are on average 40 years old, have about 3 children and all live in polygamous families in Tieguekourouni, one of the villages of Baya, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.  
They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better run their agricultural activities during the winter.  They are on their third rural loan with the institution.  Maimouna, the second person standing up from right to left in the photo, grows peanuts.  With this loan, she will buy fertilizers, seeds and pay for labor costs to support 1 hectare.  
The products are sold at the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of resellers and consumers.  She plans to earn an average profit of 195,000FCFA per season.  This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: with labor costs and to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase electrical wire, a fuse box, electrical outlets and pay for cost of labor to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Norma Esperanza

texts.es:
Norma tiene 27 años de edad, pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado, ahora  está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.


Norma se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en las parcelas que posee, oficio que realiza durante la mañana junto a su  esposo y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a ordeñar las vacas y a los oficios domésticos.

Ella necesita la ayuda de este crédito para comprar una vaca y así poder incrementar la producción de leche que le generará mayor ingreso para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is twenty-seven, she was able to attend school up to the sixth grade. Now she is married and her husband works in agriculture. 

Norma works in agriculture on the parcels of land she has; she does this in the mornings alongside her husband, and in the afternoon she tends to the cows and household tasks. 

She needs this loan to buy a cow to be able to increase milk production, which will generate more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 63 años de edad, por la situación económica de sus padres no pudo lograr un alto nivel académico, su esposo falleció y por lo tanto sus hijos la apoyan en lo que pueden.


Adela se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, ella paga alquiler de terreno para sembrar,  este oficio lo realiza durante la mañana junto a sus hijos y en las tardes ordeña las vacas para elaborar queso.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar semilla, abono, veneno, etc. Para llevar a cabo su cosecha.
texts.en:
Adela is 63 years old. Due to her parents’ difficult financial situation, she could not study beyond the basic level. Her husband died, so her children help her as much as they can.

Adela works in agriculture. She rents a piece of land, where she grows vegetables. She works in the morning together with her children. In the afternoon, she milks some cows to make cheese.

She needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies she needs for her plantations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and other supplies for her plantations.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 57 years old, married, and blessed with six children. For the last 15 years, he has run a motorcycle transport business that has been profitable. 

Enock is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to maintain and service his motorcycle so that it will be in good condition for business. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his loan to educate his children and repay the loan. In the future, Enock hopes and dreams to expand his business by buying another motorcycle. He wants to be successful.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Manzoor

texts.en:
Manzoor is a 52-year-old married woman. She and her husband have been successfully running a small general store in the corner of their house. Manzoor’s husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products. Manzoor and her husband have been able to make enough money to meet the expenses of their four children. 

Manzoor is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea. She hopes to cater to the maximum number of customers to generate better income. Manzoor is positive about her future earnings and will continue to supply  her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three pigs and pig feed for them.

loans.name: Triple Aaa Group

texts.en:
Grospe is the featured borrower of the Triple AAA Group. She is a 50-year-old mother of three children and has been working hard as a housekeeper to provide for her children and give them an education. Grospe joined with her other group members to request a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. Members of the Triple AAA Group have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work abroad as housekeepers and support their beloved families. 

Grospe will use her portion of their loan from the Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to send to her beloved husband and children to provide for their educational and living needs. She is the first lady on the far left side of this photo. As for the other group members, Mylene is the lady at the center, while Loida is the lady at the right.

loans.use: to send money to her beloved husband and children to provide for educational and living needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock to meet customer needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make pupusas and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida  is 29, a married woman and a mother of 4 children. The income generated by her husband (also shown in the photo) is insufficient to cover all their household expenses, so she has initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing this business for many years now and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more retail goods to resell for income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to increase the number of liters of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  9 membres du groupe  BENKADI 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIEGUEKOUROUNI, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  DJENEBA MOUSSA, 2éme personne debout de la   droite  vers la  gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The nine members of the group BENKADI 3 are married women who average 37 years of age and 3 children each. They all live in polygamous families in TIEGUEKOUROUNI, a village in BAYA, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 3rd loan cycle with the MFI. 

DJENEBA MOUSSA grows groundnuts; she is the member standing second from the right in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 1 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold at the market to a clientele consisting of consumers and resellers. She expects to earn an average profit of 195,000 FCFA per season which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 47 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales todos están casados y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.     

Miguel, se ha dedicado desde hace 20 años a la agricultura, aprendió todo lo que sabe después de que salió de la fuerza armada y quedo sin trabajo, fue así como se dedicó a cultivar la tierra, también se dedica al cultivo de anonas y en este cultivo se involucran sus hijos.
  
Miguel, necesita el dinero para comprar fertilizantes y otro tipo de insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos, anteriormente sembraba 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno y hoy tiene proyectado sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados.

El sueño de Miguel es, poder  ampliar el cultivo de anonas y con las ganancias que obtenga comprar más arboles de anona.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 47, is a farmer. He has three children who are all married. His wife does the household chores. 

Miguel has been a farmer for 20 years. He learned everything he knows after he left the army and became unemployed, which is why he began farming. He also grows sugar apples, which his children help him with.

Miguel needs the money to purchase fertilizer and other types of agricultural supplies for his crops.  He had 7,000 square meters [1.7 acres] planted before, and now he plans to plant 14,000 square meters [3.5 acres].

Miguel’s dream is to be able to expand the sugar apple crop and purchase more sugar apple trees with the earnings that he will obtain.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other types of agricultural supplies for his crops.

loans.name: José Brígido

texts.es:
José  tiene 65 años de edad, se crió con sus padres y le enseñaron a trabajar, está casado y tiene dos hijos.

José se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para irse a las parcelas que alquila donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus hijos y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde trabaja como cuidandero de una finca cerca de donde reside

Con este préstamo él podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla, abono, etc. Cuenta con la experiencia necesaria de varios años para llegar a obtener una buena cosecha.

Él tiene entre sus metas comprar una yunta de bueyes para arar la tierra cuando cultive.
texts.en:
José is 65 years old. He grew up with his parents and they taught him to work. He is married with two children.

José gets up at 5:00 a.m. to travel to the plots of land he rents. He works on them in the mornings with his children while his wife does the housework. In the afternoons, he works looking after a ranch near his home.

This loan will enable him to buy agricultural inputs such as poison, seeds, compost, etc. He has the necessary experience gained from various years of work to achieve a good harvest.

One of his goals is to buy a pair of oxen to plough the land on which he grows his crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as poison, seeds, compost, etc.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en: Amale is a 35-year-old Lebanese woman.  She is married with ten children, two of whom still live with her. Her husband has worked in the construction field for a very long time, and he is the supporter of the family. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the first installment of her children’s education fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of her children’s education fees.

loans.name: Luis Raul

texts.es:
Luis, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, vive con sus 2 hijos, que están asistiendo a la escuela y su esposa que se dedica a la venta de tortilla.    

Luis, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos desde que era niño, tuvo que dejar de estudiar por dedicarse a la agricultura.- También, se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, su esposa se involucra en esta actividad, él tiene que desplazarse 2 kilómetros a pie, porque trabaja en un lugar donde no hay transporte de buses y su  horario es desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m. 
  
Luis, necesita el dinero para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.
  
Los sueños de Luis son, poder comprar 2 vacas  con la ganancia al final de la cosecha.
texts.en: Luis is 39 years old and studied up to Grade 4. He works growing basic grains. He lives with his two children who attend school and his wife who sells tortillas. Luis has grown basic grains since he was a boy. He had to leave school to work in agriculture. He also raises poultry. His wife is involved in this business. He has to walk two km by foot as there are no buses and his timetable is from 6 am until 4 pm. Luis needs the money to buy fertilizer and pesticides to cultivate 14,00 sq. meters of corn. Luis' dream is to be able to buy two cows with the profit from harvesting his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to plant 14,000 sq. meters of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk supply to clients daily

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more trees to obtain home energy resources to sell.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Sharifan is 50 years old and married. She operates a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Sharifan’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. 

Sharifan requested a loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. The loan will help provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Jamila Group

texts.en: Nazeeran is a house wife, mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters.Her husband has run a medical centre for 7 years now. Although being hard working, he does not make much money due to financial constraints in the near past. So he was unable to buy inventory for a long time and run his medical clinic properly. And this is creating an hindrance for his earnings, to meet the needs and wants of their family. Nazeeran therefore, has applied for the loan so her husband can buy the required inventory for retaining his business. She is thankful to KIVA and its field partner BRAC for helping solve the difficulties for them.

loans.use: to buy various injections and equipment for her health center.

loans.name: Amar

texts.en: Amar is a 33-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and four kids. She has been working since seven years ago at tailoring in her house to help her family meet the needs of life. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. To better develop her work, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new materials for her business such as textiles, scissors and many other items. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and, thus, will improve her income.

loans.use: to buy new materials for her business such as textiles, scissors and many other items

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 63 años y llegó al municipio de Soledad en el año 2002; venía en busca de oportunidades y un amigo le enseño el oficio que le  brindó la oportunidad de emprender su negocio; invirtió su pequeño capital en la compra de sus primeras máquina e inició a prestar el servicio de  cerrajería, mantenimiento, arreglo y elaboración de llaves, oficio que ejecuta diariamente desde su local en el horario de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m. y con el cual logró educar a sus tres hijos. Para Carlos su negocio le permite mantenerse en actividad constante y en ningún caso considera una vida pasiva y sin proyección, pues con el Credikiva que solicita a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo planea organizar otros puestos de atención y necesita surtir con llaves de varias referencias, candados de seguridad y cerraduras.  Su meta personal es continuar apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 63 years old and arrived in the municipality of Soledad in the year 2002. He came looking for opportunities, and a friend taught him something that gave him the opportunity to start his own business. He invested the little money he had in buying his first machines and started to offer locksmithing services, maintenance, and keys repair and production. He works every day from 08:00 am until 5:00 pm. This business helped him to raise his three children. Carlos thinks that his business helps him to keep himself constantly busy and he never feels that he lives a passive and aimless life.

With the CrediKiva he applied for at Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he plans to open other points of sales and needs to buy different types of keys, safety padlocks and door locks. His personal goal is to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy different types of keys, safety padlocks and door locks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition

loans.name: Souadou

texts.fr: Madame Souadou est membre du banc villageois. Elle est mariée, âgée de 45 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de pain depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle achète plusieurs sacs de pains par jour pour les revendre dans sa localité et dans les villages environnants. Elle est la seuls qui exerce cette activité dans son quartier. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari dans le ménage surtout pour la prise en charge de la scolarité et la nourriture des enfants.
texts.en: Mrs. Souadou, age 45, is a member of her Banc Villageois. She is married with five children, four of them boys. She has been selling bread for over five years. She buys several bags of bread daily to sell around her neighborhood and in nearby villages. She is the only person selling bread in her district. She will use her profits to help her husband run their household, mainly to feed their children and pay for their tuition.

loans.use: to buy bread to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are still studying. Her husband is the main income source to enhance their family way of living. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them to continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Humberto Napoleón

texts.es:
Humberto es un hombre trabajador de 69 años de edad, por situaciones de la vida él no estudió no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pues desde muy pequeño se dedico ha trabajar en el campo con su padre, ahora está acompañado y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y solo uno vive en casa.
 

Humberto Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 6 años, su padre le enseñó a preparar la tierra para cultivar, decidió dedicarse a esta actividad porque vio que de ahí podría sobrevivir  y obtener el alimento diario, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Sus cultivos los tiene a 10 minutos de su casa y su esposa le ayuda en el trabajo.

Este préstamo le servirá a Humberto para comprar fertilizantes e insumos agrícolas.

Él sueña con tener muchas vacas para iniciar negocio de derivados de la leche y volver a ver a su hijo mayor que vive en USA.
texts.en:
Humberto is a hard-working 69 year old man. Due to the circumstances of his life he never had the opportunity to study. From very young he had to work in the fields with his father. Now he is in a relationship and has three children who are adults and only one person lives in his house.

Humberto has worked in agriculture since he was six. His father taught him to prepare the land to plant. He decided to work in this activity as doing this he could survive and obtain his daily food. He also raises cattle. His crops are 10 minutes from his house and his wife helps him with the work.

This loan will help Humberto to buy fertilizer and agricultural inputs. His dream is to have a lot of cows to start a dairy product business and to see his oldest son who lives in the United States again.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
Rosa, de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está soltera y solo vive con un nieto y la esposa de él.

Rosa, se ha dedicado a este negocio de crianza de cerdos desde hace 3 años, también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa y el horario de atención es de 6:00 p.m. a 4:00 p.m. 
  
Rosa, necesita el dinero para comprar concentrado, el préstamo le ayudará porque podrá solventar esa necesidad.

El sueño de Rosa, es poder comprar más cerdos para ampliar el negocio y ampliar la tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 58 years old, studied until the 2nd grade.  She is single and only lives with a grandson and his wife.  

Rosa has been working this business raising pigs for three years.  Also, she has a small store in her house and the schedule is from 6:00am until 4:00pm.
  
Rosa needs the money to buy pig food.  The loan will help her because she could solve that need.

Rosa's dream is to be able to buy more pigs to increase the business and increase the store.

loans.use: To buy pig food.

loans.name: Rafael Ernesto

texts.es:
Rafael de 43 años de edad, actualmente está casado y tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen de él.

Rafael se dedica a la agricultura, esta actividad productiva la aprendió de sus padres, él  se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. para irse a trabajar durante la mañana en las parcelas que alquila y durante las tardes trabaja como ayudante de albañil.


Este crédito le servirá a Rafael para comprar los insumos como semilla, veneno, abono y pagar el alquilar de la parcela donde siembra.

Él planea para un futuro obtener otro crédito para comprar vacas y aumentar la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Rafael, age 43, is married with two dependent children.  Rafael is a farmer. He learned this productive occupation from his parents. He gets up at 5:30 A.M. to go to work during the morning on the plots that he rents, and he works as a bricklayer’s helper in the afternoon.

This loan will help Rafael to purchase supplies such as seed, poison, and compost; and to pay the rent for the plot where he does the planting.

In the future he plans to obtain another loan to purchase cows and increase milk production.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as seed, poison, and compost; and to pay the rent for the plot where he does the planting.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is married and has four kids to feed. She lives with her parents-in-law.

Beatriz works as an artisan, and she makes shoes. This time, she needs a loan to buy machines that will help her to make shoes. Beatriz is still the only person who earns money to support the family.

Beatriz is shown with her husband in the picture.

loans.use: to buy machines that will help her to make shoes

loans.name: Gevinor Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the featured borrower of Gevinor group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have all became close friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to seek a better income to support their beloved families.

Josephine is a 51-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working as a housekeeper in order to support her family back in the Philippines in developing their living. 

Josephine provides her children with a a good income in order to pay for their education.  Since her family's needs are increasing, she has decided to start her own as she calls 'mini store' where she sells diversified goods that she can afford to buy in order to sell to her Filipino friends during their weekend vacation. Through her acquired loan, she will increase her small newly established business merchandise and pay for her children education, and some of their living expenses.

Josephine is the first lady standing at the far right side of the picture, Jovita is the first from the left, Lourdes is the second from the right,  Marilyn is the second from the left, while Bella is the lady at the center of the picture.

loans.use: to increase her small newly established business merchandise

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIEGUEKOUROUNI, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  KOUMBA DAOUDA, 1ére personne assise de la  gauche vers la   droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group Bankadi 2 are married women, about 40 years old and have around 4 children each.  They all live in polygamous families in Tieguekourouni, one of the villages of Baya in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.  
They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better run their agricultural activities during the winter.  They are on their third seasonal loan with the institution.  Koumba Daouda, the first person sitting down from left to right in the photo, grows peanuts.  With her loan, she plans to buy fertilizers, seeds and to pay for labor costs to support 1 hectare of land.  The products will be sold at the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of resellers and consumers.  She plans to earn an average profit of 195,000FCFA per season.  This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and to help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and seeds and cover labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer for use on his farm

loans.name: Los Vencedores De Zapallal Group

texts.es: Sara es una mujer luchadora madre de 2 pequeños hijos uno de 5 y 2 años de edad,pertenece al grupo Vencedores de Zapallal,que  formaron un grupo de 5 personas emprendedores como ella,que sueñas en grande y poder asi formar una empresa mas grande. Sara cuenta con un negocio de panaderia en el cual recibe la ayuda de su familia,sus principales clientes son sus vecinos que conocen la calidad de sus productos.Sara invertira el dinero otorgado a incrementar en el negocio en la compra de insumos y materiales como harina, levadura y demas maquinarias que estan para renovar.Sara agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda prestada y asegura que va a poner todo de su parte para no defraudarlos y asi poder sacar adelante a su familia y lo mas importante que son sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sara is a hardworking woman.  She is mother of two son children, one of 5 and 2 years old.  She belongs to the group Vencedores de Zapallal (Victors of Zapallal) that is made up of five entrepreneurial people like herself.  She dreams big to be able to form a bigger business.

Sara has a bakery business in which she receives the help of her family.  Her main customers are her neighbors who know the quality of her products.

Sara will invest the money granted to her to increase the business by buying input and materials such as flour, yeast, and more machinery to renovate.  Sara is grateful for the Kiva lenders for their assistance, and she promises that she is going to put in her all so as not to disappoint them.  And in this way be able to get her family ahead and that the most important are her children.

loans.use: To buy materials and products such as flour, yeast, and more.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en: Mr. Lauben is aged 31 and happily married with one wife and 5 children aged 15, 12, 9, 6 and 4 years old, respectively. Four of his children are still schooling. He is borrowing a loan of 1500,000/= and this is his first time of borrowing from UGAFODE Microfinance ltd (MDI). He is a principle farmer of coffee and banana plantation. He works for 10 hours a day and 6 days a week.  He started this business in order to generate income for his family household. The loan purpose is to buy chemicals and mulches for his plantation. These will help to improve the quality of his bananas. Most of his clients are people in Bushenyi District. He started his business in 2002. He hopes to own large plantations of coffee and banana, and to produce more for sale. He is always faced with a challenge of price fluctuations, banana bacterial wilt and high prices for agricultural inputs. He is a hard working person.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron, in order to build her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables to sell; she hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 35 years old, married, and blessed with two children. He is a farmer and has been growing cash crops to sell. 

He will be using the loan to buy farm inputs such as certified maize seeds, herbicides and fertilizer for use on his farm. He hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income, and support his family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as certified maize seeds, herbicides and fertilizer for use on his farm; he hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of bananas and vegetables to sell with the hope this will enable her to serve more customers and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Midarlis María

texts.es: Midarlis tiene 29 años es una  mujer que descubrió su espíritu emprendedor al quedar desempleada; con su cónyuge decidieron crear su propio camino laboral aprovechando sus conocimiento en zapatería y con un pequeño capital se dedicaron a la elaboración de calzado que entre los dos comercializan en los almacenes de calzado, poco a poco el negocio ha crecido y actualmente tiene siete empleados además de su cónyuge.  Midarlis desea  proyectarse  como empresaria exitosa, para ello tiene metas claras que planea  materializar aprovechando las oportunidades que se le presentan como el acceder a la financiación a través del Credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que planea adquirir materias primas como suelas, cuero, taches, hilos, hebillas y demás productos que le ayuden a incrementar su producción y generar mayores ingresos que a futuro le permitan reunir los ahorros necesarios para adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Midarlis is 29 years old.  She is a woman who discovered her entrepreneurial spirit when she was left unemployed.  With her spouse, they decided to create their own work taking advantage of their knowledge in shoe making.  With a little capital, they began making shoes that between the two of them, they sold in the shoe store.  Little by little, the business has grown, and currently she has seven employees in addition to her husband.

Midarlis wants to project herself as a successful business woman; therefore, she has clear goals that she plans to make happen by taking advantage of the opportunities that she has access to through Credikiva with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  

With the loan, she plans to acquire raw materials such as soles, leather, studs, threads, buckles, and more products that help her to increase her production and generate better income that in the future will allow her to put together the necessary saving to get her own house.

loans.use: To acquire raw materials such as soles, leather, studs, threads, buckles, and other products that help her increase her production.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah lives in Nairobi’s Mukuru informal settlement. She is a mother of two boys and a savvy entrepreneur who owns rental units in Mukuru, is involved in the sale of firewood, and also runs two Fresh Life Toilets which provide her community with clean and hygienic services on a daily basis.

In the last one year of operation, she has not only witnessed but also contributed to the immense sanitation improvements in her area. “I am happy that flying toilets are a thing of the past,” she says. In addition, the business has been a great boost towards providing for her family’s needs of food, clothing and education for her children.

With her set of Fresh Life Toilets doing very well, Leah’s goals this year is to establish an additional facility to serve her community better and efficiently.

As she says, her customers have been thrilled by her toilet services, and is thereby growing in numbers by the day. As such she anticipates that an additional Fresh Life facility will ensure her customers and community have better access to toilets by eliminating recurrent queues as they await to use the Fresh Life facilities.

Leah is therefore seeking financial assistance towards the achievement of this goal; acquiring one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 22 years old and he supports one family member. 

He has a motorcycle transport business and he will be using the loan to buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition. He hopes this will enable him to serve more customers. 

Nelson plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hope and dream is to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fishing tools, driftnets, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón, de 70 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, actualmente vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos, ya que uno ya se casó y formo su propia familia. 

Ramón, tiene más de 20 años de experiencia como tractorista, desde pequeño le ayudaba a su padre en los cultivos, ahora a él le ayuda un hijo, ya que cuando hay que ir a rastrar la tierra con el tractor, si no puede ir él, va su hijo y ambos se comparten el trabajo. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar semilla y fertilizantes para sembrar granos básicos y por el momento carece de capital de trabajo para comprarlos. 

Ramón, quiere que a su familia no le falte nada y que su hijo aprenda bien el trabajo para que en un futuro le sirva.
texts.en:
Ramón, 70 years old, studied until the 3rd grade.  Currently, he lives with his wife and one son, since the other one is married and has formed his own family.

Ramón has more than 20 years of experience as a tractor driver.  Since he was young, he helped his father in the crops.  Now one of his sons helps him, since when it is time to till the land with the tractor, if he can't go, his son goes; and both of them share the work.

The loan will be used to buy seed and fertilizers to plant basic grains because they lack the capital to buy them.

Ramón wants that his family lacks nothing and that his son learns the job well so that in the future it serves him.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Flor Esmeralda

texts.es:
Flor, de 22 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora, culmino sus estudios básicos de noveno grado, no siguió estudiando porque salió embarazada, ahora su hijo tiene 2 años de edad y vive junto a su mamá y una hermana.
 
Flor, ha comenzado a emprender un negocio de crianza de pollos y cerdos, en el cual lleva 1 año, el negocio lo tiene en su casa, ya que con la ayuda de su mamá logro construir un corral para el resguardo de los animales. 
  
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar cerdos, el dinero será el capital con el que comprará los cerdos a un precio bajo y de esta manera poder generar los ingresos necesarios para su familia. 

Flor, quiere ampliar su crianza de cerdos y continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Flor, 22 years old, is a young entrepreneur who completed her basic education through the 9th grade, but did not continue studying because she became pregnant. Now her son is 2 years old and lives with her and her mother and a sister.
 
 Flor has begun to operate her business raising chickens and pigs, and  has done this for one year. She carries out the business in her home, having constructed a corral for securing the animals with her mother's help.
  
The loan will be used to purchase pigs. This money will become the capital with which she buys the pigs at a low price and, in this manner, generates income that the family needs. 

Flor wishes to expand her pig-raising business and, in addition, to continue her studies.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Benkadi  5 Group

texts.fr:
Les  05 membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIEGUEKOUROUNI, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  DAMBA, 1ére personne debout de la  gauche     vers la  droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of this group called Benkadi I  are married women with an average age of 28 and on average three children each, all living in polygamous families in Tieguekourouni, one of the villages of Baya, third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third seasonal loan with the institution. 

The crop grown by Damba is peanuts. She is the first person from left to right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farming supplies and seeds and pay for tillage to cultivate one hectare. Her production is sold at the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of dealers and of consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 195,000 F CFA per season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay fees for plowing and buy inputs and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron, to build a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Lyndiane 3 Group

texts.fr: Ce banc villageois a été inauguré le 09 Mai 2007. C'est un groupe constitué de dix huit femmes qui s'activent dans le petit commerce. Elles ont toujours remboursé leurs prêts avec succès. Madame Fatou qui est la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de 60 ans et mère de huit enfants dont six filles et deux garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes depuis plusieurs années. Avec le prêt sollicité elle va acheter des légumes en grande quantité. Elle est une femme très dynamique et très douée dans ce domaine. Les bénéfices vont servir à prendre en charge ses enfants(scolarité, nourriture et santé).
texts.en: This banc villageois has been created on May 9, 2007. This borrower’s group is composed of 18 women who work as vendors. They have been  repaying all their loans on time. Mrs. Fatou, the one on the right raising her hand in the photo is the group’s representative. She is a widow, 60 years of age, and is the mother of six daughters and two sons. Fatou has been selling vegetables for years. With her loan, she will go stock up on vegetables. She is a very energetic person and manages her work very skillfully. Fatou's revenues will allow her to provide for her children’s needs (education, food and healthcare).

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 4  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIEGUEKOUROUNI, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  NAGUON , 2éme personne debout de la   droite  vers la  gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 4 are married women who average 33 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in polygamous families in TIEGUEKOUROUNI, a village in BAYA, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 3rd loan cycle with the MFI. 

NAGUON grows groundnuts; she is the member standing second from the right in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 1 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold at the market to a clientele consisting of consumers and resellers. She expects to earn an average profit of 
195,000 FCFA per season which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José de 22 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa,  tienen un hijo de menos de un año de edad y es el único que depende de José.

Él trabaja como albañil, ya tiene dos años dedicándose a esta actividad que aprendió gracias a amigos suyos, además tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas, su jornada comienza a las 6:30 AM y termina a las 3:30 PM.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar láminas, polines, pines, etc. para terminar de instalar el techo a su casa.

Él sueña con ver terminada su casa que ha estado construyendo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajar duro para el bienestar de su esposa e hijo.
texts.en:
José, age 22, completed high school. He's married, and his wife does the household chores. They have a son who is less than a year old, who is José’s only dependent. 

He has been working as a bricklayer for two years now, an occupation that he learned thanks to his friends. In addition, he has a business selling beverages. His day begins at 6:30 A.M. and ends at 3:30 P.M.

He needs this loan to purchase metal sheeting, purlins, fasteners, etc. in order to finish installing the roof of his house.

He dreams of seeing his house, which he has been building with much effort, finished; and of working hard for his wife's and son's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, purlins, fasteners, etc. in order to finish installing the roof of his house.

loans.name: Ginio

texts.es: Don Ginio tiene 8 años de laborar en la crianza de pollos para engorde y venta. De los ingresos obtenidos de esta actividad dependen él y su esposa. Está solicitando un préstamo por dos mil cien dólares ($2,100), para comprar 500 pollitos para cría , además necesita comprar  materiales para ampliar la galera donde los cría. Con esto disminuirá los ataques de animales a sus pollos, aumentará la producción y mejorará las ventas.
texts.en: Ginio has 8 years experience raising broiler chickens to sell. He and his wife depend on the income obtained from this business. He is requesting a loan for two thousand, one hundred dollars ($2,100) to buy 500 chickens to raise and he also needs materials to expand the coops where he raises them.  This will cut down on the attacks on the chickens by other animals, increase his production and improve his sales.

loans.use: to  buy 500 chickens to fatten and material to expand his coops.

loans.name: Nohemy Areli

texts.es:
Nohemy de 34 años de edad, está casada y su esposo se dedica a crianza de pollos, tiene dos hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia y dependen de Nohemy.

Ella trabaja en mejoramiento de calles como ingeniera, ya tiene 9 años de experiencia en esta actividad, la distancia de su trabajo depende del lugar donde se lleve a cabo proyectos de mejora de calles y su horario es de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm.

Ella necesita este crédito para pagar deudas pendientes que tiene con otra institución.
Sus sueños son poner una granja grande de pollos y que sus hijos estudien hasta ser profesionales.
texts.en: Nohemy is 34 years old. She is married and her husband works raising chickens. She has two children dependent on her, only one of them is studying. She works in street improvement as an engineer and she has 9 years experience in this work. Her distance to work depends on where the street improvement projects are taking place and her timetable is from 8 am until 4 pm. She needs this loan to pay off debts that are outstanding with another institution. Her dreams are to build a large chicken farm and for her children to study until they become professionals.

loans.use: to pay off outstanding debts she has with another institution.

loans.name: Eshmurot

texts.ru:
Эшмурот 51 летный мужчина. Он один из жителей района Кубадиен. Все жители района Кубадиен занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. У кого-то земельный участок, который выращивает растение, а некатором  еще домашнее животное, который выращивает скота. В районах и селах Республики Таджикистан, отличная и прекрасная погода для сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Свежий воздух, свежая трава для корма скота, и чистая вода. 
Эшмурот женатый. Он проживает вместе женой, невесткой и детьми. Его деятельность является основной, потому что его семья тоже занимается этой деятельностью. Эшмурот в этом году посадил картофель, и их собирает на продажу. И готовится к новому посеву урожай. Ему нужно обработать землю минеральными удобрениями. Он запрашивает кредит для минеральных удобрений. Шомурот хочет, чтобы Вы ему помогли финансам, и он будет рад на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Eshmurot is a 51-year-old man. He is one of the residents of the Qubadiyon region. All of the residents of the Qubadiyon region are engaged in agricultural activity. Some have a plot of land and grow crops, and some have domestic animals and rear livestock. There is excellent and wonderful weather for agriculture in the regions and villages of the Republic of Tajikistan. Fresh air, fresh grass for livestock feed, and clean water.

Eshmurot is married. He lives together with his wife, daughter-in-law, and children. His business is their foundation, because his family also engages in this activity. Eshmurot has sowed potatoes this year, and he harvests them for sale. He is preparing to sow a new crop. He needs to treat the land with mineral fertilizer. He is requesting a loan for mineral fertilizer. Eshmurot would like you to help finance him, and he will be glad of your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Benkadi  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FARABACOURA, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  KADIATOU, 1ére personne assise de la  gauche vers la   droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of Benkadi 1 Group are married women who, on average, are 35 years old, have four children, and all live in polygamous families in Farabacoura, one of the villages of Baya, in the third administrative region of Mali.

These women are working with microfinance institution [MFI] Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the MFI.

The crop to be grown is ground nuts, by Kadiatou, the first person seated in the photo, left to right. With her loan, she plans to purchase inputs and seeds and pay the labor costs to maintain one hectare. After the harvest, the crop will be sold in the market to a group of customers made up of resellers and consumers.

Kadiatou expects to see an average profit of 125,000 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow her to [re]pay her loan as well as to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs and purchase inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 47 years old and happily married with one wife. They have four children who are 16, 13, 10 and 7 years old. He has no other dependents, and all of his children attend school. He is a principle farmer and mainly farms coffee, tea and bananas on his plantation. He works for 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. He also has a side income from retail trade. He started the business in order to generate income for his family's household. 

He borrowed a loan of UGX 1,000,000 and has been borrowing from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for over 4 years. The purpose of the loan is to buy fertilizers, chemicals and mulches for his plantations and stock for his retail business. Most of his clients are people in Bushenyi District. He started business in 2003. He hopes to own large plantations of coffee and bananas and produce more for sale. He is always faced with a challenge of price fluctuations, banana bacterial wilt, and high prices for agricultural inputs. He is a hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Liberatus..

texts.en:
Liberatus, who is in his late twenties, is married and has no children. He has been running a retail shop for five years.  He works from 5:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly report.  

This will be Liberatus’ second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase the shop's inventory, and he has paid back his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the resulting profit to take care of himself and his wife, for loan repayment, and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy new products to improve his business. He  dreams of owning a motorcycle.

Liberatus will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan terms.

loans.use: to buy new products to improve his business.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.en:
Magaly is 19 years old and lives with her parents. She sells construction items. She is the only support for her parents as they are currently unemployed. 

Magaly requested a loan, which she will use to buy shelves to sell. In the future, she would like to live in her own place and have a library.

loans.use: to purchase shelves

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a single man and he lives alone. He has a little farm and he sells milk to earn some money.

Jose needs a loan to buy a milking cow. He works hard and he has to attend to his farm alone as he doesn't have any relatives that can help him.  That is why he is asking for your help. Jose used to be a mason but he had an accident and now he is making big efforts to have a profitable farm.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Gimbert

texts.en:
Gimbert makes cheese and he is assisted by his mother. Gimbert is also a mason and he needs a loan to buy a milking cow.

Gimbert is single and he doesn't have children, but he has to take care of his mother.  He has to manage his farm alone because his mother only cooks the cheese and nothing else. He hopes you can help him. His business is o.k., he is healthy and he has experience.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a single mother and she has a son. Luisa makes cheese and she is assisted by her son when it is time to sell the cheese at fairs. She has her own house but the place is poor.

Luisa also sells milk and she needs a loan to buy a milking cow that will help her to increase her milk production. She hopes you can help her because her son has to study and Luisa doesn't have another source of income, but she is healthy and she has experience selling milk and making cheese.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy a solar light

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FARABACOURA, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  MASSIGA, 3éme personne debout de la  gauche vers la   droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi-3 group are married women who on the average are 33 years old, with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Farabacoura, a village in Baya, the third administrative district of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. The group members are on their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

They grow peanuts, which is what Massiga does, for example. She is the third one standing from left to right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to use agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers] and seeds as well as pay for the cost of labor to work 1 ha [2.5 acres] of land.  After harvesting, she sells her produce at the market, to a customer base composed of both resellers and consumers. She plans to earn an average revenue of 100,000 CFA francs per agricultural cycle. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy a solar system

loans.name: Chuipachaj Group

texts.en:
About two hours northwest of Panajachel lies the beautiful city of Totonicapán.  From Toto, a 20 minute shuttle ride will take you high up to a rural area where monthly meetings of the amiable group “Chuipachaj” take place.
