Among the 10 women of the trust bank is entrepreneur Maria, she is a charismatic and dedicated member who, due to her well-spoken ability, has been elected as “Chuipachaj’s” treasurer. The 23-year-old mother of two has been with Friendship Bridge for just over three years and recounted the incredible impact the organization has had on her and her family. Before Friendship Bridge, Maria was unemployed and sharing the stresses of financing both food and education with her husband who lives and works in another country. With the loan she took out from Friendship Bridge, Maria shares that she was able to kick-start her weaving business and start generating enough revenue to feed and educate her children. With the new loan she will receive, Maria hopes to invest the money into new weaving equipment and materials so that she can continue supporting her family with the help of her supportive husband.  She is always looking for a better future of her family. 

Maria’s calm and determined demeanor along with her success allows for a beautifully inspiring story that can be seen throughout Friendship Bridge.

Besides the loan, Maria will also receive non-formal education as part of the Friendship Bridge Microcredit Plus program, which combine microloans and education. So, Maria will grow both as an entrepreneur and also increase her knowledge on topics like health, business, family and specific topics about women.

The trust bank Chuipachaj appreciates the confidence of KIVA investors around the world for giving them the opportunity to pursue development for their small businesses through microcredit.

loans.use: To purchase weaving equipment and materials.

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.en:
The eleven women who compose the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Palomitas” share the common goal of moving themselves, their families and their community of Estanzuela in Quiche” into a brighter and more prosperous future. The community is located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The ladies are beginning their very first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and are extremely excited! They are highly motivated to create new and workable solutions to poverty, to see their children in school and step into a brighter future.

Matias is the 60-year-old president of the group.  She raises animals like chickens and also buys and sells beans.  She has six children and her children help her with the businesses. Two of them are street vendors in the capital of the country, Guatemala City. Mother and children work together to benefit  the entire family.  With her new loan, Matias plans to purchase three dozen chickens as well as sacks of beans to sell, not only in her community but also nearby as well.

All the ladies in the Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings. They transact business on their loans and then participate in educational training in their own native language given by a Facilitator of Friendship Bridge. Topics covered include health, hygiene and nutrition as well as self-esteem, women’s rights and teenage pregnancy.

KIVA investors are valuable partners in the ‘Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge. It is impossible for these women to walk into a bank to secure a loan. Thank you, KIVA investors, for your kindness and compassion for these women!

loans.use: buy chickens and beans

loans.name: La Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.en:
San Pedro Jocopilas is a municipality in the Guatemalan Department of El Quiché. Eleven women have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “La Bendición de Dios”. They have various small businesses selling food like beans, vegetables, and fruit. Three of the ladies sell tortillas. The women are requesting a loan from KIVA investors in order to increase their inventory and attract more customers.

Estebana is a 42-year-old member of the Trust Bank who is married with four children. She sells pork and also is the owner of a small convenience store. Her children help her with the little store that is actually part of Estebana’s home. She shares that her husband is quite happy because several family goals have been met. With a new loan, Estebana plans to buy three pigs as well as ten sacks of corn and beans. There is a high demand for the beans and corn right now.

The eleven women of the Trust Bank meet monthly to transact business on their loans and to participate in educational training with a Friendship Bridge Facilitator. As they have had little or no education, the ladies are eager to learn about nutrition, health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants. 

KIVA investors and Friendship Bridge are highly valued by the women of “La Bendición de Dios”. They are stepping into a brighter tomorrow, benefiting themselves, their families and their community of San Pedro Jocopilas. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: buy pigs and corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy a solar system

loans.name: Wayan

texts.en:
Wayan is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones.

Wayan has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story: Wayan learned the silversmith's craft in elementary school. "I opened my own jewelry workshop to design and craft a variety of gold and silver accessories. Unfortunately, events such as the World Trade Center attacks and the Legian-Kuta bombing have had a very bad impact on Bali's tourism trade, which in turn has affected my work. I need capital to be able to craft more pieces and build up my inventory. I am happy to get a chance for this loan support -- thank you so much for this!"

Use the link below to view Wayan's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/3803

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mulch, which will improve her banana plantation

loans.name: Jawaahir Group

texts.en:
Jawaahir Group, which contains 19 female members, all have small or medium businesses in Gabiley Town. Jawaahir (who has her hand raised in the group photo) is the group leader.  She is a bread-winner and a mother of 9 children. She has a medium retail grocery store in Gabiley.  Jawaahir started her grocery in 1991 and she used her income-generating activity to pay her family bills and school fees.

The main products sold by Jawaahir’s Grocery include onions, potatoes and other types of vegetables. Each and every individual member of the Jawaahir group will take her loans separately. The requested loan of $700 could bring Jawaahir's business to the upper level and improve the standard of living for her family members.  She wants to buy more vegetables to increase the goods in her business. 

Jawaahir needs to import the vegetables from Ethiopia and to expand her grocery. She will purchase the vegetables and she will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 23 years old and describes herself as an ambitious person. She lives with her sister and brother-in-law.  She doesn't pay rent but helps in  buying food for the family. 

Jacqueline works in a call center and wants to start selling products through a catalog to earn an extra income. She is asking for a loan to buy shoes and cosmetics that she plans to sell to co-workers and neighbors.

loans.use: buy shoes and perfumes

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 43 years old and married. Her husband sells paint and also repairs cars and she own a grocery store. 

Alicia says that she started selling candies in a table outside the place that her husband use to rent as warehouse. But as the business grew, she decided to sell different things until it became a grocery store.  She also sells Mexican snacks. 

Alicia is asking for a loan to buy more products and have a bigger inventory. She opens the store from Monday to Saturday and spends Sundays with her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FARABACOURA, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  MARIAMA, 3ére personne debout de la  gauche vers la   droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of Benkadi 2 Group are married women who, on average, are 32 years old, have three children, and all live in polygamous families in Farabacoura, one of the villages of Baya, in the third administrative region of Mali.

These women work with microfinance institution [MFI] Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the MFI.

The crop to be grown is ground nuts, by Mariama, the third person standing in the photo, left to right. With her loan, she plans to purchase inputs and seeds and pay the costs of labor to maintain one hectare. After the harvest, the crop will be sold in the market to a group of customers made up of resellers and consumers.

Mariama expects to see an average profit of 125,000 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow her to [re]pay her loan as well as help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs and purchase inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evan is age 46 and happily married with one wife. They have three children who are 13, 10 and 6. He has no other dependents, and all of his children are in school. He is a principle farmer who does tea farming and runs a banana plantation. He works for eight hours a day and six days a week, and he also has a side income from retail trade. He started the business in order to generate income for his family household. 

He borrowed a loan of UGX 2,500,000 and has been borrowing from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for over four years.The loan purpose is to buy fertilizers, chemicals and mulches for his plantations and stock for retail business. Most of his clients are people in Bushenyi District. He started his business in 1998, and he has been able to provide for his family and educate his children. 

He hopes to own large plantations of coffee and bananas and produce more for sale. He is always faced with the challenges of price fluctuations, banana bacterial wilt, and high prices for agricultural inputs. He is an honest and hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Bulus Goma

texts.en: Bulus Goma is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dauro Village. Bulus Goma joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Bulus Goma suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Bulus Goma has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seed that will increase his yields and income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona Bulus Goma can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Mati

texts.en: Mati is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dauro Village. Mati joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Mati suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mati will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Mati now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Ummaru

texts.en: Ummaru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bargi Village. Ummaru  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ummaru suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ummaru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ummaru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Audu

texts.en: Audu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bargi Village. Audu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Audu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Audu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seed that will increase his yields and income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Audu can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Zara

texts.es:
Zara, de 67 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, solo estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada desde hace 30 años, tienen 4 hijos, 2 de ellos ya son mayores de edad.

Zara, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, ya que por su edad ya no trabaja el cultivo de la tierra, antes lo hacía junto a su esposo, ahora su hijo está trabajando la tierra y el terreno donde cultivan se encuentra a 1/2 kilómetro de su casa y es propio.  

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar semilla y fertilizantes, ya que se acerca la época lluviosa y tiene que preparar con anticipación la tierra. 

Zara, desea que sus hijos sean personas profesionales y exitosos en esta sociedad.
texts.en:
Zara is 67 years old. She is an enterprising woman. She only has a fourth grade education and has been married for thirty years. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are now adults. 

Zara works as a homemaker, since due to her age she no longer farms the land, even though she used to, alongside her husband. Now her son does the farm work on the land they own, which is located 0.5 Km. from their home.

She will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, since the rainy season is approaching and she has to prepare the land in advance.

Zara wants her children to have a career and achieve success in society.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gs Los Pagadores Group

texts.es:
El Señor Espectacion tiene 42 años de edad, es padre de cuatro hijos, convive con su compañera de hogar. Su actividad es la caficultura, su finca  esta ubicada en la Aldea de los Lirios, municipio de Trojes al oriente de Honduras.
Don Espectacion su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia con el credito que esta solicitando podra obtener la planta solar, sueño que a tenido desde hace tiempo el cual se le ara realidad con el apoyo de la Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras y KIVA. Don Espectacion con la inversion le ayudara a llevar el progreso a su hogar y dar a su familia una nueva forma de vida ya que podran tener acceso a la energia solar.
Don Espectacion el credito lo solicita con Pedro y Andrez todos ellos se dedican a la caficultura y sueñan con tener energia en sus hogares.




                                                                                         Trojes, Honduras Abril 2015
texts.en:
Espectacion is 42 years of age, the father of four children and shares a home with his live-in partner. His occupation is the cultivation of coffee. His plantation is located in Aldea de los Lirios, in the municipality of Trojes in East Honduras. Espectacion's dream is to improve his family's living conditions. With the loan that he is requesting, he will be able to get a solar energy system, a dream that he has had for a long time which will be made reality with the support of the Honduran microfinance institution Prisma and Kiva. The investment will help Espectacion bring progress to his home and give his family a new way of life since they will have access to solar energy.


Espectacion is requesting the loan with Pedro and Andrez. They all make a living in the cultivation of coffee and dream of having energy in their homes.

Trojes, Honduras
April 2015

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, de 59 años de edad, no estudio, se acompañó desde muy joven, actualmente tiene un hijo, el cual vive junto a él y su pareja.

Juan, desde hace 35 años ha trabajado en la agricultura, ya que esta actividad se la enseño su padre, quien también se dedicaba a la agricultura, actualmente cultiva dos hectáreas de maíz y también se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto.

El dinero del crédito será para comprar abono para el cultivo de maíz que tiene plantado, y que necesita las primeras aplicaciones de abonos y otra pequeña parte será para el pago de mano de obra de los jornaleros que le ayudan a realizar sus trabajos.

El sueño de Juan, es poder construir una vivienda segura y más dignamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 59 years old. He never went to school and started living with his partner when he was very young. They currently have a son living with them. Juan has been working as a farmer for the past 35 years, since that is the business he learned from his father, who was also a farmer. He currently farms five acres of cornfields and also works raising beef cattle.

He will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer for his corn crops. The corn has been planted and he needs to apply a first round of fertilizer. Another small part of the loan will go towards paying for labor. He will hire laborers to help him with his work.

Juan's dream is to be able to build a safe and decent home, so that he and his family can live better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn crops.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman, but her husband travels a lot, so Rosa has to attend the little farm the family has by herself. She needs a loan to buy a milking cow. 

Rosa learned how to take care of cows when she was a child, so she knows what to do and she hopes you can help her. Rosa is healthy, and she is a mother of four kids.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace her roof.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is from Dumingag, in the Philippines. She and her husband have agricultural land and earn a living through farming. They have also cultivated rice land near their home. Evelyn makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan from Paglaum MPC to finance farming activities such as clearing, holing and planting on her land. She wishes to sustain her business and to be able to supply more crops to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to finance farming activities such as clearing, holing and planting on her land

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Сельское хозяйство является одним из самых трудных рабочих мест, потому что это занимает много тяжелой работы, чтобы двигаться вперед. Но Мавлуда никогда не отказалась, несмотря на плохую погоду или на то другое. Она всегда готова найти способ, чтобы обеспечить свою семью.
Мавлуда прекрасная женщина. Ей 53 года. Она живет вместе семьей  на районе Кубадиен. Она встает с первыми лучами солнца отправиться в земельный участок, где она имеет обязательства работы. У нее есть собственный земельный участок, где она выращивает помидоры и семечки. Мавлуда хотелось обработать урожай и почву минеральными удобрениями, чтобы уничтожать микробы и насекомые. Для приобретения минеральных удобрений ей нужно Ваша поддержка. Она нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Agriculture is one of the most difficult types of work because it involves a lot of hard work to keep it running, but Mavluda had never turned away from despite bad weather or something else. She is always ready to find a way to provide for her family.

Mavluda is a beautiful woman. She is 53 years old. She lives with her family in the Qubadiyon district. She gets up with the first rays of sun in order to got to her land plot, where she has work responsibilities. She has her own land, where she grows tomatoes and sunflowers. Mavluda wants to treat her crop and soil with mineral fertilizers in order to prevent bacteria and insects. She needs Your help to buy mineral fertilizers. She relies on Your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to build a wall in her house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has always been an enthusiastic farmer who grows rice on her land in Dumingag. She consistently has a good yield and strong earnings from her business, but would like to be even more productive. 

Elizabeth requested a loan, which she will use to prepare her land and seedbed and purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. With the loan, her rice field will be ready for planting. In the future, she hopes to buy a truck to haul her produce to market.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena makes good earnings on her farming activities in Dumingag. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially now that she has a high cost of living since her children entered college. She approached Paglaum for a loan amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides and farm tools. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides and farm tools

loans.name: Yeny De La Paz

texts.es:
Yeny, de 34 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, también trabaja en una tienda de repuestos para motocicletas, ella se creció con su abuela, quien se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos de su casa.- Yeny, es una mujer muy educada y trabajadora, que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido sacar adelante sus estudios de educación media y graduarse de bachillerato, su familia está formada por su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura y una  hija de 3 años de edad.

Yeny, tiene una experiencia de 5 años en prestación de servicios como vendedora, realiza esta actividad desde que salió de estudiar, con ayuda de sus abuelos ella pudo salir adelante y terminar sus estudios y graduarse como bachiller general.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para reparar la motocicleta de su esposo, ya que esta motocicleta les ayuda a movilizarse del trabajo a su casa y viceversa. 

Las metas de Yeny, son mejorar y ampliar su casa, también sueña con tener un vehículo, el cual le sirva para viajar de su casa a los campos agrícolas a recoger las cosechas de su esposo.
texts.en:
Yeny, 34, works doing housework and also in a motorcycle repair parts shop.  She grew up with her grandmother who was a housewife.  Yeny is a very educated and hardworking woman that with much efforts and sacrifice has been able to get her high school studies ahead and graduated from high school.  Her family is formed by her husband, who works in agriculture and their 3-year-old daughter.

Yeny has 5 years of experience in sales, she started working here when he finished school, with her grandparent’s help she was able to get ahead and graduate from high school. 

The money from the loan will be used to repair her husband’s motorcycle, this is their way of transportation from home to work and viceversa.

Yeny’s goals are to improve and expand her house, she also dreams to buy a car so she can use to go from her home to the farm and pick up her husband’s harvest.

loans.use: to repair her husband’s motorcycle.

loans.name: José Pablo

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años de edad, estudió hasta 3er grado, está soltero y tiene dos hijos que viven con él los cuales ya no estudian pero trabajan.

José trabaja como agricultor, desde hace unos 10 años vive sembrando maíz y el trabajo lo  aprendió con su papa, no tiene otras actividades económicas pero anteriormente trabajaba como ganadero.
Su trabajo está a unos 200 mts de su casa y viaja a pie.


Este crédito lo está solicitando para comprar abono, semillas y fertilizantes para llevar a cabo la siembra.

Sus sueños son comprar vacas y que sus hijos aprendan este trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old.  He studied through the third grade.  He is single and has two children who live with him; they are no longer in school, but they work.

José works as a farmer.  For the past ten years or so he has made his living sowing corn.  He learned this work from his dad.  He doesn’t have any other jobs, but previously he worked as a rancher.

His work is about 200 meters from his house; he commutes on foot.

He is asking for his loan to buy soil amendments, seeds, and fertilizers in order to carry out the planting.

His dream is to buy cattle, and that his children would learn this line of work.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, seeds, and fertilizers in order to plant.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Ba'awa Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Isah suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Isah has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize this year, Isah can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Wherever her feet bring her, she'll push her cart to sell corn. Fely resides in Intramuros Manila, Philippines. She is 49 years old and is married to Anthony who works as a bark taker. Together, they work hard to satisfy the needs of the family. 

She would like to avail a loan worth PHP 20,000 that she will use to buy more supplies of corn to sell. This would be a great help, not just to her, but also to her household since it would mean a greater profit if she could acquire more quantities of corn. She truly hopes that you can help her with this. 

In the future, she dreams of growing her business and hopes that her family will always be in good condition in terms of health and other aspects. She works persistently today because she is looking forward to a better life ahead. 

She regularly meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of corn to sell.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is a woman with three children. She is 44 years old and of her children is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Miguela has a buy-and-sell spices business in the Philippines and requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of spices like unions, etc. to sell.

Miguela has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Miguela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of spices like unions, etc. to sell

loans.name: Santos Fermin

texts.es:
Santos, tiene la necesidad invertir en la agricultura, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar una bomba de mochila para fumigar sus cultivos y también adquirirá insumos agrícolas para acondicionar el terreno y sembrar sin dificultades.
Con el apoyo del crédito anterior las cosechas de maíz, frijol y maicillo han sido muy abundantes, su núcleo familiar se mantiene y actualmente sus recursos económicos han disminuido por lo que necesita de un nuevo crédito para mantener la continuidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos needs to invest in farming. He requires a new loan to purchase a backpack pump to fumigate his plants, and to get farming supplies to prepare the soil and plant seed without difficulty.

With the help of the previous loan, the corn, bean, and sorghum harvests have been very abundant. His immediate family is enduring and currently his financial resources have decreased, so he needs a new loan to ensure continuity of his business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack pump to fumigate his plants, and to get farming supplies to prepare the soil

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул, 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 2 детей. У нее среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бурул занимается животноводством, стартовав 35 лет назад, с 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бурул, на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 15 овец, лошадь. Примерно, доход от бизнеса составляет 19,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Burul is 60 years old, married and, together with her husband, raised 2 children. She has a secondary-school education. To provide the primary income for her family, Burul is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business 35 years ago with 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Burul's hard work, today she has 4 cows, 15 sheep and a horse. Approximate income from the business amounts to 19,000 som (KGS) per month. To continue developing her business, Burul requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount. Burul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en:
Cecilio is 34 years old, married and has two young children. He is a farmer while his wife stays at home to take care of their children. He plants and harvests rice to sell. He also pays laborer who helped him in the farming activities such as planting and harvesting rice. 

Now, he wants to improve his crop production, so he is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay the labor fees too. He hopes to keep improving his crop production and invest in improving his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay the labor fees too

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth has always been enthusiastic about farming. She has cultivated their farmland in Dumingag and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, Ruth applied for a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, and to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Ruth knows that she has to get things right to yield more income in this cropping season. In the future, Ruth hopes to buy a rice thresher and farm tractor for additional earnings for their family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, and to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is grateful that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan, which she used to buy more mineral water needed in her retail water business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan, which she will use to buy several gallons of mineral water, which she sells at retail price. Her earnings help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her.

Jenefer's dream is to expand her mineral water selling business. She prays for God's abundant blessing for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more containers of mineral water.

loans.name: Nagehan

texts.en:
Nagehan is married and has two children. In order to make a contribution to the family budget and to payments of their newly bought house, she was sewing and crocheting the edges of the scarves she has made at home. With her first loan she renewed her sewing machine. With her second loan she purchased bulks of fabric for her scarves. Her biggest dream is to open a store of her own and sell her products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nagehan hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Nagehan Hanım ev bütçesine katkı sağlamak ve aldıkları evin borcunu daha kolay ödeyebilmek için evinde yazma kenarlarına overlok çekerek bunları oyalıyor. Mayadan ikici kredisini kullanan Nagihan Hanım ilk kredi ile makinesini yeniledi. İkinci kredi ile toptan yazma aldı. Nagihan Hanımın en büyük hayali yazmalarını satacağı bir dükkan açmak.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Jose Nikerson

texts.es:
El socio Jose Nikerson se sigue dedica al negocio de venta de maquinas de contabilidad e informatica, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de maquinas. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar maquinas de contabilidad e informatica.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jose Nikerson continues working in the sale of accounting and computing machines.  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  By means of this work he wants to improve his family.  His dream is to increase his machine sales.  

He is asking for the loan to purchase accounting and computing machines.  He is happy about the loan and promises to repay according to the agreement.

loans.use: To purchase accounting and computing machines

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen signed her membership in 2012. She has accessed a loan for her farming activities. For this cropping season, she applied for another loan to pay for the leveling and cleaning of dikes. She wants to make sure that everything is ready for her farming activities. Helen hopes to have a good harvest so that she can purchase another piece of land to cultivate.

loans.use: to pay for the leveling and cleaning of dikes.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 28 years old and is married with two wonderful children. Her husband works in construction and is also a farmer. Narine greatly helps her beloved husband with the farm. Their farm is a rather big one and they do not have enough time to manage all of the work that it needs. Narine is a very active and cheerful person and usually she does all kinds of work easily and without any hardships. Lately she feels weak and unhealthy which causes her great discomfort and she would like to find out the problem.

Narine is requesting a 400,000 AMD loan to get to pass medical examination and solve her health problem.

loans.use: to pass medical examination and solve her health problem

loans.name: Erlita

texts.es:
Erlita tiene 39 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge, tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica al comercio de animales menores como gallinas, pollos, cuyes, entre otros, la venta de golosinas y comida es su actividad secundaria. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Erlita is 39 years old and has a stable home alongside her spouse.  She has a 15 year old son and lives in the Santo Tomas district, which is in the province of Cutervo, in the region of Cajamarca in the northern sierra of Peru.  The people of this district work in agriculture, ranching  and raising animals.  

She works in the business of small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, among others.  The sale of sweets and food is her secondary activity.  She has experience in this business and good personal as well as professional references in her district.  

The loan will be for the purchase of more animals to increase the stock of her business.  With this infusion she will earn more and thus be able to improve her life and her family's life.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of animals to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is a 38-year-old single woman with two children who are in school. She lives in both a town and a rural setting with her family, and she deals both in a retail shop and in cattle fattening.

She works 5 days a week and 12 hours per day, and she started her business to increase her family income. She acquired this loan to boost her mobile money business; demand is high, yet her capital is limited.

Her future hope is to expand her business so as to increase her family income, and her challenge is limited capital. She describes herself as an honest and hard-working woman who encourages lenders to continue helping businesspeople and organizing workshops for their clients to teach them how they can use the money lenders lend them.

loans.use: boost her mobile money business.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: Euleterio es un hombre de 40 años que vive en la población rural de Cocachacra ubicado en Arequipa. Se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Hoy en día tiene sembrado ajo orgánico en su terreno agrícola que es tratado con abono natural libre de insecticidas y es de muy buena calidad, este es vendido en su localidad a un precio justo. Como Eluleterio también se dedica a la ganadería, solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas que serán alimentadas con alimentos naturales de su propia localidad, espera poder vender leche cruda orgánica a un precio justo también. En el futuro Eleuterio espera poder mejorar su casa quitando las calaminas haciendo su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Euleterio is a 40 year old man who lives in the rural town of Cocachacra located in Arequipa. He makes a living working in agriculture and livestock. He currently has planted organic garlic on his land, which is treated with insecticide-free natural fertilizer, and is of very high quality, which he sells at a fair price. 

As Eluleterio also works in farming livestock, he is requesting a microloan to buy two cows who will be fed with natural foods from his own land. He hopes to sell organic raw milk at a fair price too. In the future, Eleuterio hopes to improve his house by removing the corrugated iron, and building his home out of cement.

loans.use: To purchase two cows that he will feed organically.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie is from Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  She is earning a living in her small grocery store business, supporting her husband who is a farmer, providing income for their family.  

To generate additional income, Jovie decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can access financial assistance from PMPC.  Consequently, she requested a loan to pay for fertilizer and herbicide,s and purchase more inventory for her store to increase sales.  

Jovie smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family a better life.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and herbicides and purchase more inventory for her store to increase sales.

loans.name: Mauricio Alexander

texts.es:
Mauricio de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado por razones de pocos recursos económicos, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 9 años de edad los cuales solo uno está estudiando.

Mauricio trabaja en la alcaldía en la parte de vigilancia  desde hace tres años, optó por ese trabajo por falta de oportunidades en el estudió, también cultiva maíz. Su trabajo en la alcaldía está a 4 kilómetros de su casa y el lugar donde cultiva está a 3 kilómetros, él utiliza una bicicleta para transportarse y su esposa se encarga de cuidar los cultivos cuando él no está.

Con este crédito Mauricio podrá comprar seis bolsas de fertilizantes y también pagará el alquiler del terreno donde cultiva.

Él sueña con  darles el estudio a sus dos hijos y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 26, studied until the fourth grade, due to a lack in economic resources. He is in a relationship and he has two children, ages three and nine, only one attends school.

Mauricio has worked in security at city hall for the past three years and he also grows corn. He chose this work because he lacked opportunities through his studies. His job at city hall is four kilometers from his home and the area he farms is three kilometers away, so he uses a bicycle to get around. His wife is in charge of the crops when he is not there.

With this loan, Mauricio would be able to buy six bags of fertilizer as well as pay to rent the land where he farms.

He dreams of providing his children with an education as well as improving his house.

loans.use: to buy six bags of fertilizer and to rent the land where he farms.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is a 39 year old man married with 3 children having two attending school.  He deals in the timber trade and does motorcycle riding (boda boda) as his major income sources, 

Matia is a new client who applied for a loan of UGX2,500,000 to add capital in his business of timber trade since he has market to serve but he is limited by capital to meet the available demand and make more income.  Matia thanks Ugafode for their financial assistance which he hopes will enable him to meet all family financial obligations and he has hopes of expanding his business.

loans.use: To boost his timber trade with the intention to expand his business

loans.name: Melba Yadira

texts.es:
Melba tiene 28 años, y desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la producción de café. Vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su pequeña finca la cual maneja bajo las normas de certificación de comercio justo.

Esta pequeña emprendedora es la que se encarga de la administración de su finca y junto a su esposo le han venido dando un buen manejo a sus plantaciones, que ha resultado en un incremento del 86% en su producción en los últimos tres años. 

Su expectativa ahora es combatir eficientemente las enfermedades que afectan el café y continuar aumentando su cosecha para obtener mejores ingresos. Para esto, ella está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento de su café en este ciclo.

Su sueño es hacer que su finca sea un modelo de productividad en la zona donde habita y que sus hijos puedan tener una buena base para su futuro
texts.en:
Melba is 28-years old.  For more than ten years, she has been making her living as a coffee producer.  She lives with her husband and their two children on their small farm.  They run their farm according to fair trade certification standards. 

This small entrepreneur is in charge of managing her farm.  She and her husband have been managing their plants well, which has resulted in an 86% increase in productivity in the last three years.  

Melba's hope now is to efficiently combat the diseases that affect coffee plants and to continue increasing her harvest so she can earn a better income.  To accomplish this, Melba is requesting a loan to guarantee her being able to maintain her coffee crop this cycle. 

Melba's dream is to make her farm into a productivity model in the zone where she lives.  She also wants her children to have a solid base for their future.

loans.use: to guarantee her being able to maintain her coffee crop

loans.name: Marie Jhanye.

texts.fr: Jhanye,  44  ans, vit en union libre. Elle a trois enfants. Elle vend des Produits cosmétiques. Avec l’appui financier de Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal, son activité a beaucoup progressé. Elle est à son 19ème prêt, et elle les a remboursés sans donner de retard. Elle continue à demander du crédit pour garder la progression de son activité.
texts.en:
Jhanye is 44 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children. 

Jhanye sells cosmetic [and hygiene] products. 

With financial support from Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal, her business has grown a lot. She is on her 19th loan, and she repays her loans on time. 

She continues seeking loans to maintain her business's growth.

loans.use: to buy sanitary napkins and body soap

loans.name: Maria Joy

texts.en:
Retailing helped Maria Joy's family survive.  She operates a sari-sari (general) store business.  She found the business easy and simple.

Maria Joy plans to expand her retailing business and has applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital.  She wants to buy grocery items like biscuits, canned goods, milk, sugar, and soy sauce to sell. 

Maria Joy smiles at the thought of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant more sugarcane to sell after harvesting

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes has more than a decade of experience running her business, finding pleasure in her farming activities.  At the age of 48 and a mother of six children, she never becomes tired of taking care of her farming activities.  

Paglaum Mulit-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) has met all her capital needs.  Recently, she obtained another loan to pay for land preparation and purchase fertilizers. 

In the future, Lourdes hopes to open a retail store, selling rice to the local community.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 39 years old, married and blessed with six children. 

He is a farmer and has been in the business for four years. He will be using the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer and herbicides for use on his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer and herbicides for use on his farm. He hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is a single  woman with four children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Dorah has been operating a rental house business for the past ten years. She rents to her neighbors. She mentioned tenants delaying early payment of their rents as a challenge to her operations.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase materials to repair her rental houses. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income, and of establishing a wholesale shop selling palm leaves in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her rental houses

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Romulo De Jesus

texts.es:
Romulo, tiene 66 años de edad, debido a los escasos recursos de su familia no pudo seguir estudiando, pero aprendió un poco a leer y escribir gracias a sus hijos que le enseñaron en casa; está casado y junto a su esposa han procreado tres hijos, de los cuales solo uno de ellos vive con ellos.

Romulo, desde muy joven se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura, puesto que sus padre le enseñaron ese trabajo para poder salir adelante.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar 4 sacos de abono, semilla y pagar el alquiler de la tierra, para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.
texts.en:
Romulo is 66 years old. Due to a lack of resources in his family, he was not able to continue his schooling, but he learned to read and write thanks to his children, who taught him at home. He is married and has had three children with his wife, only one of whom lives with them.

From a very young age, Romulo has made his living in agricultural work, since his parents taught him this work to get ahead.

The loan he is applying for is to buy 4 bags of compost, seeds, and to pay for the lease on the land, in order to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of compost, seeds, and to pay for the lease on the land.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a hardworking woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She runs a restaurant that sells both food and soft drinks. She started the business to support her family. She desires to educate her children to higher levels of learning and grow her business into a modern and standard hotel. Despite the desires, she has hardships of competition on top of increased food prices.

Zaina intends to use the loan to buy food and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy food and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rini

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rini, one of Ruma's agents. She lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about 5 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her only daughter. 

Rini owns a stall where she sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s very important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their child’s education. That's why she joined Ruma. She feels happy as well because, since she joined Ruma, she can contribute more to her community.

As her business grows, Rini needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to sell more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her they can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are. 

In the future, Rini’s goal with regards to Ruma is to provide her community with an e-commerce business, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

Rini is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase prepaid airtime credit which he will resell to community members who need to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is is from Carmona, Cavite, Philippines, married, and has children. She has been employed in a garment factory in Cavite for nine years through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.*

Vilma works as a clothing packer. She ensures that items of clothing are packed properly and are ready for distribution. The type of packaging used depends on the type, value, fabric, and destination of the garments. One of the main concerns of factory employees is how to meet the needs of their family. With the increasing cost of living, their monthly salary is not enough to adequately provide for their families. This forced Vilma to borrow from money lenders who charged very high interest rates and who require her to surrender her ATM (her salary is credited to her ATM) as her loan collateral. These low-income employees sadly have no access to bank loans. 

For this reason, Vilma is asking for your assistance to prevent her from submitting to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying them, since the loan payment is deducted every payday. She will greatly appreciate your positive response to her request to enable her pay her monthly obligations of her house and help her recover her ATM, to avoid being exploited by loan sharks. 

Vilma meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best in life.

loans.use: To pay for her house obligation.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en: Elpedia is married and the mother of six children. She is 57 years old and lives in Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a farmer who grows rice and other commodities to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. She has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Elpedia hopes to own another rice field to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Segundo Libardo

texts.es: Segundo es un señor de 64 años de edad, Segundo ha crecido en el campo y  hasta la actualidad se dedica a la agricultura, la esposa de Segundo se dedica a cuidad animales menores. Segundo tiene 5 hijos mismos que ya son mayores de edad. Segundo vive con su esposa y un hijo que trabaja al  jornal y a veces trabaja de chofer. Segundo solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra abono y fungicidas para sus cultivos de papas, alverja, habas y más productos que se dan en la provincia en la que reside.  Segundo tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando y seguir adelante con su esposa para tener una vejez digna, ya que mas adelante viviran solos, porque solo un hijo vive con ellos ya que los demas hijos ya viven aparte formando sus propios hogares.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 64-year-old man.  He grew up in the country and up until the present time he has always worked in agriculture.  Segundo’s wife words taking care of barnyard animals.  Segundo has five children, all of whom are adults.  He lives with his wife and one son, who works as a day laborer and sometimes as a driver.  

Segundo is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and fungicides for his potatoes, peas, beans, and other crops, which he grows in the province where he lives.  Segundo aspires to keep working and getting ahead alongside his wife to live a dignified old age, because later on he and his wife will live by themselves. Only one son lives with them because the others live on their own, starting their own homes

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 3 cartons of body cream, 3 dozens of rubber bowls

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy de 39 años, inició su negocio de venta de frutas, jugos naturales y bebidas al llegar a la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias ubicada en el departamento de Bolívar;  una ciudad con gran afluencia turística, en la que vio la oportunidad de generar ingresos para su familia,  al considerar que requiera de poca inversión para iniciar este negocio y se vendía muy bien no dudo ni un instante emprender este reto.  Sus compras las realiza en la central de abastos del centro de la ciudad y surte sus carretillas en su vivienda para luego trasladarse a las afueras del terminal de transporte, donde instala su punto de venta.  Esta actividad la realiza todos los días, a partir de las 3 p.m  hasta las 11 p.m. un horario amplio para que los viajeros y trabajadores puedan degustar de sus frutas y saludables bebidas. Nancy aplicó a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,   para comprar una mesa donde pueda laborar mejor y frutas al por mayor para surtir su negocio. Ella es madre de tres hijos a quienes desea ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida y comprarles una vivienda.  Su gran desafío ha sido reponerse de un robo que aconteció en su vivienda y hurtaron toda la mercancía de su negocio, sin embargo ella comenzó nuevamente con muchas esperanzas de prosperar.
texts.en:
Nancy is 39 years old, she started her business selling fruits, natural juices and beverages when she got to Cartagena de Indias, a city located in the department of Bolivar. This is a city with a great tourist turnout, where she saw the opportunity to generate income for her family. When she evaluated that it required a small investment to start this business and sales where good, she did not hesitate in launching this challenge.

She makes her purchases in the wholesale center of the city, stocks her cart in her house, then goes outside of the transportation terminal where she sells from.

She does this every day from 3 p.m. until 11 p.m. This is an ample schedule so that travelers and workers can try her fruits and healthy beverages.  Nancy applied for a credikiva, this is the first loan request she makes to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy a table where she can better prepare her fruits and to buy fruits in bulk to stock her business. 

She is a mother of three children and wants to provide for them better living conditions and buy them a home. Her great challenge has been to recuperate from a burglary that happened where she lives when they stole all her merchandise. However, she started again with a lot of hope to succeed.

loans.use: to buy a table where she can work and fruits in bulk to stock her business.

loans.name: Wabimanya Group

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 21-year-old Ugandan; he is married and has three children with two of them attending school. Tadeo is a farmer and an agricultural produce dealer, which has been his main source of income since 1998. He does this in his home area of Wabinyama and the surrounding areas.

He has applied for a loan of ugx800,000 through his Wabinyama group to buy agricultural produce in the form of corn, beans and millet grain. He expects to pay the loan back after he has sold and made profit. His dream for the future is to construct a family house since the one he is in now is not in good condition.
He faces challenges of limited capital and weather changes and the fact that his business is also seasonal.

The group appreciates the Kiva partnership and are committed to repay the loan as well as to maintain the partnership.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans and millet grain

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a 45-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a printing shop, her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members. Ayesha has been running her own beauty salon for past four years; she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e., creams, hair brushes and other accessories, for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purposes. Therefore, Ayesha has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Ayesha is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: she wanted to increase her polar business

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en: This is Murodjon. He is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and three sons in the district of B.Gafurov. Murodjon is a very hardworking, nice and dependable person. He is a loader. His work is very difficult and he cannot provide for his family. Currently Murodjon does not have income and it is very hard for him to live. For this reason Murodjon applied for a loan in order to buy a truck. With truck he can work faster and get good income. Murodjon hopes for your generosity and support.

loans.use: to buy a truck for his work.

loans.name: Anibal Omar

texts.es: Aníbal de 25 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que desde hace varios años se gana la vida con la venta de frutas y verduras, actividad que realiza en el mercado municipal y en la cual se ha apoyado para sacar adelante a su familia. Aníbal vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 6 años de edad el cual se encuentra estudiando con su apoyo. Aníbal desea construir un muro de contención, ya que su vivienda se encuentra construida en un terreno muy frágil y cerca de un deslizamiento de tierra, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro de contención que permita brindar mayor protección a su vivienda y de esta manera también proteger a su familia.
texts.en: Aníbal is 25 years old and is a hardworking man who has earned a living for many years selling fruit and vegetables. He does this in the local market and has relied on it to get his family ahead in life. He lives in his own home with his partner and his 6 year old child who studies with his support. Aníbal wants to build a retaining wall as his home is build on fragile land close to a landslide. This is why he is applying for a loan to FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a retaining wall that will give his home better protection and thus also protect his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a retaining wall that will give his home better protection.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos y cuyes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes entre otros.
La foto no fue tomada en su negocio, fue tomada en el lugar donde realizan las reuniones.
texts.en: Alejandra is a member of the communal bank COMUZONE I. This member continues to make her living raising small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. This member has had this business for some time and, thanks to the hard work she puts into it everyday, it is going well. This member would like to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in the same manner. This member is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and more. The photo was not taken in her business; it was taken at the place where the meetings are held.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and more.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA-SAN SALVADOR.
La socia Alejandrina alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de carnes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar carne entre otros.
La socia Alejandrina se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA-SAN SALVADOR communal bank.

Alejandrina sells meats and has had this business for a long time and it’s going well, thanks to her daily efforts.  She sells her merchandise to customers who request it and she wants to continue working so that she can support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy meat, and other things.

Alejandrina is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a widowed woman who has been blessed with four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a dairy farming business, offering retail sales and also selling at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase cow feed and medicine for livestock. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cow feed and medicine for livestock

loans.name: John Antonio

texts.es:
John es un joven de 20 años y vive en unión libre junto a su esposa que tiene 19 años de edad, viven en casa de sus suegros, lleva casado ya un año y no tiene hijos todavía. Ambos acabaron sus estudios de secundaria y tiene su título de bachiller.
Vive en la comunidad de Calpaqui que pertenece a la parroquia Eugenio Espejo de Otavalo, por el sector las personas son muy colaboradoras, todavía se ven que se desarrolla por el sector las llamadas mingas en las que las personas se reúnen para realizar trabajos por el bien de la comunidad. Las personas se dedican a diferentes actividades como por ejemplo la elaboración de alpargatas, la comercialización de todo tipo de granos, agricultura y cuidado de animales.
Su esposa trabaja como secretaria de un Abogado en la ciudad de Otavalo desde hace varios meses, como ella es quien actualmente aporta económicamente al hogar John desea ayudar y es por eso que decidió emprender el negocio de venta de CD’S.
El crédito lo van a utilizar en la compra de una quemadora de CD’S, CD’S en blanco, portadas y fundas. Ellos ya tienen experiencia en el negocio ya que hace algunos meses tenían un local de CD’S en la ciudad de Otavalo y después en  San Antonio, que tuvieron que cerrar por falta de tiempo para su atención, pero ahora John se encargará al 100% al negocio. De su anterior negocio tiene todavía cd’s para le venta, tablones para la exhibición, y una quemadora de CD’S que no funciona muy bien, es por eso que desean invertir en una nueva, John agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
John is a young man 20 years old who lives in a common-law marriage with his wife, who is 19 years old. They live in his in-laws' house. He has been married for a year already and does not yet have children. They both finished high school, and he has his diploma.

He lives in the community of Calpaqui which belongs to the Eugenio Espejo de Otavalo parish. The people in the area are very cooperative. The neighborhood still has communal labor, where people come together to do work for the good of the community. People make their living in different activities, for example making espadrilles, selling all types of grains, agriculture, and animal husbandry.

His wife has worked as a secretary for a lawyer in the city of Otavalo for several months. Since she is the one who currently supports the home financially, John wants to help. That is why he decided to start a business selling CDs.

They are going to use the loan to buy a CD burner, blank CDs, covers, and cases. They already have experience in the business, since a few months ago they had a CD store in the city of Otavalo and later in San Antonio, that they had to close due to a lack of time to tend to them. But now John will be 100% in charge of the business.

From his previous business, he still has CDs for sale, display cases, and a CD burner that doesn't work very well, which is why they want to invest in a new one. John is grateful to Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to launch his movie and DVD business, and with the income, begin a better lifestyle.

loans.name: Korn's Group

texts.en: A 43-year-old-mother of seven children, living in Kampong Cham province, Korn has been a rice and cassava farmer for twenty-five years. She could earn about 43,700KHR per day. Now she faces a problem of lacking funds to do farming, so she decided to lead a group to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and pay the fee for renting farmland. She hopes to earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay the fee for renting farmland.

loans.name: Adela De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Adela tiene 58 años de edad, estudió hasta 3°grado, por lo económico ya no pudo seguir pues eran 10 hermanos y para ayudar en los gatos del hogar abandonó la escuela, es madre de 6 hijos a quienes sacó adelante sola pues su pareja la abandonó, ya todos son mayores de edad y por lo tanto Adela vive solo con sus padres. 


Adela se dedica a la venta de frutas en buses desde que tenía 12 años, oficio que aprendió de su mamá, gracias a ese trabajo logró sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos y lo sigue haciendo para ayudar a sus padres, ella se levanta a las 5:00 am para preparar el desayuno, luego prepara la venta y a las 7:00 am comienza su jornada para terminar con las ventas a las 5:00 pm.


El crédito será invertido para comprar frutas al por mayor pues así le sale más cómodo y le saca más ganancias.

Su sueños son tener una tienda fuerte, mejorar su negocios de cocos y construir su propia casa pues hoy vive en la de sus padres.
texts.en:
Adela is 58 years old and studied until the third grade.  For economic reasons and because there were 10 siblings, she could no longer study.  To help out with household expenses, she left school.  She is the mother of six children, whom she brought up by herself because her partner abandoned her.  Now, they are all older; therefore, Adela just lives with her parents.

Since the age of 12, Adela has made a living selling fruit in busses, a job that she learned from her mother.  Thanks to this work, she has been able to bring her 6 children ahead in life, and she continues doing it to help her parents.  She wakes up at 5:00 am to make breakfast.  Later, she prepares for her sales, and at 7:00 am, she starts her workday in order to finish her sales at 5:00 pm.  

The loan will be invested to purchase fruit in bulk so that she can be more comfortable and make a better profit.  Her dreams are to have a robust store, improve her coconut business and to build her own house, since right now she lives in her parent’s house.

loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk so that she can be more comfortable and make a better profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Asuda

texts.en: Asuda is 31 years old, married and she has two kids. She is engaged in milk selling. She has three cows now. Asuda and her husband are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) and they live in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. The income her business generates is about 200 AZN per month, but it is too low to cover the basic demands of her family. Milk and dairy products are very popular in Azerbaijan, and that is why she decided to purchase an additional cow and calf. Her loan request is 1,500 AZN. Please support Asuda.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow and calf.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy compost and seeds

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
El Sr. Anastacio sigue   dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
 El socio Anastacio solicita el crédito para comprar abono y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Anastasio belongs to the “San Martin de Zurite” communal bank. This bank is located in Zurite, a village in the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

Anastacio continues to make a living from farming and ranching. He is grateful for the loan he has received and is committed to making his repayments on time. He is a responsible and dedicated person who supports his family.

Anastacio is requesting the loan in order to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil has a piece of farmland in Dumingag. He is a farmer who plants a variety of commodities. For this cropping season, he is focusing on rice farming. He has requested another loan to pay for land preparation. Ramil has big dreams for his children to all have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en: Esmaelita has been running her business for more than a decade. She finds pleasure in doing farming activities. At the age of 45 with five children to feed, she is doubling her effort to take care of her farming activities. She owes Paglaum for all her capital needs. Recently, she availed herself of another loan to pay for land preparation and purchase fertilizers. In the future, Esmaelita hopes to venture into other types of business to continuously support her family.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en: Dionesio is a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. He has a piece of agricultural land in Dumingag. As a hardworking father of five he endures backbone breaking labors to sufficiently provide for the needs of his children. For this cropping season, he availed himself of a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and chemicals for his farming activities. Dionesio wants to see all his children finish their studies and have stable financial status in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and chemicals for his farming activities

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Teresita is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia Margot pertenece al banco comunal DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS.
La  socia Margot alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales como pollos, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia Margot solicito el crédito para la compra de pollos entre otros.
La socia Margot se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Margot belongs to Dulce Nombre de Jesús Communal Bank.  Margot alternates her daily activities with her business raising animals such as chickens.  She has been in the business for a long time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to be able to keep working and helping her family.

Margot requested the loan to buy chicks and other things.  She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chicks and other things

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is determined to pursue her goals for her family. She and her husband cultivate a farmland in Mahayag that earns a quarterly income sufficient to provide for her family. She has been doing farming activities for two years and she hopes to acquire another piece of farmland in the future. To fulfill her dreams, she takes care of her farm and seeks a loan to pay for labor in mounting and sowing seed beds, basal fertilizers and compost.

loans.use: to pay for labor in mounting and sowing seed beds, basal fertilizers and compost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, ceramic flooring and sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Delia Teodocia

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer  de 42 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de informática.
Ella es inteligente, feliz, soñadora, optimista, emprendedora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Sus estudios los realiza en un instituto técnico situado en la ciudad sede de gobierno y capital político-administrativa del país, donde convive gente de todas las nacionalidades. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-17 grados centígrados.
Su vida la realiza en un cuarto alquilado construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de informática y se encuentra en 2 año de 5 que dura la carrera, le gusta comprender las dinámicas culturales contemporáneas, maneja las nuevas tecnologías de la comunicación y se prepara para manejar grandes flujos de información, “estudio y trabajo, necesito obtener mi titulación para obtener un mejor cargo dentro de mi empresa…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios, ella trabaja como supervisora de personal de recojo de basura pública.
