La ventaja de sus actividades es que no se cruzan los horarios, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar estudiando. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y obtener un mejor puesto de trabajo en su empresa, ella desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que trabaja y 2 años que estudia.
Es por esos motivos que Delia solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil para terminar sus estudios y obtener un mejor cargo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Delia is a 42 year-old single woman, without children. She is studying information technology.

She is intelligent, happy, a dreamer, optimistic, entrepreneurial, responsible and very hard-working. She is studying at a technical institute located in the country’s government headquarters and political-administrative capital, where people of all nationalities live together. It has a cool, dry climate with a temperature that varies between 1 and 17 degrees Celsius [about 35 to 65 degrees Fahrenheit] during the day. 

She lives in a rented room built of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof and wood floors. It has running water, electricity and a sewage system. 

She is studying information technology and is in the second out of five years of study. She likes learning about contemporary cultural dynamics. She handles new communication technologies and is preparing herself to manage large amounts of information. 

“I study and work. I need to earn my diploma so I can get a better position within the company I work for,” she says. 

Along with her studies, she works as a supervisor of public waste collection workers. The good thing about her activities is that her schedules do not conflict. The disadvantage is she doesn’t have enough money to buy a laptop to be able to continue her studies. 

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the five years that she has been working and the two years that she has been studying. 

For these reasons, Delia is requesting a loan to buy a laptop to be able to finish her studies and get a better position at her work.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to be able to finish her studies and get a better position at her work.

loans.name: Finc Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo FINC viven en una comunidad del Estado de México muy lejana debido a que difícilmente hay transporte público, para llegar a ella es necesario contratar servicio particular o caminar durante varios minutos a pie. En este lugar las personas tienen muy arraigadas sus tradiciones así como sus fiestas y actividades. La mayor parte de la población se dedica a la cría de animales como borregos, cerdos y pavos, además del cultivo de maíz.
   Anastacia es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre está al pendiente de su familia, en su comunidad de cariño le dicen Tachi. Está casada con el señor Joel y tienen cinco hijos de los cuales ya solo una niña pequeña depende de ellos pues estudia la educación primaria.
Tachi, tiene ocho años dedicada a la cría de cerdos, inició con la actividad porque en la comunidad donde vive es muy fácil reproducir y hacer crecer a estos animales. Una vez que han alcanzado un buen tamaño, los vende para la elaboración de carnitas o chicharrón, platillos típicos en México. Tachi recuerda que comenzó la actividad sólo con cinco cerdos y ahora ha llegado a tener hasta veinte al mismo tiempo.
   Afortunadamente no le resulta ningún problema vender los animales. Ahora, la única meta de Tachi es poder hacer crecer su negocio para abrir una tienda de abarrotes y así continuar pagando los estudios de su hija. Con el préstamo comprara más cerditos y alimento, "Los compramos desde pequeños pero si los cuidamos muy bien y alimentamos; en cuatro meses podemos venderlos y obtener muy buenos ingresos". 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Eusebio, Aidde, María Guadalupe y Lourdes quienes invertirán en la compra de borregos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la plaza del municipio, Tachi es quien vise el suéter azul con la bufanda*
texts.en:
The members of FINC group live in a community in the State of Mexico that is very distant due to there being hardly any public transportation. To get there, it is necessary to book a special service or walk for some time on foot. The people here hold their traditions very firmly, as well as their celebrations and their occupations. Most of the population raises animals such as lambs, pigs and turkeys for a living, as well as cultivating corn.

   Anastacia is a very hardworking woman who is always looking out for her family. In her community they fondly refer to her as Tachi. She is married to Joel and they have five children, out of whom only one little girl is their dependent as she is studying in primary school.

   Tachi has raised pigs for a living for eight years. She began doing this work because in the community where she lives, it is very easy to breed and raise these animals. Once they have reached a good size, she sells them for meat or pork rinds, typical foods in Mexico. Tachi remembers that she started out in the business with only five pigs and now she has managed to have up to twenty at a time.

   Fortunately, she has no problems selling the animals. Now, Tachi’s only goal is to be able to grow her business to open a grocery store, and thus continue paying for her daughter’s studies. With this loan she will buy more piglets and food. “We buy them from when they are very small, but if we feed and care for them very well, in four months we can sell them and get a very good income.”

   The other members of the group are Eusebio, Aidde, María Guadalupe and Lourdes, who will be investing in the purchase of lambs.

*The photo was taken in the municipal square. Tachi is the one seen in the blue sweater with a scarf.*

loans.use: to buy more animals and food.

location.town: Los lobos San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es:
Manuel de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta 3°grado, está acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica atender una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que estudian y dependen de Manuel.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, además junto con su esposa tiene una pequeña tienda en casa en la cual venden pan, azúcar, frijol, arroz, jugos, y todo relacionado con la canasta básica.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar maíz, arroz, frijoles, jugos, galletas, pan, frutas y verduras para surtir su tienda.

El sueño más grande de Manuel es poder darles el estudios a sus hijos y también mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel is 37 years old. He studied up until 3rd grade. He is married and his partner earns a living looking after a small shop that they have in their home. He has two young children who study and who depend on Manuel.

He has worked in farming since he was 12 years old, he learned this from his parents. Also, along with his wife he has a small shop at home in which they sell bread, sugar, beans, rice, juice, and everything relating to basic necessities. 

He needs this loan to buy corn, rice, beans, juice, biscuits, bread, fruit and vegetables to stock up his shop.

Manuel's biggest dream is to be able to give his children their studies and also improve his home.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, beans, juices, biscuits, bread, fruit and vegetables to stock up his shop.

loans.name: Esther Rosmery

texts.es:
Esther es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, estudia la carrera de lingüística y trabaja como peluquera.
Ella es inteligente, dulce, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su carrera la cursa en un instituto comercial en la zona ‘Pampahasi’, sitio caracterizado por encontrarse sobre una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son pendientes y empinadas. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Esther es de tez morena, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello negro largo peinado a la moda, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Su vida la comparte en casa de sus padres que trabajan como transportista y su madre tiene una tienda de barrio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas natural y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de lingüística y se encuentra en segundo año de cinco años que dura la carrera; disfruta traduciendo textos, se entusiasma aprendiendo la fonética de las diferentes lenguas y le gustaría hablar todos los idiomas del mundo, “estudio idiomas y trabajo para pagar mis gastos, mis principales necesidades son las que corresponden a mi carrera…” comenta. La ventaja de su trabajo es que es independiente y no se cruzan los horarios, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para pagar los gastos universitarios como la compra de libros, pago de fotocopias, y otros. Su sueño es terminar su carrera y salir profesional, Ella desea realizar la compra de libros y pagar diferentes gastos como fotocopias y otros materiales de estudio para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que estudia y trabaja. 
Es por esos motivos que Esther solicita un préstamo para pagar sus gastos universitarios para terminar su carrera y salir profesional
texts.en:
Esther is a young woman who is 20 years old, single, has no children, is studying to earn a linguistics degree and works as a hairdresser.  She is intelligent, sweet, caring, empathetic, sincere, responsible and very hardworking.  She is pursuing her degree at a business school in the ‘Pampahasi’ area, a place known for its mountainside location, where the streets are sloped and steep.  It has a cold, dry climate with a temperature ranging between 0 and 12 degrees Celsius.

Esther is dark-skinned, has brown eyes, wears glasses, has long black hair that is fashionably styled, and has a short, thin stature.  Her native language is Aymaran, which she speaks with her family, while she speaks Spanish in the general public and for her studies.  She lives in her parent’s house.  Her father is a transportation worker and her mother has a neighborhood shop.  They live in their own house built of brick and cement with a metal roof, wooden floor, running water, electricity, natural gas and a septic system.  

She is studying a linguistics degree and is in the second year of the five-year degree.  She enjoys translating texts, is excited to learn the phonetics of different languages, and would like to speak every language in the world.  She comments, “I study languages and I work in order to cover my expenses.  My main needs are those pertaining to my degree.”  

An advantage of her work is that it is independent and her schedules do not conflict.  A disadvantage is her lack of money to pay for her college expenses, such as buying books, paying for photocopies, as well as others.  Her dream is to finish her degree and become a professional.  She wants to purchase books and cover various expenses such as photocopies and other school materials in order to continue with her studies.  This is the second sequence of loans with this institution in the two years that she has studied and worked.  It is for these reasons that Esther is requesting a loan to pay for her college expenses in order to finish her degree and become a professional.

loans.use: to pay for her college expenses in order to finish her degree and become a professional

loans.name: Delmis

texts.es:
La señora Delmis de 32 años edad,  es madre  soltera  tiene cuatro  hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa  propia se dedica desde hace 01 año al negocio de elaboración y venta de baleadas y fresco natural sus clientes son los amigos y personas que transitan todos los días por su negocio.
Doña  Delmis es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de harina, soda, huevos, café, sal y aceite para tener más productos  que ofrecerles a los clientes que la visitan.
Doña Delmis  desea ampliar el negocio y poder comprar la materia por para elaborar su producto al por mayor y también comprarse otra estufa para la producción de baleadas,  con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y tener más utilidades, es un cliente que solicita su primer crédito.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Delmis is 32 years old. She is a single mother and has four children, who are her dependants. She lives in her own home.

For the past year, she has been earning a living by making and selling "baleadas" [thick flour tortillas filled with a variety of ingredients] and fresh fruit drinks. Her customers are her friends and the people who walk by her business on a daily basis.

Delmis is a hard-working woman, who has the desire to do well for herself. She is requesting a loan to buy flour, sodas, eggs, coffee, salt, and oil in order to have more products to sell to her customers.

Delmis wants to expand her business and buy ingredients to make her products in bulk. She also wants to buy another stove, which she will use to make "baleadas."
 
With the loan, she hopes to improve her business and generate more profits. This is her first loan.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – May, 2015

loans.use: to buy flour, sodas, eggs, coffee, salt, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Liliana Isabel

texts.es: Liliana de 30 años reside en el municipio de Tubará y a través de un programa de gobierno impulsado por la Gobernación del Atlántico, accedió a un curso de elaboración de cazado, en el que aprendió este arte con el que inició su taller de calzado, hoy en día fabrica sandalias y bolsos para dama en diferentes materiales, texturas y diseños.  Liliana cuenta con cinco años de experiencia y ha alcanzado éxito en su negocio por su dedicación y empeño, todos los días a partir de las  8 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. los habitantes del sector pueden llegar a su taller y realizar sus encargos o comprar lo que más les agrade.   Su principal desafío es fidelizar a su clientela al ofrecerles calidad en sus productos a precios de oportunidad, para ello está aplicando a su primer Credikiva con el que planea comprar materias primas; material sintético, suelas y goma.  Con esta inversión pretende aumentar la producción y realizar compras al por mayor para tener mejores márgenes y cumplir con su premisa de servicio “excelente calidad a precios de oportunidad”.  Ella es madre de una niña de 14 años y desea ofrecerle bienestar.
texts.en:
Liliana is 30 years old and lives in the town of Tubará. Through a government program promoted by the Gobernación del Atlántico (Government of the Atlantic), she was able to take a course on shoe-making in which she learned this art and then opened up her shoe-making shop. 

Today she makes sandals and handbags for women out of different materials, textures and designs. Liliana has five years of experience and has become successful in her business thanks to her dedication and determination. Her shop is open every day from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. during which time her neighbors can visit  to conduct business or buy what most pleases them. 

Her greatest challenge is to retain her customers which she does by offering quality merchandise at good prices. In order to do this she is applying for her first Kiva loan with which she intends to buy raw materials such at synthetic material, soles and rubber. This investment will allow her to increase production and to purchase at wholesale so she will have better margins while staying true to her motto, "excellent quality at good prices." 

She is the mother of a 14-year-old girl and wants her to have a sense of well-being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as synthetic material, soles, and rubber.

loans.name: Susarkan

texts.ru: Сусаркан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто откликнулся и помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве имеется: 4 коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сусаркан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Сусаркан планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и по-прежнему планирует накопить средства на обучение сына  в университете.
texts.en: Susarkan successfully repaid her loan, using it as directed. She is very grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who responded and helped her with the financing. Today, her farm contains 4 cows and 10 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Susarkan requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock. Susarkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing her livestock quantities and still saving money for her son's university education.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Josué Balmore

texts.es:
Josué tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene un hijo que apenas es un bebé, también con Josué viven sus padres pero solo su esposa e hijo dependen de él.

 
Josué trabaja en un taller de estructuras metálicas desde hace unos 6 años, fue con su hermano con quien aprendió este oficio y también tiene un taller de carpintería, el taller lo tiene en su casa ya que ahí tiene todo el equipo de trabajo, y labora en un horario de 6:00 am hasta terminar con el último encargo.


Este préstamo lo necesita para terminar de pagar un terreno.

Sus sueños en futuro son poder construir su vivienda y que su hijo pueda estudiar.
texts.en:
Josué, aged 26, studied up to ninth grade. He is in a relationship, and his life partner is a homemaker. They have a son, who is only a baby. Josué's parents live with them, but only his life partner and their son are his dependants.

For six years, Josué has been working at a blacksmith's workshop. He learned this trade from his brother. He also has a carpenter's workshop, which is located at his home because he has all his work tools there. He starts working at 6:00 a.m., and he finishes when he is done with the last order. 

He is requesting this loan to finish paying his plot of land.

His dreams are to be able to build his house and to provide his son with an education.

loans.use: to finish paying his plot of land.

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jhoanna es una joven de 22 años de edad, es bachiller y actualmente está soltera, vive con su madre a quien trata de ayudarles siempre que puede.

Jhoanna trabaja en un negocio de lácteos vendiendo, queso, quesillo y crema, anteriormente trabajó en el campo cortando caña. 
Su trabajo actual está a 36 km. de su casa y viaja en bus y trabaja en un horario de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm.  
 

El crédito será utilizado para comprar ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y pagar mano de obra para terminar de construir un cuarto en la casa de su madre.

Su sueño es retomar sus estudios y ser enfermera, construir su propia casa y más adelante formar una familia.
texts.en:
Jhoanna is a 22 year-old girl and a high school graduate. She is currently single and lives with her mother, whom she tries to help whenever she can. 

Jhoanna works in a dairy shop selling cheese, fresh cheese and cream. She previously worked in the fields cutting cane. 
Her current workplace is 36 km away from her house. She gets there by bus and works from 7:00am to 4:00pm.  
 
The loan will be used to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and pay for the workforce to complete the construction of a room at her mother's house.

Her dream is to go back to school and become a nurse, build her own house and start a family later on.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and pay for the workforce to complete the construction of a room at her mother's house.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma has a vegetable garden. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and also earning income for her family. 

As a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, (PMPC), she seeks financial help to purchase a variety of vegetable seedlings that she can grow and sell, as well as to pay for the land and seedbed preparation. 

In the future, Emma wishes to become the supplier of vegetables in her town and surrounding neighborhoods.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetable seedlings that she can grow and sell, as well as to pay for the land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito, de 66 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado y vive únicamente con su esposa, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y es la única que depende de él.
	
Tito, se dedica específicamente al cultivo de sandía desde hace 20 años, su padre fue quien le enseño todo lo que sabe, trabaja en el cultivo de sandía en las mañanas y en la tarde trabaja en los otros cultivos.

Tito, necesita el crédito para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y para comprar un par de hachas para cortar madera.

Tito, sueña con tener la mejor cosecha posible de este año.
texts.en:
Tito is 66 years old, he attended school until the third grade, is married, and lives only with his wife.  His wife is dedicated to the household chores and is the only one who depends on him.

Tito makes a living specifically by growing watermelons for 20 years. It was his father who taught him everything he knows. He works to growing watermelons in the mornings, and in the afternoons he works in the other crops.

Tito needs the loan in order to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and to buy a pair of axes in order to cut wood.  Tito dreams of having the best harvest possible this year.

loans.use: to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and to buy a pair of axes in order to cut wood.

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
María de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta 2ª grado, está acompañada y  su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 10 hijos pero en casa solo viven 3 y son los únicos que dependen económicamente de ella.

María se dedica a la siembra de maíz y ajonjolí, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la actividad, la parcela le queda  a 1 hora de su casa y se va caminando,  su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am y regresa con sus hijos y su esposo a las 11:30 am.


María necesita este crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, etc.

Ella siempre ha soñado con mejorar su vivienda y espera lograrlo algún día.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old and has a second-grade education. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. She has 10 children, but only 3  live with her in their home and are they only ones that depend on her financially.

María cultivates corn and sesame seed. She has been doing this for over 20 years. She walks to the plot of land that she works on, which is an hour away from her house. Her work schedule starts at 6:00 AM and she returns with her children and her husband at 11:30 AM.

María needs this loan to buy farm supplies such as manure, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.

She has always dreamed of improving her home and hopes to be able to do it one day.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as manure, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence is a married woman with three children who all attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her place of operation.
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities such as growing, caring for her crops and harvesting, and is earning income, as well. Carmelita has supported her husband doing multi-cropping type farming.

Like a farmer, Carmelita has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase vegetable, rice and corn seedlings, fertilizer and bags of chicken manure.

Someday, Carmelita hopes to purchase a parcel of agricultural land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable, rice, and corn seedlings, fertilizer and bags of chicken manure

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette is a 38 year old Lebanese married woman for two aged school children. In 2012, she started working from her home as a private teacher to provide her family with extra financial support. She arranged a special room where she welcomes her students. To better improve her job, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new laptop. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to develop more her work.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for use as a private teacher

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale in the market for more income gain

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 41 years old, and all her children are in school.

Virginia has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish and other supplies for her business.

Virginia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 31 years old. He lives in Kapan town with his wife and 2-year-old son. The only source of income for the family is his Davit's income from construction works. He provides different construction works for local people in Kapan town and gathers income for his family.
 
 With the received loan, Davit plans to purchase tools and materials needed for providing construction work. He will purchase all the needed materials such as cement and other tools needed for his work. The start-up loan program , which is the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International,  provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products

Davit hopes to receive lenders' support and improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing construction work

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with four children, all of whom don't attend school. She lives at her rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waiting too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to fix the roof of his house and protect his children.

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Clifford is from Tambulig. He is 33 years old and is married with 3 children.

With his desire to provide the best for his family, he was inspired by the microfinance program extended by PMPC. Clifford firmly believed that PMPC could helped him for his capital needs, so he applied a loan to start his chicken lechon business. He has been in the business for two years now supporting his family's needs. Recently, Clifford reapplied for a loan to pay for his dressed chicken stocks to maintain his inventory and serve his customers well.

He deeply wishes to maintain his membership in good standing and live comfortably with adequate income from his business.

loans.use: to pay for his dressed chicken stocks to maintain his inventory and serve his customers well.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 52 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Betty works very hard to provide for them.

Betty runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Betty has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Betty would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna is 47 years old and has one child in school.

Lorna has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lorna has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 55 years old and has five children. Yolanda is a married woman.

Yolanda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Yolanda has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Yolanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old with three children. Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Maria has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Edna works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production/vending business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Janier Dayan

texts.es: Janier, un apasionado por la culinaria, desde muy niño su gusto por este arte estuvo afianzado por sus padres y hermanos quienes han trabajado en negocios de comidas. Hoy en día se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas rápidas en su negocio ubicado en un barrio del Sur de Barranquilla, donde ofrece deliciosos platillos; perros calientes, hamburguesas, salchipapas, carne asada, chusos, mazorcas desgranadas entre otros.  Los vecinos del sector pueden degustar de sus comidas de lunes a jueves en el horario de 3 p.m. a 11 p.m. y los viernes, sábados y domingos a partir de las 2 p.m. a 2 a.m.  Janier se aprovisiona de suficientes insumos como panes, embutidos, carnes y salsas para poder cubrir la demanda y realiza sus compras en graneros, supertiendas y supermercados.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar bebidas gaseosas, cervezas, licores e insumos y materias primas utilizadas en la preparación de las comidas.  Esta inversión beneficia los márgenes de ganancia puesto que Janier va a realizar compras al por mayor.  Janier desea a futuro incrementar y fortalecer el capital de trabajo, en consecuencia incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Janier has been passionate about cooking since he was very young, and his enjoyment of this art was reinforced by his parents and brothers, who have worked in food businesses.  

Today he works preparing and selling fast food in his business, located in a neighborhood in the southern part of Barranquilla. There, he offers delicious meals, such as hot dogs, hamburgers, French fries with sausage, grilled beefsteak, shish kebabs, and fresh corn dishes, among other things. The neighbors in his area can enjoy his food Monday through Thursday, from 3:00 P.M. to 11:00 P.M. and Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays, from 2:00 P.M. to 2:00 A.M.

Janier stocks up on enough supplies, such as bread, cold cuts, meat, and salsa, to be able to meet demand, making his purchases in grocery stores, superstores, and supermarkets.

Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase soft drinks, beer, liquor, and basic ingredients used in the preparation of the meals. This investment will benefit his profit margin, since Janier will be making wholesale purchases. 

In the future, Janier wants to increase and strengthen his working capital, and as a result, increase his sales and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer, liquor, supplies, and basic ingredients used in the preparation of the meals.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a single mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 25,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Bun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun, born in 1981, is a Thai ethnic woman who joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January 2002. She is always an exemplary member who strictly complies with the regulations, policies of M7-MFI and helps other members in her group when they was faced with difficulties in their lives. She is living with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. The annual income from 8000 square meters of cultivated land for coffee and corn is about VND 45 to 50 million. Nevertheless, after deducting all costs, the income is just enough to cover the living expenses and saved a small amount. However, that saved amount is not enough to buy seeding corn for the coming crop; therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the production with high productivity, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy seeding corn for her farm in order to provide for her family

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en: Jacinto is a 65-year-old widower from Badian, Cebu. He relies on his business which is selling of school supplies. This business has been in existence for six years and still thriving. Jacinto is asking for a loan of PHP30000 to buy stocks of school supplies next month. He will use the money to buy notebooks, paper, pens, glue, crayons, bond papers, ruler and pencils. Jacinto is excited to make the most profit this start of school year with the help of the loan. In the future, he hope to make his business bigger and better in profitability.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, paper, pens, glue, crayons, bond papers, ruler and pencils

loans.name: Las Chambitas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS CHAMBITAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Anace ella es soltera y tiene 64 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the communal bank "Las Chambitas."  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.  

The member Anace is 64 years old, single, and has two children.  She works in her craft business.  She sells cloth, sweaters, blankets, and looms.  She also sells different fabrics.  She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm.  She has been in this business for 8 years and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her business selling fabrics and looms.  She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, sweaters, and looms.  

Anace is grateful to those who are part of this dream through these means, and commits to pay her installments on time.  

The other members make a living with their businesses selling crafts, clothing, books, and groceries.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sweaters, and looms.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is thirty years old and from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. She has four children aged from four to thirteen years. Her husband is a security guard and barely earns enough to cover their needs for food.

Beatriz has been raising and selling hogs for about three years now. She is also farming rice for a living. She is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy more piglets to raise. With the loan she can develop her business to augment her income

Beatriz’s desire is to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana, 49, is married and from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband operate a transportation business using their motorized tricycle. Income from this operation is used to cover their daily needs.

Bebiana is requesting a loan to buy a new tire and sprocket and pay for maintenance on her tricycle like payment for vulcanizing (a chemical process for converting natural rubber or related polymers into more durable materials via the addition of sulfur or other equivalent curatives or accelerators). She wants to raise their income so that she can improve her home. Any additional income will be used to reinvest in the business and put into savings.

loans.use: to buy a new tire and sprocket and pay for maintenance of her tricycle like the vulcanizing cost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks of sodas for sale to clients and earn a living from it.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 34 years old with five children. With three children in school, Rosalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosalyn has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Rosalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eva is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

Eva  has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Eva has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her motorcycle business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children who both attend school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past five years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating her hairdressing skills in the future.She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 32 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Janet has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed from NWTF twice in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Henry Alcides

texts.es:
Henry de 40 años de edad, solo estudió hasta 9° grado, no pudo continuar por motivos económicos, está casado y su esposa se dedica a la sastrería, han procreado 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando y dependen de ellos, él a veces le ayuda a su esposa en la sastrería.

Henry es comerciante, a  él le pagan por salir a vender productos a la calle, vende ropa, colchones, mesas, ventiladores etc. Decidió dedicarse a esto porque la necesidad de ganar dinero para su familia y porque es algo que le gusta.

Él ha decidido independizarse, es por eso que necesita este crédito para comprar ropa, colchones, mesas, roperos, ventiladores para iniciar su propio negocio.

Su sueño es darles buena educación a todos sus hijos y piensa que todo es posible con su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
Henry is 40 years of age and only finished school through the 9th grade. He could not continue for economic reasons. He is married and his wife makes a living in tailoring. They have 4 children who are in school and depend on them; he sometimes helps his wife in tailoring. Henry is a merchant. He is paid to go out and sell products in the street. He sells clothes, mattresses, tables, fans, etc. He decided to make a living in this because of the necessity to earn money for his family and because it is something he likes. 

He has decided to become independent and this is why he needs this loan to buy clothes, mattresses, tables, wardrobes, and fans to start his own business. His dream is to give all his children a good education and he thinks it is all possible with his effort and with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to buy clothes, mattresses, tables, wardrobes, and fans to start his own business.

loans.name: Héctor Carlos

texts.es:
Héctor de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta 4° grado en su cantón, actualmente está casado y tiene una hija menor de edad que depende de él.

Héctor trabaja en la agricultura, tiene alrededor de 40 años de experiencia en esta actividad que aprendió de su padre,  también se dedica a cuidar ganado y cerdos con el objetivo de comercializarlos.


Él necesita mucho este crédito para comprar fertilizantes para el aplicar al cultivo de maíz, comprara 5 quintales de fórmula, 3 quintales de sulfato y herbicidas.


Su mayor sueño es obtener buenas cosechas y seguir con su negocio de comercio de ganado y cerdos.
texts.en:
Hector, 54 years old, studied up to 4th grade in his country subdivision. He is now married and has a dependent minor daughter. 

Hector works in agriculture, and has around 40 years of experience in this business which he learned from his father. He also works in raising cattle and pigs with the objective of selling them. 

He needs this loan very much in order to purchase fertilizers that he will apply to maize cultivation. He will buy 5 quintales (500 lbs) of formula and 3 quintales (300 lbs) of sulfate and herbicides.

His biggest dream is to have good harvests and to continue with his cattle and pigs trade business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to apply in the cultivation of maize; to buy 500 lbs of formula, 300 lbs of sulfate and herbicides.

loans.name: Karen Patricia

texts.es:
Karen es una joven de 25 años de edad, culminó sus estudios de bachillerato, está casada y aún no tiene hijos, por lo tanto solo vive con su esposo.

Karen se dedica a la siembra de maíz y ajonjolí, la actividad la aprendió de sus padres y ahora la realiza con su esposo, cuando era soltera vendía tostadas y otros antojitos en la calle. La parcela donde cultiva está a 30 minutos de su casa y se transporta en bus.


Ella solicita este préstamo  CrediCampo para comprar medicinas pues se encuentra mal de salud.

Ella sueña para un futuro reparar el techo de su casa pues le ayudará a estar mas protegida durante el invierno.
texts.en:
Karen is a 25-year-old woman.  She completed her high school studies.  She is married and lives just with her husband since they don't have any children yet.

Karen works growing corn and sesame.  She learned this occupation from her parents and now she does this with her husband.  When she was single, she sold “tostadas” [plaintain chips] and “antojitos” [traditional corn-based dishes] in the street. The piece of land that she cultivates is 30 minutes from her house and she gets there by bus.

She is asking for this Credi Campo loan to buy medicine since she is in poor health.

Karen's dream for the future is to repair the roof of her house since this will help her be better protected during the winter.

loans.use: to buy medicine since she is in poor health

loans.name: Samaleswari Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, eight self-dependent women of Paramanandapur village of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India formed a group named Samaleswari. The main objective is to get economic security through expanding their existing businesses and development of their social livelihood by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Guntala is the most active and energetic lady of this village and has taken a decision to improve herself. This outstanding lady is aged about 40 years. In the photo, she is sitting in the first row, the first person from the left hand side with a raised hand. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For ten years, Guntala has been engaged in a cloth business with the help and support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of Rs. 8,500 from her occupation, but the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family.

So, Guntala decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business by debt in the form of a loan. She will purchase different types of modern, ready-made clothes and clothing pieces from the wholesale market. Through this, Guntala hopes that it will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house.

The other seven members of the group are also engaged with different small businesses such as a snacks (pampad) business, vegetable vending, tailoring, betel shop, milk selling, general store, etc. They also can develop themselves through post-loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase different types of modern, ready-made clothes and meet the demands of the market.

loans.name: Hoan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoan, born in 1986, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives mainly based on cultivation and breeding. The family has about 8000 square meters of cultivated land for coffee, but the income is just enough to cover the living expense and paying for their children’s education fees. She intends to build a sanitary toilet  but her saved amount is not enough to buy materials. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy materials to build a sanitary toilet.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she expects that the loan amount will help her family have a better living condition in the coming period.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a sanitary toilet for the health of her family

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is a working mom with four children; they live in Tabasco with her mother-in-law. Every morning Angela wakes up at dawn to go to work so she can save enough to put a roof over her children’s heads. Angela and her husband make around USD 12,000 a year. Finally, after years of hard work and saving as much as they can, they can begin working on their home so their children can grow up in a homey and safe environment. Nonetheless, they need a loan so they can finish paying for all of the necessary materials and start building right away. Angela and her husband will work on the construction of their home, along with certified technicians who will provide all the assistance and support needed to make sure their new home meets all the safety and quality standards.

loans.use: to finish paying for materials needed for her home

loans.name: Jam Group

texts.en:
Maybel is the featured borrower of JAM group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work as housekeepers and support their beloved families. 

Maybel is a 22-year-old single mother, who has been working as a housekeeper to provide for her beloved only child the necessary standards of living. She is working hard to make sure that her child can benefit from the best education and living to make sure he can acquire a better future.
 
Today, Maybel is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to send the money to her beloved child to cover his educational and to improve his living needs
Maybel is the first lady from the left. As for the other group members, Jocelyn is the first from the right, and Airies is the lady at the center.

loans.use: To send money to her beloved child in the Philippines to cover his educational costs and improve his living needs

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Filipinos love eating. It’s an advantage to Carmelita since she has chosen to run a small food stall along the road in her area in Caloocan City, Philippines. She sells pica-pica, a native snack which tickles the taste of her customers. Her husband, Jose works as a technician and is very supportive to her in her trade. Both work hard, and they willingly provide their family with all that they need. 

Carmelita wants to ask for help from you. She would like to take a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use this to buy additional raw ingredients to help improve her sales for her pica-pica. If her request is granted, it would most likely be a big help for her and her family.   

Being a selfless mother, Carmelita dreams that someday she will be able to have her own stall so that she would not have to rent anymore. Also, she always prays for the safety and health of her household. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients and help improve her sales for her pica-pica.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store. Lucia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell at her vegetable vending business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 37 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries. Melanie has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman and has four children all whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated an open air food stall business; her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality of products in the market.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat oil, wheat flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat oil, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 73 años de edad, es un hombre agricultor, está casado y solamente vive con su esposa.

La agricultura es el trabajo que le ha servido a Carmen para sostenerse económicamente y lo aprendió de su padres desde pequeño.  

Este crédito le servirá para comprar insumos agrícolas para llevar a cabo la cosecha de granos básicos.

Él espera seguir trabajando con esta institución para poder cumplir todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Carmen, 73, is a farmer.  He's married and lives only with his wife.  Farming is the work that has allowed Carmen to support himself.  He learned it from his parents at a young age.

This loan will allow him to buy agricultural inputs to harvest basic grains.

Carmen hopes to keep working with this institution so he can achieve all his goals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to harvest basic grains

loans.name: Leya

texts.en: Leya is 60 years, married and she is currently dealing in both cocoa farming and getting additional income from selling food stuffs like cassava flour, ground nuts and beans. She lives in Bundibugyo  Uganda with her family, and hopes to educate her children plus providing basic needs for them, but faces a challenge of limited capital. Leya has requested for a loan to to buy food stuffs to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs to sell and make funds to educate her children

loans.name: Darwing

texts.en:
Years ago, Darwing and his wife started building a home, but they soon had children and their expenses where higher, making it very difficult to save enough money to finish. They now have three teenagers and they want to build a proper home, so their daughter can have a separate room and some privacy from her two brothers. Their current home is made up of perishable materials, and during the hot months in Tabasco, it is almost unbearable to be inside. 

Darwing works every day at construction sites, earning close to USD 600. His two boys help out as much as they can with the income from occasional construction work. This has allowed Darwing and his wife to save up some money for their new home, but they still need a loan so they can get all the materials they need. 

With your help they can start working on their new home right away.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a new room for his daughter.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a hardworking mother living in Tabasco. Yolanda and her family have been living in their house for some time and have been saving to make some arrangements that will make this a better home for everyone. To Yolanda, giving every opportunity to her children is very important and give them a better life. Yolanda and her husband have an informal job and thus accessing credit from other financial institutions is almost impossible. Yolanda is asking for this loan to complete the payment of the materials needed for the construction. With this loan, she will also receive technical assistance and supervision to make sure that the construction will comply with all the safety and quality standards.

loans.use: to buy materials to build her house

loans.name: Vieng's Group

texts.en:
Vieng is a Thai ethnic woman who has been with the M7 MFI program since January 2009. She was one of the first members to join the program. She is living with her husband, her two sons and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so their income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount of money. However, because she has to pay for her children’s education fees, she does not have enough money to expand the scale of her breeding program. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in raising buffaloes and goats for meat.

She hopes the loan amount will help her family invest well in breeding, and that next year the breeding will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to invest in raising buffaloes and goats

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Это парень Алишер. Алишер молодой шустрый повар. Он любить готовить блюдо. Его научила его любимая мама. Сейчас он занимается поваром в ресторане около 5 лет. Он вкусно готовить. Он умеет готовить почти все блюдо. Алишеру 25 лет. Он женат и пока не имеет детей. Он в городе Душанбе живет вместе отцом, матерью и сестренкой. У сестренке скора свадьба. Родители готовятся к свадьбе. Алишер решил взять кредит и помочь родителям проводить  свадьбы сестры. За счет кредита он купить свадебные принадлежности. Алишер верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Он будет очень рад на Вашу поддержку. Поддержите Алишер!
texts.en:
This is Alisher. Alisher is a young and bright chef. He loves to cook. He was taught by his beloved mother. Now he has been working in a restaurant for the past five years. He cooks delicious food. He is able to cook almost any dish. 

Alisher is 25 years old. He is married and does not yet have children. He lives in Dushanbe city with his father, mother, and sister. His sister is getting married soon. Their parents are preparing for the wedding. 

Alisher has decided to take a loan and help his parents carry out his sister's wedding. He will buy wedding supplies with the loan. Alisher trusts in you and your support. He will be very happy for your support. Support Alisher!

loans.use: to buy wedding supplies for his sister's wedding.

loans.name: Jeremia...

texts.en:
Jeremia, who is in his mid 20s, is single with no children.  He has been running a general store for four years now.  He works from 06am to 9.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jermia's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase on the store inventory and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to take care of himself, loan repayments, paid rent for the store and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase on the general store inventory.  He dreams of making his store international.

Jeremia will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase his general store inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale for more income gain

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Ma. Nilda

texts.en:
Ma. Nilda is 56 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, Ma. Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

Ma. Nilda has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Ma. Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 23 years old, single and lives with his parents. He describes himself as ambitious with many goals. He currently works as a cashier in a department store, but hopes to grow in his professional life. 

He is asking for a loan to do some home improvements and repairs in his house such as plumbing and repairing some walls.

loans.use: to pay for some home improvements such as plumbing and repairing some walls.

loans.name: Phuc's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuc, born in 1992, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has four members including her husband, her son, her daughter and the family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is from cultivation and breeding, but the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and a saved  small amount. She wants to repair her house because it is downgrading but the saved amount is not enough to buy materials to repair the house. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose. 

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have money to repair their house and make it more spacious. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her house and also make it more spacious

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 38 years old and married with eight children. With seven children in school, Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Marivic has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is 56 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maxima is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maxima has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various kinds of hair oils for her husband to resell.

loans.name: Tuyet's Group

texts.en:
Tuyet is a Thai ethnic woman who has been with the M7 MFI  program since January 2013. Her family has four members, including her husband and her two children (one son and one daughter). The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation, and they have about 8,000 square meters of cultivated land. The income from cultivation, after deducting costs, is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family and save a small amount of money. She wants to buy fertilizer and sugarcane cuttings (seed canes) for the coming season, but the amount she has been able to save is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. 

She will work hard to get money to repay M7-MFI for the loan on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in cultivation with high productivity. Then, with the coming crop, her family will have a yield as much as double as the last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and sugarcane cuttings (seed canes)

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa 55 years old and married, with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Narcisa has a bakeshop business in the Philippines. Narcisa requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Narcisa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Narcisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery food production business

loans.name: Mihan Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
This group of five enterprising, dedicated women hail from Dahod, India. They are led by Sakilabanu who is standing in the center. Sakilabanu is a 38-year-old mother of two children. She manages the household expenses and medical expenses singlehandedly. The household income is INR 12,000, which is insufficient to meet household expenses and pay for her children's education. The monthly savings are just INR 3,000. Hence Sakilabanu thought of starting her business to supplement the family income. She started her tailoring business, which includes stitching clothes for women. With this business, she is currently earning INR 3,000. But she wants to earn more to support her children's education. Hence she came up with the idea to avail a loan to expand her business. 

She got together with four other women who share similar interests. The other women are determined to help their families and want to expand their existing businesses in tailoring, garment retail and vegetable-selling. Together the group seeks a loan of INR 72,000. Your loan will help these women earn more and provide a good education for their children. It will also pave the way for a good standard of living and happiness among these families.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 36 year old married woman. She is living with her husband and only one child. She is a housewife dedicating only to take care of her daughter and her husband, who works as a farmer to fulfill the family needs. 

Today, she is asking to take a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l; she will be utilizing the loan to pay her daughter nursery fees.  She said that she is very happy that she will be able to register her in the nursery.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's nursery fees

loans.name: Boanerges Ulpiano

texts.es:
A treinta minutos de San Miguel de los Bancos tenemos la Parroquia Nanegalito Barrio La Armenia un lugar con gente muy  humilde y  luchadora en este sector vive y trabaja el señor Boanerges de estado civil soltero, tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes.
En su vida ha tenido varios obstáculos uno de ellos fue no poder culminar sus estudios pero no se ha dejado vencer, actualmente tiene muchos conocimientos en labores artesanales las mismas que las aprendió con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, le han servido para poder tener otros ingresos y por ser una persona muy trabajadora y cumplida es muy reconocido en este sector.
Don Boanerges desea fortalecer su negocio, tiene en la finca de su madre varias vacas lecheras y entrega varios litros de leche diarios pero desea readecuar su establo debido a que por factores climáticos necesita mantenimiento, esto permitirá que tenga más comodidad para realizar sus labores diarias y podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos. 
Don Boanerges agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder pronto cumplir con sus sueños.
texts.en:
The neighbourhood of La Armenia, in the Nanegalito Parish, is located thirty minutes from San Miguel de los Bancos. This is a place where the people are very humble and hard-working. 

Boanerges lives and works in this area. He is single and has three children, who are of legal age and independent.

He has faced many obstacles throughout his life. One of them was being unable to complete his education; however, he has not given up. Currently, he is very knowledgeable in making handcrafted products, a trade he learned through a lot of effort and determination. His skills have helped him to generate an extra income. He is known in the area for being a very hard-working and reliable person.

Boanerges wants to strengthen his business. In his mother's farm, he has many dairy cows, and he sells several litres of milk every day. He wants to refurbish the barn, which needs maintenance because of the weather conditions. The barn renovation will make it easier for him to do his daily work, and he will be able to improve his income.

Boanerges is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunity they give him to improve his quality of life and to be able to fulfill his dreams in a short time.

loans.use: to repair the barn at his mother's farm and, in this way, improve his income.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 48 years old and a mother of three. She and her husband aim to educate their children so that they will earn a degree and be employed someday. 

Edwina's youngest daughter is now in fourth year of college taking pharmacy. Due to the high cost of school fees, they are not able to finance all of her schooling. 

For this reason, Edwina is requesting an educational loan of PHP 10,000 to pay the said tuition fee and miscellaneous fees of her youngest daughter. 

She hopes that she will avail her loan request in order to support the education of her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee and miscellaneous fees of her daughter

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn works raising pigs in Pines, Oroquieta City, Philippines. This is how she makes a living and supports her parents to sustain their family needs. Jenalyn’s lowest point was when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to access credit to support her business. Jenalyn  takes her PMPC membership as seriously as she does her hog-raising business. 
She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always be eligible for any financing needs. 

Jenalyn is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her piglets. In the future, her profit will help her build a concrete pig pen to improve sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her piglets

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure service business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs. Rowena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  purchase more items for her manicure and pedicure business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her manicure and pedicure business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 43 years old with ten children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy sugar, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Jessica has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Jessica aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sugar, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 54 years old, married woman with one child and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Estrelita requested a 21,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair.

She has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Estrelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 44 years old and has six children who are in school.

Rowena has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell, so her children may go to college

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 45 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Joyce works very hard to provide for them.

Joyce runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products and other groceries.

Joyce has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Joyce would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Virginia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 47 years old and married with six children.

Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Amelita has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell ready to wear.

Amelita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Tien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tien is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has three members, including her husband, her lovely daughter and she. The family is now living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is mainly from cultivation and breeding so the annual income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and a small amount is saved. She wants to raise breeding cows but that saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in raising breeding cows.

She hopes that thanks to the loan amount, it will help her family invest in raising breeding cows with high productivity, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7 MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising breeding cows.

loans.name: Nzilani

texts.en:
Nzilani is married and has seven children,  of whom one attends school, while the other six are adults. She lives at her own  house that  has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food ,water and electricity bill.

Nzilani has operated a food selling business, making dumplings, flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar, for her dumpling making business

loans.name: Djantoyerela I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. .
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil   avec  MARATOU , 1ère personne assise de la  gauche vers la  droite de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
