The 10 members of the group called Djantoyerela I  are married women with an average age of 40 and on average four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of Sanankoroba, second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth seasonal loan with the institution, with prior loans correctly reimbursed. 

Maratou, the first person sitting from left to right in the photo, grows peanuts and millet as her crops. With her loan she intends to buy farm supplies and seeds, and pay the fees for tillage to maintain two hectares. Her produce is sold right there in the village, in the market of Sanankoroba, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of dealers and consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 75,000 F CFA per season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover fees for tillage and buy farm supplies and seeds

loans.name: Ma. Nesheideth

texts.en:
Ma. Nesheideth is 28 years old with one child. Ma. Nesheideth works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Nesheideth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Ma. Nesheideth has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Ma. Nesheideth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Gulpari

texts.en:
Gulpari is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is single and lives in a village with her family. 

Gulpari has ten years of practice in agriculture. She has four heads of livestock that she keeps for further selling. She is well known among friends and neighbors. Her beginning business was keeping calves and doing business with them. Now, she has land where she wants to plant agricultural products. 

She is asking for financial support from Kiva and IMON to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and seeds. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and seeds.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Nimfa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending. Nimfa is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 58 years old and has six children. She is widowed and has one child in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mr Nouhou, c’est l’homme qui est habillé en ensemble avec le bonnet sur la tête et arrêté au bout derrière le Bélier sur la photo. 
Âgé de 64 ans, Marié, sa femme est ménagère. Mr Nouhou a fréquenté l’école coranique et il est père de 10 enfants, les dix enfants  fréquentent l’école coranique comme lui, et sont âgés de 5 ans à 20 ans.
Il fait l’activité d’embouche ovine depuis plus d’une décennie. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Après la vente son bénéfice peut varier entre 10 000 f à 15 000 f CFA. Avec ses profits il parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille : tel que couverture sanitaire, habillements, et alimentaires.
Mr Nouhou est à son cinquième cycle  et souhaite dans l’avenir avoir plus de fonds afin de développer son activité d’embouche ovine.
texts.en:
Mr Nouhou is the man in the photo that is dressed with a cap on his head and standing at the back of the ram. A married man, he is 64 years old, and his wife is a homemaker. Mr Nouhou has attended Koranic school and is the father of ten children, aged 5 to 20 and who all attend Koranic school like him. He has been a livestock farmer of sheep for over a decade. His supplies come from nearby markets. 

After making his sales, he profits can vary between 10,000 and 15,000 francs CFA. With the profits, he manages to meet the needs of his family: such as covering the costs related to healthcare, clothing, and food. Mr Nouhou is at his fifth cycle and hopes to have more funds in the future to be able to develop his livestock farming of sheep activity.

loans.use: to purchase rams to resell later

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 46 years old and married with eight children.

Rebecca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home-care products and other groceries.

Rebecca has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Rebecca aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, condiments, home-care products and other groceries

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 34 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

Lorena has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Alla Barika Ps1 Group

texts.fr: Salimata, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Cette brave dame fait la restauration depuis 10 ans maintenant. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour aller s'approvisionner en légumes, en vivres dans les villages environnant a bas prix pour préparer pour satisfaire ses clients. Cette brave dame a des employés qu'elle rémunéré mensuellement qui l'aide dans son restaurant. Elle a beaucoup de client parce que le service est rapide. Après ses ventes, elle pourra avoir un bénéfice qui l'aidera a continuer son activité et aussi de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salimata, the featured member, is married and the mother of three children, all in school. This good lady has been preparing cooked food to sell for 10 years now. She needs this loan to go and stock up on vegetables and foodstuffs in the surrounding villages at a low price, to prepare so as to satisfy her clients. 

This hardworking lady has employees whom she pays monthly to help her in her restaurant. She has a lot of clients because the service is rapid. After her sales, she will have a profit which will help her to continue her business and also take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, rice, and oil, to prepare dishes sold in her little restaurant

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental horticulture business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for a 40,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wires and nets for her landscaping business. She is thanking God and you for your good heart for the financial assistance that will be given to her that will surely cover her daily needs.

Evelyn wants to grow her business and have more clients She prays for God to continually bless her family with good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wires and nets for her landscaping business.

loans.name: Dilmurot

texts.en: Dilmurot is a careful man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1955. He is living in a village with his big family. He is married and has five children. He has years of experience in agriculture keeping livestock and trading animals in the market. He is a responsible, honest and patient person and has a good reputation among friends and neighbors. His wife is ill and needs treatment. He appealed to IMON, asking for help to pay for his wife's treatment in hospital. He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's treatment in hospital

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 32 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Regina works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Regina has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Regina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlen is 39 years old and has two children still in school.

Arlen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Arlen requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Arlen has been in this business for 16 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 57 years old and married with six children.

She runs agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Benita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Benita has been in this business for 1 year and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Benita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Benita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to  buy additional fishing nets, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Benita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Malyn

texts.en:
Malyn is 31 years old and married with six children.

Malyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Malyn has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from manicures and pedicures.

Malyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 46 years old and married with nine children, three in school. Wilma works very hard to provide for her family.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries.

Wilma has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio, de 57 años de edad, solo estudio hasta primer grado, actualmente está acompañado y tiene un hijo el cual ya no vive junto a él, su pareja tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual pasa atendiendo sus clientes.

Julio, trabaja desde muy joven en la agricultura, especialmente cultiva maíz, frijol y también cría ganado, por el momento cultiva dos hectáreas de frijol y también tiene una vaca la cual cuida mucho porque le provee leche todos los días.

Julio, anteriormente obtuvo un crédito para comprar ganado, ahora lo necesita para comprar abono, pesticidas y fertilizantes, para el cultivo de maíz, ya que necesita comprar insumos agrícolas.

El sueño de Julio, es poder vivir en una vivienda digna, ya que la que tiene está en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
57-year-old Julio only studied until first grade. Now he has a partner and a child who doesn't live with him any more. His partner has a small shop where she spends her time attending to customers.

Julio has worked in agriculture from a young age, especially growing corn and beans as well as raising livestock. At the moment he has two hectares of beans and he also has a cow that he takes great care of because it provides him with milk every day.

Previously, Julio obtained a loan to buy livestock. Now he needs it to buy compost, pesticide and fertiliser in order to grow corn, as he needs to buy farming supplies.

Julio's dream is to live in a decent home, since the one he has now is in a poor condition.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticide and fertiliser in order to grow corn.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan is a rural villager living in Banteay Meanchey province. She is 50-year-old mother of a child who is in school and has been a rice farmer for thirty years. Selling vegetable is the additional source of income for her family and she could earn about 19,200KHR per day to support her family’s need. 

Due to lack of funds from farming, she is now leading a group of two to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes to this loan will help her to earn more income and ability to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farming business

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Linh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Linh, born in 1982 is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She is living with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province.  Her son is at Grade 8 and her daughter is at Grade 1 of school.

Her family’s main occupation is running a small business, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the whole family. Because she has to pay much for her children’s education fees, their income is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in her children’s education.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her children have better learning condition, and then they will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education fees so they will have a brighter future

loans.name: Djantoyerela Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. .
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil   avec  SETOU , 1ère personne debout de la   droite vers la   gauche de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of Djantoyerela II Group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old, have four children, and all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of Sanankoroba, in the second administrative region of Mali.

These women work with microfinance institution [MFI] Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the MFI and the previous loans have been properly repaid.

The crops to be grown are ground nuts and millet, by Setou, the first person standing in the photo, right to left. With her loan, she plans to purchase inputs and seeds and pay the labor costs to maintain two hectares. After the harvest, the crop will be sold in the village and the market to a group of customers made up of resellers and consumers.

Setou expects to see an average profit of 125,000 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow her to [re]pay her loan as well as to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs and purchase inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is a hard-working woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is married and has one daughter. She is a calm, well-behaved and honest worker. She works at a culture house as an cleaning woman. Her family lives on the salary that she and her husband earn. Her husband is a guard at that same culture house. Previously, she got a loan from IMON to renovate her house and she was satisfied with the service of IMON. The standard of their living is modest but satisfactory. Svetlana’s husband is sick now. She wants to pay for his hospital treatment. She appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking financial support for her husband's treatment. She awaits your kindness and hopes for her husband's well-being.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's treatment in hospital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new tires for her son's vehicle so he can drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers.

loans.name: Rabi

texts.fr:
Mr RABI est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 06ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 01 va à l’école. Il a 08personnes en charge.
Mr est un boucher depuis 15ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés de bétail.
Il veut s’acheter 10 animaux pour tuer et revendre.
Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité. Mr ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr. Rabi is married and the father of two children. The eldest is six, and the youngest is two. One of them goes to school. Both go to school. He has eight people to support.

Mr. Rabi has been a butcher for 15 years. He gets his supplies from animal markets. He wants to buy 10 animals to kill and resell.

He wants to use the profits to reinvest in his business. He ambitions to build a house on his lot.

loans.use: to buy 10 animales to kill and resell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old, and widowed with seven children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Alicia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Daouda's Group

texts.fr: Daouda qui se trouve sur la photo assignant devant sur la chaise en complet bleu et babouche marron, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bassian au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Daouda, âgé de 81 ans, est le père de 6 enfants dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Daouda à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 70 ans. Daouda cultive le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, d'engrais de qualité et de semences de qualité. Daouda entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Daouda effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture de maïs  afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Daouda cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Daouda planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme . Enfin Daouda espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Daouda, sitting in a chair in the photo and wearing a blue outfit and brown slippers, is a member of a group of eight farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Bassian, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. He is 81 years old and the father of six children, three of whom are currently in school. 

Daouda is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. And he loves farming, thus he has been encouraged to do this work for 70 years now. He grows corn on his parcel of land. But, as a farmer, he must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of farm equipment, quality fertilizers, and quality seeds. 

Daouda is starting his third year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system and the quality seeds, as well as the training and farming techniques. This year, he is making payments to purchase a myAgro fertilizer for growing corn, so as to increase his yields on his 1-hectare parcel of land. He has been growing peanuts for 10 years for their productive and market advantages. 

With greater yields and higher income, Daouda is planning on raising livestock. Ultimately, he also hopes to cover his children’s schooling costs, as well as ensure the family’s self-sufficiency.

loans.use: to obtain a packet of fertilizer for growing corn

loans.name: Nagnouma's Group

texts.fr: Nagnouma qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, attachant la foulard blanche de myAgro sur sa tête, est membre d’un groupe de 16 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Faraba (SID) au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Nagnouma, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 20 à 30 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. Elle a expliqué que, "celui qui dit la parole s'en va et la parole reste." L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Nagnouma à exercer cette activité. Elle a mentionné que, "connais toi, toi-même est la meilleur des connaissances." Nagnouma cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, de semences de qualité  et de main d'œuvre. Nagnouma entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Nagnouma effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 45 ans que Nagnouma cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Elle a expliqué que, "la terre ne ment pas." Nagnouma planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de diversifier ses cultures et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Nagnouma espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Nagnouma is standing at the far right in the photo, wearing a "myAgro sign" on her head.  She is a member of a group of 16 farmers registered with myAgro, who live and work in the village of Faraba (SID), located south-east of Bamako, Mali. Nagnouma is 50 years old and the mother of seven children whose ages range between 20 and 30.  Four of her children currently attend school.  Nagnouma's favorite saying is: "Words stay after people have left".

The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, an activity which constitutes the main source of income and provides food self-sufficiency for the family. For this reason, Nagnouma decided to become a farmer. She believes that self-knowledge is the best knowledge.  She grows groundnut and rice on her plot of land. As a farmer, however, she faces challenges such as the lack of farming tools and high-quality seeds, as well as the lack of labor. Nagnouma is starting her first year with myAgro. She decided to join because of the payment system, the high-quality seeds and the technical farming training.  This year, she will be making payments to purchase a myAgro package of OPV (open-pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizers to grow groundnut in order to increase her yield on her 0.0625 hectare plot of land.

Nagnouma has been growing groundnut for 45 years now for its nutritional value, since groundnut can be readily consumed by the family and is used as an ingredient in staple sauces, and also for its commercial value, since she sells groundnut at the market. Nagnouma says that "the earth doesn't lie".  With her expected increased yield and income, she is planning to diversify her cultures and to buy farming equipment.  She also hopes to be able to cover her children's school fees and to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a package of OPV seeds and fertilizers in order to grow groundnut.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.fr:
Charles fait partie du groupe Twisungane et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 60 ans et est mariée à  Daphrose,  
une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 3 à 30 ans, dont  2 étudient. 
Il a un enfant membre de sa famille élargie  à sa charge.

Il  fait le commerce de la bière de banane  depuis  4 ans. 

Il est à  son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes à transformer en bière, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Charles is a member of the Twisungane Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 60 years old and is married to Daphrose, a merchant. Together they have five children, aged 3 to 30 years old, of whom two are students. 

He has been doing commerce in banana beer for four years. 

He is on his 3rd Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a large amount of bananas to process into beer to resell, so as to earn more.

In the years to come, he would like to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas to process into beer to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Solar Solution for his business; he wants to uplift his income.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Girlie is 42 years old and has seven children who are still in school.

Girlie has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Girlie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

Girlie has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Hussel

texts.en:
Hussel is 31 years old and is married with two children.

Hussel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, and personal care products.

Hussel has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Hussel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, and personal care products

loans.name: Hery Jean Gervais

texts.fr:
Jean Gervais a 36 ans.Il est marié et a trois enfants dont un seulement va à l'école maintenant parce que les deux autres sont encore en bas âge.
Auparavant,il était couturier salarié pendant pas mal de temps et depuis 2011, il commençait son propre business. Il confectionne des casquettes dont le port est très tendance actuellement. Il est appuyé par sa femme dans l'exercice de son activité Les deux époux savent travailler ensemble et cela favorise le développement du business. C'est une motivation pour avancer encore et encore et d'étendre l'affaire.
Leur objectif est de faire eux-même tous les travaux. De ce fait, il souhaite acheter les outils pour la sérigraphie car ceci est actuellement effectué ailleurs et c'est une autre dépense.
texts.en:
Jean Gervais is 36 years old, married and has three children, of whom one attends school, the other two are too young.  

He used to have a job working as a tailor, but in 2011 he started his own business making caps, which are very fashionable now.  He works with his wife and the two of them work very well together and are developing their business.  They are working towards being able to carry out all the production steps themselves and would now like to buy the necessary equipment to do their own printing.  Currently this is done elsewhere and it is an extra expense for them.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lining and visors for his sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial oven to open a restaurant.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosario es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos varones de 2, 3 y 4 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 14 y 18 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de floreros.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, generosa, paciente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias y mercados de la ciudad, caracterizada por estar ubicada a una altura aproximada de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar,  De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -1/16 grados centígrados.
Rosario es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por las actividades que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; las hijas mayores estudian en la escuela y los hijos menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de floreros a partir de botellas recicladas de gaseosas, el proceso que sigue es; cortar la botella de vidrio con alcohol, lija el borde y realiza los contornos para obtener un florero reciclado, “limpiamos bien las botellas y las déjamos secar en un lugar fresco, las vendemos en cementerios y a los vendedores de flores...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con material de trabajo reciclado, la desventaja es los lugares alejados donde debe transportarse con su mercadería. Su sueño es incrementar su producción contratando mano de obra, ella desea realiza la compra de botellas por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosario solicita un préstamo para la compra de botellas por mayor para incrementar su producción y contratar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Rosario is 35 years old, and lives with her partner. She has three sons who are 2, 3, and 4 years old, and 2 daughters who are 14 and 18 years old. Her business is making vases. 

She is a good mother, independent, generous, patient, optimistic, responsible and very hardworking. She carries out her business as a street vendor in different exhibitions and markets of the city, which is well-known for being located at an altitude of approximately 4000 meters above sea level, with a dry, cold climate and temperatures varying during the day between -1 and 16 degrees Celsius.

Rosario is of dark complexion, with brown eyes, and long black hair which she ties behind her neck. She is of short stature and thin physique. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish generally and for activities that she does. She shares her life with her partner who works in commerce and with her children. Her older daughters study in school and her young sons have not reached schooling age. They live in a rented room made from brick and cement with a tin roof and wooden floor that has water, electricity and sewage lines. 

Her business is the production of cases from recycled soda bottles. The process she follows is: to cut the glass bottle with alcohol, sand the edges and make an outline for the case. "We clean the bottles well and leave them to dry in a clean place, and sell them in cemeteries and to flower vendors...," she says. The advantage of her business is that she works with recycled material. The disadvantage is the remoteness of the places to which her goods must be transported. Her dream is to increase her production by employing labor. She desires to be able to buy bottles wholesale. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 8 years that she has carried out this activity.

It is for these reasons that Rosario applies for a loan to buy bottles wholesale in order to increase her production and hire labor.

loans.use: to buy bottles wholesale in order to increase production and hire labor

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
His name is Marciano, 35, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Maricar, an OFW, and they have two children who are still in the Elementary level in school. He works hard to provide for his family.

Marciano owns and operates his own transport jeepney service. He has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) of jeepney. Jeepneys are the most common form and cheapest means of public transport. They are one of the remnants of the American military presence in the Philippines during the second World War. The Filipinos being creative saw a real transportation means by making these jeeps about two meters longer and by putting two long seats on each side from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used as small buses for cheap transport of people, goods, and even sometimes little animals. 

To help him continue operations of him business, Marciano is requesting a PHP 20000 loan which he will use for the maintenance and renewal of registration of his jeepney. It is very important that his unit is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him for it will surely cover his family's everyday needs and fund his children's schooling.

Marciano aims to buy another jeepney unit. He wants his children to have a college education to allow them better opportunities in life.  He prays for his and his passengers' safety in all of their trips. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance and renewal of registration of his jeepney.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Isidra works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from general store.  Isidra is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her food production business.

Isidra has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ismaela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ismaela works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from her general store. Ismaela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Ismaela has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 66 years old and widowed with six children. Adoracion works very hard to provide for them.

Adoracion runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase items such as bread, condiments, home care products and other groceries to sell.

Adoracion has been in this business for 43 years. 

In the future, Adoracion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items such as bread, condiments, home care products and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anna Lisa

texts.en:
Anna Lisa works hard to support her family. Anna Lisa is single with one child and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Anna Lisa has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish nets, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Anna Lisa has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Amelda

texts.en:
Amelda is 55 years old and widowed with five children. Amelda works very hard to provide for them.

Amelda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as dried fish, canned goods, home care products and other groceries to sell.

Amelda has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Amelda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as dried fish, canned goods, home care products and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lorena Esther

texts.es:
Lorena es una joven emprendedora de 19 años de edad, estudió hasta 7°grado, es madre soltera de 1 hijo de 4 años de edad, ella vive con su mamá pero solo su pequeño hijo depende de ella.

Desde hace 9 meses, Lorena trabaja en una empresa de reparación de calles, anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura y a cortar cañas, ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para dejar hecho el desayuno a su hijo y luego se va a trabajar de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar semilla, abono, veneno y preparar la tierra para cultivar.

Ella sueña para un futuro con ver a su hijo graduarse de alguna carrera, construir su propia casa y espera retomar sus estudios pues desea superarse.
texts.en:
Lorena is an enterprising youth who is 19 years old. She has a 7th grade education, and is the single mother of a 4 year-old son.  She lives with her mother, but only her young child is dependent upon her.

Lorena has worked for a company that repairs streets for 9 months.  Previously she worked in agriculture and worked cutting sugar cane.  She gets up at 5 in the morning to leave a breakfast for her son, and later goes to work from 7am  until 4pm.

Lorena will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to prepare her land for cultivation.  She dreams of seeing her son graduate in the future with some type of degree.  She also dreams of building her own house, and hopes to return to her studies because she wants to improve her situation.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
33-year-old Rita lives in the village of Palashbari at Alipurduar with her husband Shibu and two children (one son and one daughter). She and her husband both have completed education up to grade 10. Her children are studying in grade 6 & 7 respectively in a local school in Alipurduar. Her husband is engaged in a fast food selling business in their locality.

Being a housewife Rita looks after the family and after managing all the household work she assists her husband in making all kinds of fast foods like momo, chow-mein, soup etc. Her husband sells those fast food items from his home to his neighbors and local area people. There is a great demand of their food items in the locality. 

Rita knows that this business will produce sufficient revenue but for continued operation she needs some capital. So she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase necessary ingredients like flour, oil, vegetables, spices, sauce, and different modern food processors etc. so that she can fulfill her customers' needs. 

She dreams of enhancing the business so that the increased profit generated by the business will reduce their food wastage and make the food preparation process easier.

Rita and her husband are grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase more necessary ingredients to develop her fast food business.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
His name is Kamal, 35, and he is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Mila, a homemaker who takes care of their two Elementary School-age children. Kamal has his own business to provide for his family's needs and for the schooling of his children.

Kamal runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. He sells slightly used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed on hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are very much cheaper compared with brand new clothes sold in malls.  He earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day.

To help him expand the business, he is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan, which he will use to buy additional used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. He plans to add more pants or jeans, and used bags and footwear as well. He is encouraged by a good return on his investment and is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to him for it will surely help fund his family's everyday needs and his children's education.

Kamal dreams of expanding his business. He prays to maintain love and harmony in his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for old/used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en: Fidel is from Badian, Cebu. He is 58 years old, married and has been on a Sari-sari store business for 20 years. His wife is helping him through farming vegetables and  corn. Fidel’s store almost look empty at the moment. He is asking for a PHP5000 loan from CEVI to replenish his stocks. He will buy items like detergent, shampoo, milk, coffee, liquors, canned goods and chips. Fidel will keep his business well-managed to improve his profitability and savings. In the future, Fidel would like to make his store bigger and save more for old age.

loans.use: to buy detergent, shampoo, milk, coffee, liquors, canned goods and chips

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dressed chickens in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Mary Ann is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more dressed chickens to sell for her business buying and selling dressed chickens.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dressed chickens to sell for her business

loans.name: Macelinda

texts.en: Macelinda is a piggery owner from the municipality of Moalboal, Cebu.  Moalboal is a town in the south of Cebu, a two-hour ride by bus from Cebu City. She is 64 years old and has been raising hogs for 12 years now. From this business, she usually earns PHP 12,000 every four months when it is time to sell her fattened hogs.  She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and feed to keep her animals healthy. Macelinda hope to make her planned expansion possible with the help of the loan. In the future, she hope to make her business more successful so she can save for her old age and live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and sacks of feed

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 49 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are still in school, Jessie works very hard to provide for them.

Jessie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and personal care products.

Jessie has been in this business for 12 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and personal care products

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josefina is 53 years old and has one child still in school.

Josefina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

Josefina has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
Junalyn works hard to support her family. She is married with two children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Junalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

Junalyn has been in this business for four years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Nanelen

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nanelen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Nanelen is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy additional pottery products to sell in the stall.

Nanelen has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pottery products to sell in the stall

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional woods, nails, varnish and other materials for her business. Rebecca has been in this business for 32 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional woods, nails, varnish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 27 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Melanie has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, bread, rice and other groceries. 

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 33 years old and married with four children.

She runs an agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Remedios is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds, medicines, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Remedios has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from a general store and e-loading. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 37 years old and married with two children. For the past ten years she has raised and sold pigs. She also sells dried fish to earn extra income.

Nena is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs. She is working tirelessly to save enough money to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en:
Ramzan owns an iron store in the area of Lahore, Pakistan; he sells iron goods such as iron bars, iron rods, iron sheets, etc. 

He wants to increase his current business. For this purpose, some additional capital is required. Nowadays, he is unable to buy inventory for his shop because he has been spending most of the income on household expenses and on medical expenses of his family; he does not have money to buy additional inventories such as iron bars, iron rods, iron sheets, etc.

Therefore, Ramzan  has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy needful things for his iron store to enhance his business.

Ramzan is tension free after taking the loan because now he can easily generate enough profit to cherish his entire family, and can bear medical expenses of his old parents as well. BRAC Pakistan has shown him a beam of hope in the darkness; he would be thankful got Kiva’s cooperation.

loans.use: to enhance his iron sales business

loans.name: Lightin Luis

texts.es: Lightin trabajo durante años en un taller de confecciones, tras la búsqueda de nuevos horizontes e ingresos para su familia, en compañía de su cónyuge iniciaron una venta de comidas típicas de la Costa Caribe Colombiana. Contaron con excelentes resultados y él decidió dejar su empleo para dedicarse de lleno al negocio, puesto que estaba percibiendo más ingresos que al trabajar como empleado.  Los productos que ofrecen a sus vecinos, amigos y transeúntes son empanadas y arepas de maíz rellenas de queso, huevo, carne o pollo, y caramañolas que son elaboradas a base masa de yuca y rellenas con carne o queso.  Actualmente está aplicando a su primer Credikiva con el que planea comprar víveres para la preparación de las comidas; harina, queso y carnes frías. Tendrá un stock de materia prima necesaria para la producción, sin salir diariamente a realizar compras, lo que beneficia a la integración familiar,  puesto que Lightin de 38 años es padre de dos hijos a quienes podrá dedicar este tiempo extra.
texts.en:
Lightin worked for years in a tailoring workshop.  After seeking new horizons and sources of income for his family, he started a business with his wife selling dishes that are commonly consumed on the Colombian Caribbean coast.  They got excellent results, and so he decided to leave his job to devote himself fully to his business, as he was earning more from his business than from his work as an employee.  

Lightin and his wife offer their products to their neighbors, friends,and passers-by.  They sell empanadas and flatbread made of corn and stuffed with cheese, eggs, meat, or chicken.  They also sell cassava cakes stuffed with meat or cheese.  At this time, they are applying for their first Kiva loan.  They plan to use the loan to buy food to make their dishes, including flour, cheese, and cold cuts.  This way they will have the supplies they need to produce their dishes without having to go out each day to make purchases.  This will benefit the family because Lightin, 38, is the father of two children, and he will have extra time to spend with them.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for his business

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Muhannad is a young, ambitious guy with willpower. He is 21 years old and lives with his family in a sector of Jordan called Marka.

Since his childhood Muhannad has helped his dad who works in repairing electrical appliances and car painting. Muhannad has good experience in this field and likes what he does. He did not complete his education because of the financial situation of his family, but he took classes in electrical repair to be able to work with his father.

Muhannad's father saw in him the willpower that would lead him to be a good manager for his business. Therefore his father gave his business to Muhannad to give him the chance to prove himself in this field.

The first step for Muhannad was to apply for a loan to help him buy new machines and new supplies for his shop, and also to run a good promotion for his business to attract more people.

loans.use: To buy new machines and new supplies for his shop, and also to run a good promotion for his business to attract more people.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es un mujer de 62 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hija mujer independiente de 24 años, y su negocio es la medicina naturista.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, optimista, paciente, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ área central caracterizada por conectar a varias zonas mediante desvíos de rutas, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Marcela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte junto a su esposo que trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su actividad es la medicina naturista; que comprende una serie de prácticas curativas utilizando remedios naturales. Estas terapias complementarias son muy populares por los lugareños, “tratamos de utilizar la tendencia natural del organismo a buscar el equilibrio, promoviendo la salud a través de una nutrición sana, costumbres saludables, relajación y otras actividades...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una cartera de clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para refaccionar su consultorio, que se encuentra con las paredes agrietadas y no brinda buenas condiciones para desempeñar el negocio. Su sueño es refaccionar su consultorio que es su principal fuente de ingresos, ella desea realizar la refacción de su consultorio médico naturista para continuar con su actividad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marcela solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su consultorio médico naturista para continuar con su actividad y ayudar a las personas.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 62-year-old woman who is married and has one independent daughter who is 24 years old. She has a natural medicine business. She is a good mother that is independent, optimistic, patient, friendly, responsible and very hardworking. She developed her business in the "Cruce Villa Adela" region which is a central area characterized by connections to various regions via detour routes. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day between 0 and 12 degrees centigrade.

Marcela is dark complected, with brown eyes and long, black, braided hair. She is of small stature and is physically robust. She wears traditional clothing (a hat, shawl, and traditional Andean skirts). Her mother tongue is the Aymará spoken in the area and she speaks Spanish given the general culture and the business she runs. She shares her life with her husband who works. They live in their own home made of adobe with a roof of corrugated metal sheeting and they have drinking water, electricity, and household gas as well as a sewage system.

Her business is in natural medicine. It is made up of a series of curative practices using natural remedies. These complementary therapies are very popular among the locals, "we try to use the natural inclinations of the organism to find equilibrium, promoting health through nutrition, health habits, relaxation, and other activities..." she says.

The advantage of this business is that she has a group of continuous clients. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to make repairs to her consultancy which currently has cracked walls and doesn't offer a good condition to carry out the business. Her dream is to make repairs to the consultancy, which is her main source of income. She wants to make the repairs to her natural medicine consultancy to continue with her business.

This is her first loan with the institution in 30 years of developing this business. For these reasons Marcela is requesting a loan to make repairs to her natural medicine consultancy to continue with her business and help people.

loans.use: to make repairs to her natural medicine consultancy to continue with her business and help people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a septic tank that is needed to make his recently constructed house habitable.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a hard working mother from Oroquieta. She has a small coconut farm and also engages in making copra (dried coconut meat used to extract coconut oil), for which she buys whole coconuts. Angelina has signed up for membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra and to pay for the materials needed for her coconut dryer repair. Angelina hopes to succeed in this business in order to continue providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts for making copra and to pay for the materials needed for her coconut dryer repair

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 29 years old with one child. Nelita works very hard to provide for them.

Nelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Nelita has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Nelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 54 years old, widowed and has five children.

Linda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Linda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Linda has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new professional sewing machine for her husband's tailoring services.

loans.name: Diego Heriberto

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 30 años, es casado y vive junto a su esposa de 33 años y sus 2 hijos, viven en casa familiar. Diego y su esposa trabajan en una plantación desde hace varios meses atrás, ellos salen muy temprano todos los días para poder llegar al trabajo a tiempo ya que trabajan en una plantación de la ciudad de Cayambe que se encuentra a una hora de distancia aproximadamente desde su domicilio. Sus 2 hijos estudian en escuela fiscal, y para que Diego y su esposa puedan convivir más tiempo con sus hijos han decidido emprender un negocio que se trata de confección de mochilas escolares, con este emprendimiento ellos desean tener más ingresos para dedicarse al 100 % al negocio y tener más tiempo para sus hijos ya que actualmente trabajan todo el día.
Diego vive en la comunidad de Calpaqui que pertenece a la parroquia de Eugenio espejo del cantón Otavalo, en el sector las personas en su mayoría se dedican a la elaboración de alpargatas que es parte de la indumentaria indígena, también se dedican a la agricultura y a cuidado de animales.
El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de materia prima como: tela jean, cierres, llaves, hilos y otros que sirven para la elaboración de mochilas.
Diego sabe del negocio gracias a su hermana ya que ella le enseño y juntos trabajaban anteriormente confeccionando mochilas, al llevara a cabo este emprendimiento ellos quieren mejorar sus ingresos y darles a sus hijos más de su tiempo y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diego is a 30 year old man, is married and lives in a house with his 33 year old wife and two children. Diego and his wife have worked on a plantation for several months. They leave very early everyday to get to work on time as they work on a plantation in the city of Cayambe which is about an hour from their house. Their 2 children go to public school and, so Diego and his wife can spend more time with their children, they have decided to start a business making school backpacks. By doing this they hope to make more income so that they can work at their business full time and have more time with their children since they are currently working all day. 

Diego lives in the community of Calpaqui which is in Eugenio Espejo parish in Otavalo district. In this area the majority of people make their living making rope sandals which are part of indian dress. They also make their living in agriculture and raising animals. 

He will use the loan to buy raw materials such as denim fabric, locks, keys, thread and other items to use in the production of backpacks. Diego knows the business thanks to his sister who taught him and with whom he worked earlier making backpacks. By starting this business they hope to increase their income and give their children more of their time and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to start a business making backpacks and fulfill his dream of owning a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to help her son buy more electrical parts and supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
Gulmira is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1988. She lives in a district with her family. She is married and has 2 children. 

Gulmira has experience trading in textiles from when she helped her mother do business. After the birth of her children, she closed her business to raise her children. 

Recently, Gulmira participated in a 3-day training session provided by IMON International for startup clients. She decided to open a business and appealed to IMON, requesting help to buy textiles. 

Gulmira hopes to receive support and be able to create her own source of income to care for her children.

loans.use: to buy textiles and open a business.

loans.name: Nina Rizza Claire

texts.en:
Nina Rizza Claire is 22 years old and married with one child. For the past two years she has raised and sold pigs as well as operated a sari-sari, or small general store, in the Philippines.

Nina Rizza Claire is borrowing 8000 PHP through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her pig. She is working tirelessly to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pig.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fishing.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 56 years old and married with 10 children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 46 years old and is married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, and personal care products.

Rosario has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to further build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, and personal care products.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 28 years old and married with six children. All of her children are presently in school. Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products.

Melanie has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and personal care products

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 60 years old, married and has four children.

Merlita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Merlita has been in this business for six years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (convenience store) business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Juliet is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to  buy 10 sacks of sugar and assorted grocery items for retail. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of sugar and assorted grocery items for retail

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is a single woman from Talic, Oroquieta. In March of 2014, she applied for membership in PMPC and had her first loan. She came up with the idea of starting a business and joined PMPC after hearing that she could request financial assistance. Maryjane applied for a loan to start her business making suman (a variety of rice cake) and it has been doing well. She is earning a good income, enabling her to save for future business opportunities.

Maryjane recently requested a loan to purchase additional cooking equipment such as a steamer and other raw ingredients such as glutinous rice, cocoa, and sugar. This will enable her to increase her production to provide for more customers and to display her suman in shops and cafes on consignment. She also plans to use her additional revenue for her increasing orders. Maryjane is thankful for the financing she gets for her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand and improve her business and hopes to open a house of suman near the town.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking equipment such as a steamer and other raw ingredients such as glutinous rice, cocoa, and sugar to increase her production

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina, 56 years old, is married and has six children. Rosalina works very hard to provide for them. For the past 5 years, Rosalina has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as beverages, eggs, candles and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries to sell. In the future, Rosalina would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita has been a farmer since 2005. She plants tree seedlings to sell. Rosita lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur and has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative since January, 2011. Rosita recently borrowed PHP 10,000 to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers. This will help her to have good growth of her planted seedlings.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman who is 56 years old with 7 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rosalinda has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 63 years old, is married and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosita has been in this business for 10 years and has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality at her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 47, is a married woman with seven children, four of whom are presently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish net and other materials for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, Mwanasiti has operated an open air business, selling food from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mwanasiti wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwanahadie

texts.en:
Mwanahadie is a single mother with two school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a business selling Khangas (women's cloth wraps), selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas for resale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Maria Tania

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 2, 4 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional. 
Ella es buena madre, generosa, comprensiva, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, 
Un sitio caracterizado por el comercio informal y por la manufactura independiente. De clima de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), y otros. Actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana de forma ambulante en su carrito de comida, “cocino en mi casa y lo vendo en mi coche, el clima del lugar hace que los alimentos se malogren rápidamente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes diarios, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un refrigerador para almacenar los alimentos. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante de comida típica, Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un refrigerador. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
