Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de un refrigerador para almacenar los alimentos y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and lives with her life partner. She has three children who are 2, 4 and 12 years old. Maria shares her life with her partner who works in construction, and with her children who are in school. They live in their own house which is built of wood with a tin roof and an earthen floor. It has potable water, electricity and sewerage.

Maria sells traditional foods. She is a good mother and is generous, understanding, a good listener, steadfast, responsible and a very good worker. She sells her food in the southern part of the city in a place characterized by informal trade and independent manufacturing. The climate is warm and sub-tropical with temperatures that range from 21 to 35 degrees Celsius during the day [70 - 95 F]. Maria has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair tied in a pony tail, and is short and stout. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks with her family, but she uses Spanish in general and for her business.

The traditional meals Maria sells include aji de panza (spicy cow's stomach with onion and tomato with rice), rice with cheese (rice, milk and cheese), stuffed peppers (peppers, chopped meat, onion), peanut soup, and others. She works every day of the week going through the streets with her food cart. "I cook in my house and I sell it from my cart. The climate here causes food to spoil quickly..." she states. The advantage of her business is that she has daily customers, and the disadvantage is the lack of funds to buy a refrigerator to keep her food. Her dream is to open a typical food restaurant. She wants to expand her business by buying a refrigerator. 

This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the two years she has had her business. These are the reasons why Maria is asking for a loan - to buy a refrigerator to store the food, and to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store the food and open a restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Khuong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khuong, a Kinh ethnic woman, has been a member of the program of M7-MFI since January 2013. She is one of those exemplary members in compliance with the regulations of M7-MFI. She is living with her husband, her son, and her daughter-in-law and her son’s child in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from breeding and farming, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount of money. She wants to expand the breeding by raising pigs for meat, but the saved amount of money is not enough for her to invest in the breeding by buying pigs and food for pigs. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in breeding with high productivity, and next year her family will sell several tons of pig meat.

loans.use: to invest in breeding pigs.

loans.name: Giang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Giang, 47 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has three members, including her husband, her son, and herself. They are now living in Mai Son district, Son la province.

Her family’s main income is from her meager civil servant salary, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount of money. However, she has to pay for her son’s education fee because he is at grade 8 at school, so the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to pay for her son’s education.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her son have better learning conditions, and then he will have a brighter future. For herself, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education.

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuan, born in 1985 is a Kinh ethnic majority woman, who joined the program of M7-MFI in January 2010. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her husband's meager civil servant salary, so his income is just enough to cover the living expenses and to be saving a small amount of money. Because she has to pay for her children’s education fees so the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to take a loan to pay for her children’s education fees.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have better learning conditions, then they will have a brighter future. For herself, she will work hard to get the money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education fees, so that she will have a much brighter future

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel manages her rice farm and sells rice to the local community. She is a hardworking mother who never get tired of selling and working. She earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Isabel is a fully fledged member of PMPC and has received several previous loans. She maintains her membership in good standing. 

She will use the loan to purchase rice to sell which will increase her inventory and sales. Isabel continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell which will increase her inventory and sales

loans.name: Darlina

texts.en:
Darlina is 39 years old and has seven children. Darlina is widowed and has five children are presently in school.

Darlina is in the agricultural business, farming citrus in the Philippines. Darlina requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Darlina has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies, to make enough to be able to send her children to college

loans.name: Maria Alexandra

texts.es:
A 1 hora treinta minutos San Miguel de los Bancos está la Parroquia de Pacto barrio el Paraíso con un clima cálido, este sector cuenta con un clima muy privilegiado motivo por el cual se da toda clase de frutas tanto de la Sierra como de la Costa aquí vive la señora Aguirre María una mujer soltera con dos hijos uno mayor de edad independiente que vive en la ciudad de Quito y su hija de 16 años que vive con ella la misma que se encuentra estudiando el bachillerato y es por quien tiene que seguir adelante tratando de darle lo necesario con mucho esfuerzo para que en algún momento llegue a ser una gran profesional. 
Doña María desea emprender su propio negocio que es la crianza y engorde de pollos, aprendió este negocio por iniciativa propia ya que por sacar adelante a sus hijos a trabajado en varias fincas al mismo le dedicará un promedio de 4 horas diarias debido a que estas aves necesitan de un cuidado especial, en ocasiones recibirá la ayuda de su hija después del colegio con esta inversión busca mejorar sus ingresos económicos y la calidad de vida de su familia. 
La señora María agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas ya que es la única institución que se preocupa por las personas que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
One hour and thirty minutes from San Miguel de los Bancos are the parish of Pacto and the neighborhood El Paraiso, which has a warm climate. This sector has a very special climate, and for this reason all types of fruits, as much from the mountains as from the coast, are found here. Señora Aguirre Maris lives here. She is a single woman with two children. One is of an independent age and lives in the city of Quito, and her daughter, who is 16, lives with her. She is in high school, and it is for her that Maria has to continue trying every day with great effort to provide the necessities so that at some time she can become a great professional person.

Doña Maria wants to begin her own business, which is raising and fattening chickens. She learned this business on her own initiative, since she has worked on various farms doing the same thing in order to raise her children. She will work an average of four hours a day, due to the fact that these birds need special care. She will sometimes receive help from her daughter after school. With this investment, she seeks to improve her economic income and the quality of life of her family.

Señora Maria is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and the opportunities offered to her, since this is the only institution that is concerned about people who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to begin her business of raising chickens. With this income, she seeks to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Haleema is a 47-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of seven children. She has been doing a business of animal sales for many years along with her husband. She is keen to provide her family with better living conditions. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma  is 48 years old, married woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from a city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Najma  has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants  to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her busines, to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 59 years old and currently lives with her husband and two grandchildren in Oroquieta. She is very responsible and hardworking with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. For a living, Emelita and her husband are both farmers who plant rice, corn, root crops and vegetables. 

Emelita wants to live in a decent house. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase light construction materials, such as plywood and wood, for her house. In the future, she deeply hopes to see all her children with stable financial status.

loans.use: to purchase light construction materials, such as plywood and woods, for her house

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC to Erlinda came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She loaned an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  Erlinda perseveres and always believe to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: January

texts.en:
January is a 60-year-old hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has two children aged 11 and 13 years old. 

January deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income. He also gets supplementary income from farming and operating a retail shop. With this, he has been able to generate funds to provide for his family's demands. He aspires to buy a car to easily transport milk to different markets but his main challenges are inadequate capital and price fluctuations.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening at the farm.

January took the photo from one of his businesses which is his retail shop where he gets additional income.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening at the farm.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with six children, of the six,only three attend school. She owns a house that only has electricity and no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for her children.

Saumu operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells from home to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of business competition to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a shop business in the future. 


With the loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, fruits, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, fruits, and onions

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own  house that  has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Immerida

texts.en:
Immerida is a married woman, aged 50 years, with five children who are 28, 26, 24, 22, and 20 years respectively. She lives in a rural area with her family and another seven grandchildren who are still attending schools.

She deals in agriculture, specifically growing bananas, and supplements her family's income with local brew-making. She works six days a week, and each day she works for eight hours. She started her business in 1990 due to experience she had in agriculture and to generate income. She has acquired this loan facility in order to pay school fees for her granddaughter.

Her clients are traders from the capital city, and her dream is to educate all her grandchildren to the higher levels of education. She says she still faces the challenges of price fluctuations in agriculture goods, and weather changes.

She describes herself as a hardworking and honest woman and asks God to bless the works of UGAFODE and the kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: New Kabingo Tukundane Group

texts.en: New Kabingo Tukundane group, located in Kahegye, Rukungiri district, has been in UGAFODE for three loan cycles with eight members. Kedress, a widow who is 45 years old is a member of the group. Kedress produces ghee from her home. She started selling the ghee after realizing the need for finances to meet her financial obligations and those of the children, since she has no husband. There was also a market in the local community, the neighbors and others far away who make orders, which she supplies. She has been operating her business on loans given by UGAFODE and she applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX through the group to buy more milk to increase the volume of her ghee production. The money from selling the ghee is used for her needs. The group members thank UGAFODE for the financial support offered despite their meager resources.

loans.use: To boost her ghee production business by buying milk

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en:
Rasoolan  is 50 years old and married woman. The man shown in the photo is Rasoolan ’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Rasoolan  has applied for a loan of 45000 PKR, for her husband. He wants  to buy new tires along with auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Rasoolan  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine has always dreamed of opening and managing her own retail store to support her needs. Josephine is married with 3 kids. The family lives in Mobod, Oroquieta, in the Philippines. She applied for a loan to restock her store with basic inventory items like sugar, oil, milk and canned goods. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits and supporting her children.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic inventory items like sugar, oil, milk and canned goods

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 44 years old and married with nine children. Two children still in school, Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like drinks, milk, coffee, canned goods, noodles, eggs and etc.

Nenita has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like drinks, milk, coffee, canned goods, noodles, eggs and etc to afford to send her children to college

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw's body for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham, 59, is married and lives in Lower Lamac, Philippines. He is a father of four who are all in their adult age. For the past ten years he has worked in sales. Because Abraham became a new member of PMPC he wanted to be able to earn more through his business. He has decided to start raising hogs and is applying for a 14,000 PHP loan from PMPC to buy bags of pig feed and animal vitamins. He will be very happy someday if he can see his family living comfortably and bountifully.

loans.use: to buy bags of pig feed and animal vitamins

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.en: Abdukodir is a bright guy. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1996. He is single and lives with parents. He is third year student at special technical lyceum. He studies well and active in classes. He is well known among friends and course mates. He tries to participate at competitions and improve his self-development. He appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to pay his tuition fee. He hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee at a special technical lyceum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of new assortment of men's clothing; jeans and t-shirts

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Jenalyn is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Gilda works hard to support her family.

She has a farming citrus business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from E-Loading.  Gilda is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her citrus fruit business

loans.name: Reoun

texts.en: Reoun is ages 50 years old and a mother of six children, only two of them are in school. She has been a cassava and rice farmer in Kampong Cham province for thirty two years and she could earn about 66,000KHR per day. Now she face with a problem of lacking money to do the farm, so she decides to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee. She hopes her business will be expanded through this loan and earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee so as to have an improved crop later on

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil works hard to support her family. Cecil is married with one child and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Cecil requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

Cecil has been in this business for 4 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Cecilia is 44 years old and has four children who are presently in school.

Cecilia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice aged 43 is a hard-working married woman with four children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. To generate income she is a salt miner and also sells fish and owns rental houses. 

Beatrice dreams of educating her children and having a sustainable good business but she faces the challenge of high transport costs to deliver her services. She is requesting a loan to buy an engine for her fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy an engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre muy luchador, de estado civil casado vive con su esposa con la cual tiene tres hijos, ellos viven en el Recinto Saloya Alto a diez minutos del Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos que está ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha, su gente es muy trabajadora y unida. 
Don Jorge viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos motivo por el cual no pudo concluir sus estudios secundarios a pesar de esto decidió salir adelante y comenzó trabajando como jornalero en una Hacienda del sector actualmente tiene el apoyo de sus jefes y es su mano derecha, en la Hacienda desempeña la actividad de ordeño de ganado lechero y también entrena a caballos de raza para eventos públicos, vive en una pequeña casa de madera prestada por su jefe en la que junto a su familia buscan salir adelante por el bienestar de todos, su esposa quien es su compañera y su apoyo constante trabaja junto a él en la misma Hacienda en las actividades de limpieza y cuidado de  jardines .
El negocio que emprenderá es la crianza de pollos  tiene varios de experiencia en esta actividad debido a que es una actividad que la ha practicado en años anteriores por iniciativa propia pero en cantidades mínimas, construirá un galpón con materiales del sector, junto a su esposa le dedicarán un promedio de 5 horas diarias debido a que deben limpiar y estar pendientes de que todas las aves se encuentren  en buenas condiciones ya que son animales de mucho cuidado. 
Don Jorge tiene muchos sueños por cumplir uno de ellos es tener su negocio propio y dedicarse solo a esta actividad para poder compartir más tiempo junto a su familia. 
Este préstamo ayudara a Don Jorge a mejorar su calidad de vida y darle un mejor futuro a su familia que es su razón de luchar día a día, agradece a KIVA por el apoyo que están brindando a personas como él que por falta de oportunidades y recursos económicos no han podido llevar a cabo sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very hard-working man. He is married and lives with his wife, with whom he has three children. They live in the Saloya Alto precinct, ten minutes from the San Miguel de los Bancos canton, which is located in the northwest of the province of Pichincha. Its people are very hard-working and united.

Don Jorge comes from a family of low economic resources. This is why he was not able to finish his secondary schooling. In spite of this, he decided to get ahead and began to work as a day laborer at a ranch in the district.  Now he has the support of his bosses, and he is their right-hand man. At the ranch, he does the work of milking the dairy cattle, and he also trains the thoroughbred horses for public events. He lives in a little house of wood provided by his boss, in which he and his family seek to get ahead for the well-being of all of them. His wife, who is his partner and constant supporter, works with him on the same ranch performing cleaning activities and caring for gardens.

The business that he will undertake is raising chickens. He has some experience in this activity, since it is work that he has done in past years on his own initiative but in minimal quantities. He will build a shed with local materials. He and his wife will work an average of five hours a day, since they need to clean and be alert to keeping all the birds in good conditions, since they are high-maintenance animals.

Don Jorge has many dreams to accomplish. One of them is to have his own business and work by himself at this activity so that he can spend more time with his family.

This loan will help Don Jorge to improve his quality of life and give a better future to his family, who are his reason for striving every day. He is grateful to Kiva for the support that they are offering to people like himself who, for lack of opportunities and economic resources, have not been able to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to begin his business of raising chickens and  be able to spend more time with his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, re-bar and laminate sheeting to construct a washstand and a shed at her house.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru: Шаходату 25 лет. Она замужем и имеет один маленький ребенок.  Шохида  живет  с мужем свекровью и ребенком. Она занята с сельскохозяйственной деятельности  много лет. Она молодая опытная дехканка.  Шаходат во дворе занимается животноводством. Она в основном выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Шаходат любить доить коров, обеспечить семью с молоками и молочными продуктами. Она обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее осталось малое количество скотов, чтобы расширить деятельность и увеличить поголовья скота, ей нужно деньги для купли скота. Шаходату ни кому обратиться кроме Вас. Поддержите ее!
texts.en: Shahodat is 25 years old. She is married and has one small child. Shahodat lives with her husband, child and mother-in-law. She has been doing agricultural work for many years. While young, she is already an experienced farmer. Shahodat raises farm animals, mainly cattle, in her backyard. Shahodat likes milking cows and being able to provide her family with milk and dairy products. She has applied for a loan because she has only a few animals left at present. She needs funds in order to expand her business and increase her headcount. Shahodat has no one to ask for support except you. Please help her out!

loans.use: to expand her business and increase livestock headcount.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 28 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón de 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tipo snack.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘3 de mayo’ fundada hace 20 años, cuenta con; el servicio de la Policía Comunitaria, 3 áreas verdes, calles adoquinados y empedradas, centro de salud y un centro técnico para jóvenes. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Julia es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la disfruta con su esposo que trabaja como transportista y viaja constantemente en compañía de su hija, viven en un cuarto en alquiler construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tipo snack; esta comida se caracteriza por ser de fácil preparación y de aceptación popular, los platos más populares son; chuleta, albóndigas, hamburguesas, pollo frito, y otros, actividad que realiza en un cuarto de su casa habilitado como restaurante, “inicié mi trabajo como ayudante de cocina luego me independice y ahora soy el único puesto de venta de comida de la zona…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia, la desventaja es que es una zona alejada y es difícil transportar los insumos de cocina. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante amplio y completo, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina freidora de pollo para la venta de pollo frito. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Julia solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina freidora de pollo para abrir un restaurante amplio y completo.
texts.en: Julia is a 28 year old woman, married with a 7-year old son. She works selling snack type food. She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, independent, constant, patient, responsible, and hard working. She works in the "3 de mayo" zone founded 20c years ago. They have access to the Community Police, 3 green areas, cobblestone streets, a health center and a youth technical center. With its cold and dry climate with a temperature that fluctuates during the day between 0-12 degrees Celsius. Julia is dark skinned, dark eyed, short black hair, short stature, robust build. Her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish as general culture and for business. She enjoys her life with her husband who works as a driver. She travels constantly with her daughter, they live in a small rental room built of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof and wood floor with running water, electricity, household gas and sewage. Her business is selling snack style food. This food is easily prepared and is popularly accepted. The most popular plates are: pork chops, meatballs, hamburgers, fried chicken, and others. She works in a small room in her house adapted for a restaurant, "I started this job as a kitchen assistant, then I became independent and now I have the only food stand in the zone..."she stated. The advantage of her business is that she doesn't have competition, the disadvantage is that this is a remote area and it is difficult to transport her kitchen ingredients. Her dream is to open a fully equipped restaurant, she wants to buy a frying machine for chicken to sell fried chicken. This is the first loan with the institution in the 6 years she has worked independently. This is why Julia is asking for a loan to buy a frying machine for chicken to open a fully equipped restaurant.

loans.use: To buy a frying machine for chicken to open a full service restaurant.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is a married woman and 58 years old. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Dionisia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Dionisia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis de 59 años, ofrece a sus vecinos y amigos del barrio en el que reside en el municipio de Soledad, carne de res y cerdo, pollo y queso.  Este emprendedor hombre palpo la necesidad en su comunidad de expender estos productos de la canasta familiar a buenos precios, inicialmente  su frecuencia de ventas era cada tres días, con tal éxito que hoy en día vende día por medio e incluso a veces todos los días. Como su demanda es cada vez mayor y su capital insuficiente está aplicando a su primer Credikiva, por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que planea invertir en la compra al por mayor de carne de res y cerdo.  Con esta inversión pretende responder a encargos de sus clientes y surtir en su punto de venta.  Luis es padre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad a quienes desea continuar apoyando. Su meta de negocio es adquirir un local y adecuarlo con enseres y maquinas.
texts.en: Luis is 59 years old. He offers his neighbors and friends in the neighborhood he lives, beef, pork, and chicken meat and cheese. This entrepreneurial man saw the need to sell these products of the family shopping basket at good prices. Initially, he started selling every three days with such a success that today he sellsevery day and a half and sometimes everyday. As demand increases and her capital base becomes insufficient she is applying for her first Credikiva loan, from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. He plans to invest this money by buying wholesale beef and pork meats. He intends to respond to his clients orders and supply his point of sale. Luis has 4 adult children who he wants to continue supporting. His goa is to acquire a store to equip it with household goods and machines.

loans.use: To buy wholesale beef and pork meat.

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
Ederlinda is a simple housewife. She busies herself caring for her ornamental plants and earns a meager income from her hobby. Now she plans to utilize her space, starting a little store and earning additional income, which will enable her to meet her family's needs. 

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and develop her skill in business engagements. Ederlinda is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to buy additional goods for her store.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for her store

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends. As a farmer in Pagadian, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump-start her coconut and farm production. 

After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Rosel feels she owes her good fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to buy 10 sacks of fertilizers and chemicals. Rosel wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply coconut and farm production in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizers and chemicals

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aquilina is 60 years old.

She has a milk sales business in the Philippines. Aquilina requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more packs of milk bottles to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Aquilina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Aquilina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more packs of milk bottles to sell.

loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.en:
Tiburcio has always been an enthusiastic farmer who has grown vegetables and other crops on his land in Unidos, Plaridel. He consistently has a good yield and strong earnings from his work but would like to be even more productive. 

That is why he has applied for a loan to prepare his land and seedbed and ensure that his rice field is ready for planting. Tiburcio knows that he has to get things right to earn a higher income in the upcoming season. 

In the future, he hopes to buy a truck to haul his produce to market.

loans.use: to prepare his land and seedbed and ensure that his rice field is ready for planting

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase light construction materials such as plywood and sticks to construct her store. She wants to make use of the vacant lot next to her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase light construction materials such as plywood and sticks to construct her store

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Cirilo Jr.

texts.en: Cirilo Jr. is married and lives in Aloran, Philippines. For a living, he cultivates a small rice field for their consumption and engages in selling lumber to the local community. Cirilo Jr. has been doing this for 15 years. He hopes to live comfortably, with simple yet comfortable living quarters for all of those in the family. Therefore, he applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement, plywood, and roof sheets for his house. Cirilo Jr. is a new member of PMPC. In the future, he hopes to save money for future emergencies and business opportunities. He wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, plywood, and roof sheets for his house

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with three kids, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Salim operates a grocery and vegetables selling stall. He sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. He faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to his place of operation. 

With the 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Jilyn

texts.en: Jilyn is a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. She has a piece of agricultural land in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She and her husband are both farmers. She works a lot to sufficiently provide the needs of her children. For this cropping season, she availed a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her bell pepper garden. Jilyn wants to see all her children finish their studies and build a decent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her bell pepper garden

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is from Pagadian City and loves farming. 

She has a vacant space where she planted vegetables, where she also gets an income. She has been in this kind of activity for almost 20 years. 

She became a member of PMPC on March 28, 2007. Recently, she availed herself of a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase six sacks of fertilizers. Fertilizers gives good production harvest in Vilma's farmland.

loans.use: To purchase six sacks of fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Gregoria works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell spices business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Gregoria is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more spices to sell in the market for her buy-and-sell spices business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in the market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, and biscuits for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert has a vast area of coconuts in Pagadian, Zamboanga del Sur. He has been in this kind of activity for 10 years. He availed a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.  Albert is thankful for it.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en: Irenea learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Irenea tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Irenea borrowed another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Irenea looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en: Cesaria is 68 years old and married with two children. She lives in Pagadian City. For the past 20 years, Cesaria has been a farmer. She earns 1,500 PHP each month. Cesaria is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 46 years old and has four children. Ester is married and has one child in school.

Ester is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ester requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ester has been in this business for 20 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Ester would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Coster

texts.en:
Coster is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, he has operated a cereals shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He mentioned seasonality and theft as his major challenge. Coster dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, he wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Elsa Dayana

texts.es:
Al Noroccidente de Pichincha en San Miguel de los Bancos Recinto Pueblo Nuevo con un clima cálido húmedo con gente muy unida, trabajadora que se dedica a las labores del campo vive Elsa una joven de estado civil soltera, tiene un hijito de 2 años de edad que es su razón para seguir adelante, a pesar de tener 19 años ha buscado la manera de triunfar en la vida uno de sus logros fue poder culminar el año anterior sus estudios secundarios y al mismo tiempo mantener su negocio que es tener cerdas madres para vender lechones, a pesar de ser muy joven es una mujer muy madura que sabe lo que busca en la vida y es salir adelante, viene de una familia con recursos económico limitados pero son muy unidos, sus Padres son su apoyo constante, cada día le dan ánimos para seguir adelante.  
A pesar de tener 19 años en su vida ha tenido varios  uno de ellos es no poder continuar con sus estudios superiores debido a que con sus ingresos económicos trata de mantener a su pequeño hijo y para continuar estudiando debe trasladarse a vivir en otro sector.
Tiene muchos sueños que quisiera concretarlos uno de ellos es darle  a su pequeño hijo lo necesario dándole una buena educación para que en algún momento llegue a ser un gran profesional y no tengan que pasar ninguna necesidad.
El negocio que desea fortalecer es la compra de dos cerdas madres para poder incrementar su producción de lechones, a esta actividad le dedicarán un promedio de 3 horas diarias, tiene mucho conocimiento ya que sus Padres también se dedican a este negocio cuenta también con el apoyo de los mismos quienes están preocupados por el bienestar de ella y de su pequeño hijo, está convencida que sus ingresos mejorarán debido a que siempre le pone mucho fe y dedicación a las metas que se propone. 
Elsa agradece profundamente a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder pronto cumplir con sus sueños, está convencida que esta oportunidad que se le presenta debe aprovecharla al máximo.
texts.en: Elsa, a single young woman, lives at the northwestern part of Pichincha in San Miguel de los Bancos, Recinto Pueblo Nuevo, an area of humid warm weather, and very hardworking people who care for each other and are dedicated to farm work. She has a 2 year old little son, who is her reason to move forward. Despite being 19 years old, she has looked for a way to prosper in life. One of her accomplishments was to finish her high school studies last year, and at the same time to keep her business of mother pigs to sell piglets. Even when she is very young, she is a very mature woman who knows what she is looking for in life and this is to move ahead. She comes from a family of limited financial resources, but who are very close. Her parents are her constant support. Each day they give her motivation to keep of moving forward. Even when she is 19 years old, she has many obstacles, one is of not being able to continue with college studies, because of having to support her small son, and to continue studying she has to move to another area. She has many dreams that she would like to reach; one of them is to give her small son all what he needs, giving him a good education so that he can become some day professional and they do not have to lack of anything. She wants to strengthen the business by buying two mother pigs in order to increase her production of piglets. She will work in this an average of three hours a day. She knows a lot about this, because her parents also work in this business. She also has her parents' support, who worry about her well being and that of her small son. She is convinced that this income will improve, because she always put a lot of faith and devotion to the goals she commits to. Elsa is deeply grateful to Kiva for the support and the given chance to improve the quality of her life and be able to meet her dreams. She is convinced that she needs to take advantage of this given opportunity to the maximum.

loans.use: to buy two mother pigs and with this income pay for her son's education so that he never has any needs.

loans.name: Sonat

texts.en: Sonat is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the Northwest of Cambodia. She is 27 years old and lives in a small wooden house with her parents and her four brothers and sisters. Her family owns two hectares of rice fields, two hectares of cassava fields and one pig. In May 2014, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social company which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sonat makes scarves that are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for fertilizer and diesel for the fields. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional cow for her son for milk production to sell in his locality.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Nodira is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1980. She is living in village with her family. She is married and has two children. She is a tailor who sews traditional women dresses and has permanent customers every day. She has years of practice sewing fashion and up to date clothing to women. 

She appealed to IMON asking for a help to get a loan to treat her mother in hospital. Her mother is sick and needs treatment. She hopes her mother will be healthy and could feel herself better. She awaits Kiva lender's kindness.

loans.use: to treat her mother in hospital

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is encouraged that she was granted a 19000 PHP loan which she used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed on her farm. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another Php 19000 loan which she will use to buy several fruits such as bananas, papaya, pine apple and jack fruit from a wholesaler and sells them by the kilo. These local fruits are among the favorites of Filipino household for their yummy taste and nutrient value. She also sell veggies that grow from her own farm. Her earnings will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you for your good heart for the financial help that will be given her. 

Elnora dreams for her farm to grow and flourish and to live a blessed life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for bananas, papaya, pineapple, jack fruit to sell.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Cherry is 44 years old and has one children still in school.

Cherry has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cherry requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Cherry has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 36 years old and married with two children.  With one child still in school, Cristy works very hard to provide for them.

Cristy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and personal care products.

Cristy has been in this business for 6 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and personal care products

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Demetria works hard to support her family.

She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Demetria is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies and equipment for her farming rice business.

Demetria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Dolores is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in steel sheets, wood, nails and wire to build a galley in her home.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is encouraged that she was granted a 10000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 11000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and for the financial help that will be given her. 

Sonia dreams of having a bigger General Store. She prays for God to prosper her business and have a better life.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 41 years old married and has one child, who is in school.

Edith is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Edith requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Edith has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Geovie-An

texts.en:
Geovie-An is 32 years old and married with four children. Three children are still in school, Geovie-An works very hard to provide for them.

Geovie-An runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and personal care products.

Geovie-An has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and personal care products

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Kim works hard to support her family.

She has a food processing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Kim is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Kim has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman, 55 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy household appliances for re-sale in her community

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 35 years old and has four children. Jean is married and has three children are presently in school.

Jean is in the agricultural business, farming citrus in the Philippines. Jean requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jean has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Yenis Sofia

texts.es: Yenis de 32 años es una polifacética mujer que emprendió por su propia iniciativa dos actividades; venta de productos de uso personal y pinchos de pollo, carne y embutidos.  Empezó ofreciendo cremas corporales, shampoo, colonias, mascarillas y desodorantes a sus vecinos por intermedio de catálogos especializados  y desde su vivienda en una vitrina exhibidora,  los fines de semana desde la terraza de su casa venden deliciosos pinchos a los residentes del sector.  En la actualidad su capital es insuficiente y está aplicando a su primer Credikiva, por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar colonias, talcos, perfumes, cremas para responder a encargos de sus clientes e invertir en carne, pollo y butifarras para la elaboración de los pinchos. Ella es madre de un niña de seis años a quien dedica mucho tiempo y esmero para que crezca con bienestar,  su meta personal es continuar apoyando a su familia y de negocio tener un local.
texts.en: Yenis is a multi-faceted 32 year old woman that undertook two occupations on her own initiative. She sells personal use products, and chicken, beef and sausage kebabs. She began offering body lotions, shampoo, cologne, face masks and deodorants to her neighbors through specialized catalogs from her home in a display case. On the weekends, from her home's terrace, she sells delicious kebabs to the residents of the area. Now her income is insufficient and she is applying for her first Credikiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy cologne, powders, perfume, and lotions to meet her client's orders and to invest in beef, chicken and sausage to make the kebabs. She is the mother of a six year old girl who she devotes a lot of time and attention to so that she grows up comfortably. Her personal goal is to continue supporting her family and her business goal is to have a store.

loans.use: to buy cologne, powders, perfume, and lotions to meet her client's orders and invest in beef, chicken and sausages to make kebabs.

loans.name: Gerosa

texts.en:
Gerosa is a widow with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Gerosa is 53 years old and has one child still in school.

Gerosa has a buy and sell personal collection business in the Philippines. Gerosa requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional products of personal collection like soap, shampoo, perfume and other personal care items to sell.

Gerosa has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products of personal collection like soap, shampoo, perfume and other personal care items to sell

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 28 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 5 years; they do not yet go to school. She sells clothes and she has been in a business for two years, while her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In the future, she aims to earn at least 100,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marie Josee

texts.en: Marie Josee is 47 years old. She is married with five children between the ages of 12 and 25. They all go to school. She has a shop and has been doing business for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, sugar, rice, and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used to increase savings and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more salt, sugar, rice, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma  is 44 years old, a married woman. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Najma  expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 51 years old and married with ten children. With four children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as peanut, biscuits, junk foods, soft drinks, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Djantoyerela Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. .
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil   avec  SATA , 1ère personne assise de   la gauche vers la  droite de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djantoyerela III group are married women who average 37 years of age with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba, Mali's second administrative region. They work together with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities during the winter season. They are on their fourth seasonal loan from the institution, and the previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Sata, who is sitting on the far left of the photo, grows groundnut and millet. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds, and also pay for labor to maintain two hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in the vilage and in Sanankoroba, to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. She expects to make an average 125,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and purchase inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Iv Group

texts.fr:

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
