They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba, Mali's second administrative region. They work together with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities during the winter season. They are on their fourth seasonal loan from the institution, and the previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Latou, who is sitting on the far left of the photo, grows groundnut and millet. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds, and also pay for labor to maintain two hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in the vilage and in Sanankoroba, to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. She expects to make an average 100,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Segundo Heleodoro

texts.es:
Don Segundo es un hombre de estado civil casado actualmente vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos los cuales están estudiando en el colegio, viven en el Recinto Saloya Alto a 10 minutos de San Miguel de los Bancos en el Noroccidente de Pichincha, Don Segundo trabaja en una finca del sector son personas que por motivos económicos decidieron radicarse en San Miguel de los Bancos.
Don Segundo  viene de una familia muy humilde y de bajos recursos económicos motivo por el cual solo tiene estudios primarios a pesar de esto ha buscado cada día salir adelante por su familia, trabaja como jornalero con una remuneración mensual mínima pero esto no ha sido motivo para estancarse siempre busca mejorar por él y su familia quienes son su razón de lucha diaria.
El negocio que emprenderá es la crianza de gallinas criollas le dedicará un promedio de 2 horas diarias, su esposa quien es su ayuda incondicional será quien le apoye en este proyecto, tiene muchos años de experiencia en esta actividad lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y actualmente cuenta con varias aves las cuales entrega semanalmente a varios restaurantes del sector, en  la finca donde viven les prestaron una casita de madera para vivir con su familia y un espacio para poder emprender su negocio, está convencido que saldrá adelante. 
Don Segundo tiene muchos sueños por cumplir uno de ellos es junto a su esposa poder poyar a sus hijos dándoles toda la educación que necesiten para poder ser grandes profesionales sabe que la gente del campo es capaz de lograr las metas propuestas y sus hijos son muy buenos estudiantes. 
Este préstamo ayudara a Don Segundo a mejorar su calidad de vida y darle un mejor futuro a su esposa, agradece a KIVA por el apoyo que están brindando a personas como él que por falta de oportunidades no han podido llevar a cabo sus sueños.
texts.en:
Don Segundo lives with his wife and their two children, who are school students. They live in Saloya Alto area, 10 minutes from San Miguel de los Bancos in the northeast of Pichincha, where they decided to move for economic reasons. Don Segundo works on a local farm.

Don Segundo comes from a very humble family with low economic means which is why he only finished primary school. Despite this, each day he tries to get by for his family. He works as a labourer, receiving a minimum wage but this doesn't mean he should stop his search to better himself and his family, who are what drive him to fight each day.  

The business that he will set up is breeding creole hens and he will dedicate an average of 2 hours per day to this. His wife, who offers him unconditional support, will help him on this project. He has many years of experience breeding birds, a skill which he learned off his own back and at the moment he has various birds which he sells to various local restaurants on a weekly basis. 

The family live in a borrowed wooden house on the farm where they live, which is also where he will run his business from. He is convinced that his business will be a success. 

Don Segundo has many dreams which he wants to make come true and one of them is that he and his wife will be able to support their children to give them all the education they need to be able to become professionals. He knows that people from the country are able to achieve their goals and his children are very good students. 

This loan will help Don Segundo to improve his quality of life and give his wife a better future. He is grateful to Kiva for the support they are offering people like him who, due to a lack of opportunities, haven't been able to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to set up a creole hen-breeding business. He is convinced that he will get by on this income.

loans.name: Ashurali

texts.en:
Ashurali is a careful man. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1963. He is living in a district with his family. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housekeeper. He has 30 years of experience working as a dentist at a medical clinic. But, recently, he has been working at the area helping residents to treat their teeth.

He has a son, and Ashurali wants him to be educated at the university level so that his son can help society. He asked for help from IMON and Kiva to pay his son's tuition fees. He hopes to be supported and waits for Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 55 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child still in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elma has been in this business for 20 years now, and she has borrowed four times from NWTF in the past to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a 40-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Isabel has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies.

Isabel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children, four of whom are currently in school.

Ginalyn is in the agricultural business; she fattens pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ginalyn has been in this business for two years now, and she has borrowed four times from NWTF in the past to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 58 years old, is widowed, and has six children.

Josefa is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josefa has been in this business for 20 years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Joselina

texts.en:
Joselina is a 48-year-old married woman with five children.

Joselina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Joselina has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Joselina aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.ru:
Сафия родилась в 1969 году. Она заботливая мать 2 детей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. У Сафия есть собственный бизнес.  Она растет и продает продукцию сельского хозяйства. Сафия имеет небольшую часть земли, где она растет помидоры, кукуруза  и другие овощи. Она сеет и собирает дважды в год и получает хороший урожай.
Она собирается выращивать другие виды овощей и предлагать их местных жителей. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить семена и минеральные удобрения для посева эти дополнительные сорта овощей. Сафия ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Safiya was born in 1969, and is a caring mother of two children. Her husband works abroad in Russia. Safiya has her own business; she grows and sells the produce of her farm. Safiya has a small plot of land, where she grows tomatoes, maize and other vegetables. She sows and harvests twice a year, and gets an abundant crop.
She is preparing to grow other types of vegetables and offer them to local residents. She is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for sowing these additional varieties of vegetables. Safiya awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy seeds for harvest and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are of all kinds.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of clothes. She hopes that, in the future, she will be prosperous.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fish-drying business in the Philippines.

Marjorie has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials for her fish-drying business.

Marjorie has been in this business for five years now, and she also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her fish-drying business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: prepare his new restaurant and buy tools and raw materials.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old married man who started a year ago using his pickup to sell vegetables and fruits to cover his needs and expenses. He is well known among his region and has his loyal customers who wait for him every day to buy from his vegetables and fruits. 

Ali is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying to develop his business. Today, he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with new summer fruits and vegetables to satisfy his customers' needs.

Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with new summer fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lolo  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  LOLO 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BINKO, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  HABY, 4éme personne debout de   la gauche     vers la   droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  175.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Lolo 1 Group are married women. On average, each member is 38 years old and has on average four children. They all live within polygamous family frameworks in Binko, one of the villages of Baya, the third administrative region of Mali. The group members are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so they can continue their agricultural activities during the winter season. This will be their fifth group loan. 

Haby (the woman standing fourth from the left in the photo) grows peanuts. With this loan, she plans on purchasing farming inputs and seeds, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, her produce will then be sold at market to a customer base made up of both retailers and consumers. Haby plans to make an average profit of 175,000 FCFA per season. These profits will allow her to pay back the loan and assist her husband with their family's daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, farming inputs and seeds

loans.name: Lolo  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  LOLO 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BINKO, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  FANTA, 2éme personne assise de   la gauche vers la   droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Lolo 2 Group are married women. On average, each member is 37 years old and has on average five children. They all live within polygamous family frameworks in Binko, one of the villages of Baya, the third administrative region of Mali. The group members are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so they can continue their agricultural activities during the winter season. This will be their fifth group loan.
Fanta (the second woman squatting to the right in the photo) grows peanuts. With this loan, she plans on purchasing farming inputs and seeds, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, her produce will then be sold at market to a customer base made up of both retailers and consumers. Haby plans to make an average profit of 150,000 FCFA per season. These profits will allow her to pay back the loan and assist her husband with their family's daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, farming inputs and seeds

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 53 years old and married with three children. Merlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, noodles, spices and etc.

Merlinda has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, noodles, and spices
